story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are Light Thieves. We are a group of dreamers that make music and wish to share it with you all. We have been writing music together for 5+ years and have enjoyed every moment of it. About a year ago, we had the pleasure of working with some great people out of Seattle, WA on a batch of songs that we wrote in a recycling center in Fresno, CA. 

  • The purpose of this event and what we're hoping for is to create a win-win situation for everyone. We are reaching out for your support in order to get our new album out to the masses but we also want to provide to you 2 evenings with some of our favorite bands out of our hometown in Fresno. 
  • This campaign is designed to provide you with 2 nights of music from some of our good friends and amazing musicians from around Fresno. The two shows that we bring to on December 9th and 23rd will be ALL AGES and FREE to the public! In turn, the contributions from the perks that we have listed for you will assist us having our album pressed to vinyl! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal we've set for this campaign is set at $1500. This, in addition to what we've been able to save as a band will help us in getting our album pressed to vinyl and packaged! 
  • The perks we've put together will provide you with some sweet deals at our New Saturnalia event! They include anything from wristbands that'll provide you with craft beer at a cheaper price (Tioga-Sequoia Brews), a poster of the event, a compilation of all the bands playing on the New Saturnalia event and some of our own Light Thieves swag as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It's really as simple as inviting your friends to the event, sharing this indiegogo campaign and joining us for 2 great nights of music!! Indiegogo provides some pretty awesome share tools to spread the word!

story:
The idea for this project began in 2006 when Johannes Müller and I met at the IASJ conference in Siena, Italy. Eight years later, I finally flew to Germany and joined Johannes for our first tour together along with Gautier Laurent, a French bass player, and Christian Pabst, a German pianist based in Amsterdam. The following year, I returned for a much more extensive tour with the band playing in Germany, Belgium, Luxembourg, and France. After two weeks of touring, we went into the studio and recorded our album, Samsara.

Recording a CD is quite expensive for the artist. The recording, mixing, and mastering phases of this album have already been completed and paid for out of my own pocket. However, the final phases of producing the physical CD, publicity, and travel costs are even more expensive, and I cannot do this on my own. It will cost over $8,000 to make this project a reality.

These last three phases of production, promotion, and travel are essential to the success of this project. My aim is to not only produce a physical copy of my artistic vision, but to expand my reach and opportunities around the world. Through the record label, Personality Records, which is based in Manheim, Germany, I have a publicist tasked at getting exposure to music publications, blogs, and radio stations throughout Europe. Finally, at the end of April, I will be traveling to Germany to play CD release shows with my quartet and to attend the Jazz Ahead Conference in Bremen, Germany. At Jazz Ahead, I will be able to talk to and shop my album to booking agents, promoters, and other musicians based in Europe.

I have 30 days to raise $8,000. If I do not reach my goal, then the money raised will be used to cover as many of the costs as possible. 

Please consider pre-ordering a copy of Samsara. I will also be offering many different perks if you wish to contribute more. Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help this campaign by spreading the word, and sharing with as many people as possible!

Ways you can help:

·       by emailing your friends and family about my campaign!

·       sharing on social networks such as Facebook and Twitter!

Thank you so much for your support! I can't wait to share Samsara with you!

Trevor Anderies

http://www.trevoranderies.com/ 

 

-----------------------------Please Scroll To Bottom To See All Perks--------------------------

 
 

Check out this version of the final cut on Samsara " A Stone I Died" with my Octet in Los Angeles!

 

My arrangement of Shenandoah with my Quintet

story:
Resumen

¡Saludos Familia! 

Me presento cordialmente, soy el cantautor Wally Martínez, directamente de mi pueblo montañoso de Corozal. Me dirijo a cada uno de ustedes porque en esta etapa de mi vida musical a de nacer mi 2da producción discográfica para el mes de junio 2017. Deseo extenderles una invitación personal para que sean parte de la misma mis amigos, familiares y seguidores.

La escena musical a sido parte de mi vida por los últimos 15 años aproximadamente y es una de esas cosas de las que no me arrepiento jamás. Conectar con el público es una de las pasiones más grandes que tengo la dicha de lograr en cada presentación. Para el 2013 tuve el honor de ver nacer mi primera producción con mi banda en ese entonces. Cuatro años después, me veo reflejado en mi guitarra con una nueva producción a realizar. En esta ocasión como solista…diseñando cada acorde y letra para lanzar “CALMA Y CAOS”, título que lleva la creación de este CD &DVD.

Este proyecto a sido parte del resumen de mi vida y otras grandes experiencias que amigos y no tan amigos me han contado y se han hecho canción. He crecido como solista en los últimos tres años, y con el apoyo, afecto, y el talento de varios amigos y colegas músicos, los 9 temas con los que cuenta esta producción serán música.

Estos temas ya están completando su fase de arreglos para comenzar los ensayos con la banda y finalmente llegar a Spectrum Recording Studios, del ingeniero Francisco “Kiko” Hurtado, a finales de junio, para plasmar de manera “LIVE SESSION” todos los temas. Quiero regalarles una obra tanto sonora como visual. Con una banda bien complementada, nuestro ingeniero “Kiko”, y la filmación visual a cargo de PRODUCCIONES SERRUCHO, obtendremos un producto digno para ustedes.

Solo les pido que me brinden la confianza, que crean en las posibilidades de este proyecto, y que cada uno aporte un poco, ya sea con tan solo compartir este mensaje, para ver realizado este sueño.

Aquí desgloso lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes por tu aportación

La meta es alcanzar $10,000.00 para costear lo siguientes gastos de pre producción, producción y post producción:

MÚSICOS:Director/Guitarrista, Bajista, Pianista, Baterista, 1 Guitarras rítmicas, 2 Coristas

SALÓN DE ENSAYOS

DIETAS MÚSICOS

ESTUDIO DE GRABACIÓN:

2 días de pre producción y producción

FILMACIÓN DEL VIDEO:

2 días  de pre producción y producción

EDICIÓN DE VIDEO PARA DVD

MEZCLA Y MASTERING

REPRODUCCIÓN DISCOGRÁFICA DE CD & DVD

CO-PRODUCTOR

MISCELÁNEOS

Con tu aportación estaremos ofreciendo uno de los siguientes intercambios:

$5 - Agradecimiento en la página por tu energía positiva!!!

$10 - Descarga del CD digital antes del lanzamiento oficial y el agradecimiento por tus buenas vibras!!!

$25 – “Poster”  conmemorativo del disco firmado. Descarga del CD digital antes del lanzamiento oficial

$40 - Recibes la copia física del CD/DVD dedicada y firmada, y la descarga digital de mis temas inéditos en el primer disco titulado FACTORES del año 2013.

$60 – Wally Martínez te prepara un video personalizado con tu tema favorito de este disco o el anterior. Además, recibes la copia física del CD/DVD dedicada y firmada, y la descarga digital de mis temas inéditos en el primer disco titulado FACTORES del año 2013.

$75 – “Poster” conmemorativo de la producción firmado por toda la banda. Recibes la copia física del CD/DVD dedicada y firmada, y la descarga digital de mis temas inéditos en el primer disco titulado FACTORES del año 2013.

$100 - Evento exclusivo en una locación de Wally Martínez en Corozal!!! Wow!!! Una noche de música íntima en una casa espectacular. Una sola presentación para todos los que den esta aportación. Más el “poster” conmemorativo del CD firmado. Recibirás la copia física del CD/DVD dedicada y firmada, y la descarga digital de mis temas inéditos en el primer disco titulado FACTORES del año 2013.

$500 - Wally te prepara una presentación acústica en la sala de tu casa para ti y tus invitados, además de 4 copias firmadas del disco, 4 “posters” conmemorativos firmados por la banda de la noche y la descarga digital pre-lanzamiento!!!

$1,000 - Wally presenta concierto en tu lugar de preferencia con su banda, además de 4 copias firmadas del disco, 4 “posters” conmemorativos firmados por la banda de la noche y la descarga digital pre-lanzamiento!!!

Ninguna aportación es pequeña. Desde un dólar! Recuerda compartirlo con tus amistades y familia. De poco a poco damos los pasos necesarios para alcanzar la meta. 

El impacto

Sus aportaciones darán pasos por un nuevo proyecto independiente para el deleite de nuevos temas. Contando con el apoyo de músicos respetados esta propuesta promete una entrega de sinceridad a través de la música sumándose  a la grandiosa aportación de la canción de autor en Puerto Rico.

Riesgos y desafíos

Siempre llega el CAOS en ocasiones pero la CALMA también se presenta cuando se trata de  construir el camino de nuestros proyectos…pero los que nos destaca es el deseo genuino de dejar plasmado esos acordes en tu camino.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que no todos cuentan con los recursos monetarios para apoyar esta campaña, pero con tan solo compartir este enlace con sus amigos y contactos puedes ayudar a llevar este proyecto a los oídos de muchos más. 

Estamos agradecidos por su solidaridad!

Un abrazo lleno de CALMA…sin olvidar que un poco de CAOS es necesario!

story:
Who Are We?

Founded in 2015, All of the Above (AOTA) is a Cincinnati-based contemporary music ensemble that has since been featured in the Constella Festival, Music for All National Festival, Giovanni Vecchi Concert Series, The Cincinnati Art Museum Muse Concert Series, and the Music in the Gorno Library Concert Series. In addition to regular appearances at Classical Revolution Cincinnati, All of the Above has also performed at various Galas sponsored by Ohio Cancer Research and CityLink Center.

AOTA was announced as the Ensemble-in-Residence at Xavier University beginning in the fall of 2016. The ensemble’s performances at the University have since been included in the Music Department Concert Series. AOTA has also been involved in various ensemble coachings, recruiting of future music majors, masterclasses, and side-by-side performances with Xavier University students.  AOTA has been a next:generation ensemble with concert:nova since 2015. As part of this partnership and mentorship program, members of AOTA have been given the opportunity to perform alongside concert:nova artists while also participating in workshops covering various topics including interactive performances, marketing, non-profit education, and improvisation. 

Recent commissions for AOTA involve collaborations with David Clay Mettens (Chicago), Allison Wright (Australia), Daniel Harrison (Cincinnati), and Sullivan Boecker (Cleveland). The ensemble’s upcoming engagements also include a recording project featuring the music of Douglas Knehans and Edward Smaldone on Ablaze records (Fall 2017).

What We Need & What You Get

We are going to be using these funds to pay for airfare to get to Europe as well as aid in final festival payments. Even if you can only donate a couple of dollars, it'll go a long way to meeting our goal. In return for support, we are going to be offering personalized "thank you's" from Italy, rehearsal insights, lessons, and even house concerts!

The Impact

This project is so important to us because it is our first opportunity to serve as an ensemble in residence at an international level. We feel that we have something really special to share with the new music community and believe this festival is going to help develop our creativity, artistry, and repertoire. One of the biggest benefits of serving as ensemble in residence is to provide young composers with an opportunity to realize their works in real time. We will get to see what weird sounds we like, which ones we hate, and create new works of music in real time. This is a big win-win for us and the composition fellows; they get to hone their craft, and we will bring back these living, breathing, works of art.

Any additional funding will go towards new commissions, future travel around the United States, and costs for establishing ourselves as a legal non-profit organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, it would mean the world to us if you shared this campaign with family, friends, coworkers, and other music lovers. We will be documenting our journey, rehearsals, and concerts throughout this process and will be sharing it all with you!

story:
DÉJÀ MORT à été formé en 2015. Nous jouons de la musique Metal-Hardcore en français. Sophie Coté au chant, J-P Marois à la guitare, JF Côté à la basse, Jean-Gab Labrie à la guitare et J-F Lepage à la batterie.

Cette page est pour nous aider à financer le projet de notre tout premier album de 12 chansons. L'album va être disponible en mars 2018 sur l'étiquette de disque PRC Music. Nous avons besoin de 2000$ pour réaliser notre projet de studio, production de t-shirts et autres.

 

Passez le mot et faite de la publicité pour notre projet !

Partagez afin de nous aider à réaliser ce projet !

story:
Help Support Decipha's Latest Videos.

Greetings everyone, my name is Decipha, I am a rapper based out of Chicago and this past October I dropped my EP entitled "Thirty."

What I am looking to do is raise support to shoot two music videos.

  1. One for a song on Thirty entitled "Coming Day" dealing with some the social issues we are facing today. 
  2. The other would go toward my new album due out after the new year entitled "Deo Volente."

What We Need & What You Get

  • I have already shot a the music video for "Coming Day" the cost for that video was $4,000, however we are also looking to shoot one more video costing us $2,400 within the same vain that encourages and even continues the conversation about the church's place in the world.
  • I am giving away free music, concert tickets, and t-shirts as well as a free download to the videos once they are complete.
  • I am teaming up with Golden Realm Productions who is helping me create high quality videos that I believe you will love to see.

The Impact

As many of you know, I am an independent artist meaning I have no label backing me and all of my work comes out of my own pocket. Therefore, the cost it takes to put out an album is more than just writing good lyrics, I spend most of my time thinking of unique ways to get it into your hands. 

  • This video project is geared to make people feel tension about what is happening in our cities across America. 
  • Some of us might already have some sense of the issues affecting our inner cities, however, it is often a trite step to tell someone living in an environment where it seems hopeless, that everything will be alright. Yet, what I am hoping these videos can do, is promote God's truth, that says, "indeed in Christ everything is absolutely All Right!"

The Back Story

Just like everything, this project costs, again I am asking for your support financially to fund these two projects and also that you share with others who would be interested in funding as well.

  • I wrote the song "Coming Day" after multiple videos surfaced showing unarmed black individuals being gunned down by police. I was thinking of individuals who had no idea they were a targets and are dead today because they appeared to be threats despite evidence pointing the fact that they were not. For people who instead of being labeled men and women first and foremost, they are being shot based on suspicion and the song is for the voices of those we haven't heard from who even today are fighting against a system that oppresses people of color. Who look to God and wonder is the best you have for me.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those that cannot contribute financially, I am simply asking for you to share this on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and with anyone else you think would want to know about what I am doing.

  • Help me get the word out, to make some noise about these projects.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks already for your support and prayers.
story_txt:
Help Support Decipha's Latest Videos.
Greetings everyone, my name is Decipha, I am a rapper based out of Chicago and this past October I dropped my EP entitled "Thirty."
What I am looking to do is raise support to shoot two music videos.

One for a song on Thirty entitled "Coming Day" dealing with some the social issues we are facing today. 
The other would go toward my new album due out after the new year entitled "Deo Volente."


What We Need & What You Get

I have already shot a the music video for "Coming Day" the cost for that video was $4,000, however we are also looking to shoot one more video costing us $2,400 within the same vain that encourages and even continues the conversation about the church's place in the world.
I am giving away free music, concert tickets, and t-shirts as well as a free download to the videos once they are complete.
I am teaming up with Golden Realm Productions who is helping me create high quality videos that I believe you will love to see.


The Impact
As many of you know, I am an independent artist meaning I have no label backing me and all of my work comes out of my own pocket. Therefore, the cost it takes to put out an album is more than just writing good lyrics, I spend most of my time thinking of unique ways to get it into your hands. 

This video project is geared to make people feel tension about what is happening in our cities across America. 
Some of us might already have some sense of the issues affecting our inner cities, however, it is often a trite step to tell someone living in an environment where it seems hopeless, that everything will be alright. Yet, what I am hoping these videos can do, is promote God's truth, that says, "indeed in Christ everything is absolutely All Right!"


The Back Story
Just like everything, this project costs, again I am asking for your support financially to fund these two projects and also that you share with others who would be interested in funding as well.
I wrote the song "Coming Day" after multiple videos surfaced showing unarmed black individuals being gunned down by police. I was thinking of individuals who had no idea they were a targets and are dead today because they appeared to be threats despite evidence pointing the fact that they were not. For people who instead of being labeled men and women first and foremost, they are being shot based on suspicion and the song is for the voices of those we haven't heard from who even today are fighting against a system that oppresses people of color. Who look to God and wonder is the best you have for me.

Other Ways You Can Help
For those that cannot contribute financially, I am simply asking for you to share this on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and with anyone else you think would want to know about what I am doing.

Help me get the word out, to make some noise about these projects.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks already for your support and prayers.

story:
HELP ME TO SHOW MY 2ND EP TO THE WORLD!

My name is Leah and I've been writing songs, singing, and playing guitar since I was 11. The other year, I had the privilege of releasing my very first EP to the world! However, at this point I didn't have the equipment to do it all myself, so I had the help of my vocal coach (which was still incredible). BUT, now I have all my own equipment and have been working for over a year on these songs for this EP so I really want to release it in a way which is meaningful and worth it! Your kind donations can help this!

What exactly will I do with your money?

Basically, to release music onto all the platforms and get physical copies made, it costs a lot of money. With this £500, I will be able to release my EP onto iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, GooglePlay and many other platforms! I will also be able to get 100 EP CDs made for you guys, with a booklet and artwork included!

 

If I don't reach the full £500, I will still use the amount I get to go towards all of this! I ONLY ORIGINALLY WANTED £300 BUT INDIEGOGO SAID A MINIMUM OF £500

PERKS AND PRIZES!

Depending on the amount you donate, you will be able to get something in return so that you don't feel like you're giving money for nothing! (And to express my gratitude for helping!) I'm still deciding on what exactly they will be, but it could include: a signed EP, handwritten lyrics, a gig whenever and wherever from myself and my guitar, all of these will also include a 'thank you' note specialised to you!!

Spread the word! (Please)

I understand some of you won't have the money to contribute, so if you don't then it would really mean a lot if you could just share my campaign to your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or just in person! (I believe you can use the Indiegogo sharing tools...)

If any of you have any queries, message me on:

Facebook- www.facebook.com/leahhaworthofficial

Twitter- @leah_haworth

Email- leah-haworth@hotmail.com

 

Maybe even subscribe to my YouTube too hehe- www.youtube.com/leahhaworth123

story:
GigGizmo™ is much more than the latest awesome and useful tool that will create a big buzz. It is the story of triumph for a young man, told he was not even qualified to stock shelves in a local store.

Cory Golden struggles with Asperger’s Syndrome, which is why he is not talking to you himself. At 22, he programs in 30+ programming languages and deals with the extreme stress of social interaction that is part of Asperger’s.

I am Cory’s mom, Ylice, a graphic artist and web designer who also manages live music promotion on social media. One day last fall, I reached a point of total frustration after tedious hours doing repetitive tasks to promote a small Aspen-area club. When I griped to Cory, “There should be an easier way to do my work – one program that could do all of this stuff,” in his usual matter of fact manner, he offered, “I can do that.” GigGizmo™ was born.

The What & Why of GigGizmo™

  • In the U.S. 2.24 million+ bars, nightclubs, restaurants and live music venues showcase nearly one million artists every week.
  • GigGizmo™ will revolutionize how musicians and venues promote – fast, intuitive and affordable. Ultra easy for anyone to use.
  • After a gig is booked, with a screen tap or mouse click it will:
    ♪ Schedule gigs.
    ♪ Update artist and venue calendars.
    ♪ Create instant online showbills for each performance.
    ♪ Announce shows on social networks.
    ♪ Share event data with the world.
    ♪ Remind followers of performances with automatic posts on a selected schedule.
    ♪ Fans can use integrated local mapping to find nearby entertainment, worldwide.
    ♪ Work on a phone, tablet or computer in Windows, OSX, Linux, iOS, and Android.
  • Planned pricing: $12.95 per month, making it accessible to everyone who needs it.
  • GigGizmo™ is web-based with no memory-hogging software to download.
  • Simple, sleek and fun to use, GigGizmo™ will meet the unique needs of local live music – saving the many hours of time that is now required to promote every show.

GigGizmo members schedule a gig simply by clicking on CREATE GIGS:

  1. Enter Venue/Band Name
  2. Pick a Date and Time for Show
  3. Click Submit

After a gig is scheduled: calendars update, a Gig Announcement immediately posts to the member’s social media networks – Facebook, Twitter, Google Events, Instagram, etc. Online showbills are created. Event data is shared with the world. Ongoing reminder posts are scheduled. If a band is posting, the venue owner is notified to confirm. When the venue owner visits GigGizmo, one mouse click or finger tap will post the event to their social media too! This is an ultra easy-to-use tool designed to pack houses.

Funding

As a single mother, it has been difficult to fund basic expenses while Cory developed the GigGizmo™ software. However, I believe in him and I want him to realize in this world we do not all have the same gifts, but we can use the gifts we do have to make a positive impact.

Now, GigGizmo™ is close to ready for beta release, where more users can test it before it launches commercially.

We need to raise a chunk of money to launch our product that fills a clear need for the LOCAL LIVE MUSIC industry. To share GigGizmo™ with the world, we need money to hire additional programmers, host the software, buy hardware, pay for launch marketing expenses and outsourced professional services (attorney, accountant) to establish a solid business foundation for GigGizmo™.

If you would like to be a beta user, that is a perk offered to some contribution levels. We would love for you to be an early member of the GigGizmo™ family.

All contributions will be deeply appreciated and, truly, no amount is too small.

We know the market for GigGizmo™ is huge and it can help local live music thrive. We plan to contribute part of our profits to help others with Asperger’s thrive as well.

Thank you for your support!

What some of GigGizmo™’s fans are saying...

Brilliant!!!!! Love it! ~ Suzanne Paris

Hats off to you! ~ Victoria Ackerman, GigDigest

Smart, very smart! ~ John Adams, The New Music Biz

Awesome! We all need help in the self promotion arena. Sometimes we forget we are a business, and this would make it so easy for everyone. Bravo...the price is affordable – even for musicians. ~ David Blair Harding, Aspen 440

What a fantastic idea! This will fly BIG TIME! ~ Joyce-Marie Morrin, Music Promotions Publicist

Check this cool thing out! ~ BJ Leiderman, Composer of NPR Theme Music

FAQs

Q: How is GigGizmo™ different from "insert Big Name Music site here"?
A: GigGizmo™ is a first-of-its-kind promotion tool – not a music site, nor a new twist on existing sites. This web-based application was created from the desire to find an easier way to promote local shows, so it caters to the needs of those in the local live music scene. The focus is not on who is packing an amphitheater 50 miles away, but on local talent playing at the brewpub two miles away.

Q: What makes you think there is a market for this?
A: A recent study found that 35% of all music goers reported seeing shows at bars and restaurants. In a universe where the music industry is estimated to generate $26 billion per year and the bar/restaurant industry also produces another $26 billion, there is a place where those two worlds mesh. That is precisely the place where 35% of live music lovers spend their time and money.

Another study found that most music goers get their show information from social media. More importantly, until now there were no promotional tools designed specifically to help those in the local live music industry reach their fans. In a $52 billion combined market, we know there is a viable opportunity for an intuitive tool that promotes local live music and makes it easy for fans to find local entertainment.

Q: Don't other sites offer these services?
A: Yes and no. Simply put, there is no one-stop-shop for this local live music niche. There are promotion tools available, however, they are scattered all over the place. Big music sites do offer some of the same services, but what and how they provide them varies. In the local live music industry, most of these sites have functionalities that are unneeded or simply not applicable. Moreover, getting pre-scheduled posts organized for multiple social media outlets requires the services of yet other providers. There is not a comprehensive product to handle the needs of local live music. In addition, accomplishing these tasks with available tools is time consuming and tedious work.

While there are currently helpful tools for each of task that GigGizmo™ streamlines, a piecemeal, kludged together approach is required with old tools. It takes time to figure out which parts fit, both logistically and financially. A person must evaluate and cobble together the offerings of multiple sites to come up with something that works. For a local band, or small nightclub, it is all trial and error – in budget, strategy and know-how – when trying to navigate all the different services. Unfortunately, even after hundreds of hours of work, the desired goal to get show scheduling, social media marketing, and online content publishing down to a manageable process is almost always unmet. That is a common experience. The average business spends 6 hours a week on social marketing alone. Everybody wants a faster, more efficient way to achieve their goals.

Q: What platforms does GigGizmo™ support?
A: GigGizmo™ works on all supported browsers for Windows, OSX, Linux, IOS, and Android. (Chrome 56.02+, Safari 10.03+, Firefox 51.01+, Opera 43.0.2+, etc)

Q: What is the membership cost?
A: GigGizmo™ ’s planned cost is $12.95 per month.

Q: When will GigGizmo™ go live?
A: We plan to be ready for beta-testing in late summer of 2017.

Q: Can I be a beta-tester GigGizmo™?
A: That's part of our contributor perks structure. We would love for you to be part of the original GigGizmo™ family.

For more details about the company, please visit our website.

Special thanks for their help and support to:

Andrew Contiguglia — The Contiguglia Law Firm, P.C.
Heather & Rene Lujan — Heather's Savory Pies, our inspiration
David Blair Harding & Amy Hawes — Aspen 440
Victoria Ackerman — GigDigest
Edward Brash — Glasgow Kiss
KK German
Lauren Walkiewicz
Rusty McNeely
Denise Drake
Kimberly — Just Kimberly
Joyce-Marie Morrin
Chris Golden
Petal Campbell
Tricia Lemoine
Hillary Maley
Carole Devine
Carl J Winters
Daniel Scorrano
Caroline Apple

story:
Valley Cat

Valley Cat is a performance venue, studio & lounge that was opened in 2015. We've expanded and grown so much in that time, overcoming every obstacle in the way. Currently, we're putting this campaign together to give the opportunity to get a ticket and extra perks for our most loyal supporters.

What We Need & What You Get

Contributing gets you a ticket in advance and more depending on what perk you choose. This helps us out with the ever growing list of expenses that we incur developing our brand in an expensive & highly competitive industry. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help out but can't afford to right now? Sharing this on your social media profile helps us out just as much. Thank you for everything!

story:
Summary

  • Hello! My name is Greg. I am an independent musician based in San Diego, CA. THANK YOU for being here. I've spent over 15 years building towards the release of this album. In that process, I've recorded two prior projects with songs that I've been proud of, but did not have the team or the structure in place to really execute the full vision as an independent musician. With the team on this album, we've spent the last few years focused on building a recording studio, writing, recording, and working towards this independent release of our best work yet.
  • YOU are a critical part of this team. This campaign brings us together to effectively create a record label. As a backer, you will help us to complete the recording process and distribute this music. 
  • These songs are for the adventurers and dreamers in all of us. It is also for those who are digging through the day-in and day-out efforts of life seeking to discover more about themselves and persevering in pursuit of dreams. The lyrics seek to inspire introspection on how we can become all we were made to be.
  • Contributors will help this to be the largest independent release of my career and cap off a project over 3 years in the making with a large team of San Diego-based artists.
  • Through this campaign, the goal is to connect more directly with listeners and other artists through unique perks not regularly available. This includes sharing more than just the music, but also the meanings behind songs and tools to help enable other artists to create their own music.   

The Team

This album has a core alternative rock sound. The songs also blend styles of blues, jazz, soul, and acoustic folk with some cinematic string arrangements and catchy melodies that use upbeat and mellow tempos. It's really diverse. Check out the 2nd video above to hear previews! To accomplish this album, there are some great musicians on these songs! It's been an honor to play with them.

  • Aaron Hall - Producer/Mixing
  • Ernie LeDuc - Bass
  • Roy Inzunza - Drums/Percussion
  • Tara Kester - Vocals
  • Anthony Bivens - Keys
  • Richard Samuels - Piano
  • Bernard Jones - Cello
  • Christina Inzunza - Vocals
  • Chad Whalbrink - Mixing
  • Evan Rodaniche - Mixing
  • Glenn Llorente - String Arrangements
  • Jered Lish - Violin
  • Ezekiel Gentle - Trumpet
  • Josias Miguel - Saxophone
  • Gregory Woodman - Photography
  • Kevin O'brien - Videography
  • Chris Graham - Mastering
  • Greg Kester - Production, Guitars, Vocals

What We Need & What You Get

Producing and releasing a record takes a lot of work and expense. We aim to complete this album and also make this process sustainable so we can put out more material in the future. Here it is in more detail:

What we need:

  • To pay session musicians, arrangers, mixing, and mastering engineers.
  • Recording equipment - We’ve slowly been building our own recording capability for years, but need to chip away in paying for equipment used to create the album. We've invested in our craft to create the vision we hear as professionally as we can while being independent artists.
  • Physical copies of the music, distribution, and digital services/marketing
  • To fund additional content to support the release of album, like production of music videos!

What you'll get:

  • You'll get the music (of course) before the official release date to the general public!
  • To be part of the excitement of an independent music release.
  • Unique perks! If you are a listener, you can get all of my music (not just this album), plus unreleased songs, and song meanings. Also, you have opportunities to connect and bundle content with unique experiences like personalized songs and private concerts.
  • If you are an artist and want to organize the creation and launch of your own music, there are some really awesome perks for you. I've spent tons of time working to be an "independent label". I would love to save you hours of time and effort and even have the chance to work with you in the studio.

The Impact - Why am I doing this?

  • For me, you will be supporting a 15+ year journey building towards the release of the biggest music project that I have dreamed of. Music means a lot to me and I feel its impact has value, both personally and collectively. I’ve had albums help define times of joy and sadness, rest and work, inspiration and action. I’ve had songs help me to process an experience, to relate to God and to others. Some music has helped me get “unstuck” from a rut, personally and creatively. I strongly believe there is something for everyone on this album—whether it be inspiration, enjoyment, comfort, conviction, or epiphany. My hope is that this music can impact those things for others. I also love getting inspired and supporting the "Dream it, Plan it, Do it" mentality with others and hope you do too. I want to support others in that by contributing my art and providing practical resources for others to do the same. 

Risks & Challenges

We've completed the earlier phases of the album creation, but there are still more critical steps for completing the album (like mastering), getting physical copies, distributing, and marketing. Independent artists rely on direct-to-fan support to make this happen.  

  • If we don't meet our goals, this release will be very limited (limited physical copies, no marketing, limited  music video content, etc) and heavily impact the ability to record and release follow-up material at the same level we've worked on this album.
  • The goal is that your support now provides the ability to completely fund this album and build a foundational fan base to create the next one. Perhaps even a small tour. To accomplish this, we need to hit our launch goals on this album.

Stretch Goals

  • If we hit $11,500 we can get some tee shirts printed up - which would be awesome! We have some designs in mind.
  • If we hit $14,000 we can also get a limited run of vinyl albums pressed - which would be epic! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We truly appreciate and value your support, but if you can't contribute, no worries! Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Get the word out on social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tell your friends in person—old fashioned word of mouth!

I am honored that you are here and hope that you enjoy the music!  Please check out the pledges and become a backer. The whole team who is working on this values your support.

Hello! My name is Greg. I am an independent musician based in San Diego, CA. THANK YOU for being here. I've spent over 15 years building towards the release of this album. In that process, I've recorded two prior projects with songs that I've been proud of, but did not have the team or the structure in place to really execute the full vision as an independent musician. With the team on this album, we've spent the last few years focused on building a recording studio, writing, recording, and working towards this independent release of our best work yet.

YOU are a critical part of this team. This campaign brings us together to effectively create a record label. As a backer, you will help us to complete the recording process and distribute this music. 
These songs are for the adventurers and dreamers in all of us. It is also for those who are digging through the day-in and day-out efforts of life seeking to discover more about themselves and persevering in pursuit of dreams. The lyrics seek to inspire introspection on how we can become all we were made to be.
Contributors will help this to be the largest independent release of my career and cap off a project over 3 years in the making with a large team of San Diego-based artists.
Through this campaign, the goal is to connect more directly with listeners and other artists through unique perks not regularly available. This includes sharing more than just the music, but also the meanings behind songs and tools to help enable other artists to create their own music.   

The Team
This album has a core alternative rock sound. The songs also blend styles of blues, jazz, soul, and acoustic folk with some cinematic string arrangements and catchy melodies that use upbeat and mellow tempos. It's really diverse. Check out the 2nd video above to hear previews! To accomplish this album, there are some great musicians on these songs! It's been an honor to play with them.

Aaron Hall - Producer/Mixing
Ernie LeDuc - Bass
Roy Inzunza - Drums/Percussion
Tara Kester - Vocals
Anthony Bivens - Keys
Richard Samuels - Piano
Bernard Jones - Cello
Christina Inzunza - Vocals
Chad Whalbrink - Mixing
Evan Rodaniche - Mixing
Glenn Llorente - String Arrangements
Jered Lish - Violin
Ezekiel Gentle - Trumpet
Josias Miguel - Saxophone
Gregory Woodman - Photography
Kevin O'brien - Videography
Chris Graham - Mastering
Greg Kester - Production, Guitars, Vocals


What We Need & What You Get
Producing and releasing a record takes a lot of work and expense. We aim to complete this album and also make this process sustainable so we can put out more material in the future. Here it is in more detail:
What we need:

To pay session musicians, arrangers, mixing, and mastering engineers.
Recording equipment - We’ve slowly been building our own recording capability for years, but need to chip away in paying for equipment used to create the album. We've invested in our craft to create the vision we hear as professionally as we can while being independent artists.
Physical copies of the music, distribution, and digital services/marketing
To fund additional content to support the release of album, like production of music videos!

What you'll get:

You'll get the music (of course) before the official release date to the general public!
To be part of the excitement of an independent music release.
Unique perks! If you are a listener, you can get all of my music (not just this album), plus unreleased songs, and song meanings. Also, you have opportunities to connect and bundle content with unique experiences like personalized songs and private concerts.
If you are an artist and want to organize the creation and launch of your own music, there are some really awesome perks for you. I've spent tons of time working to be an "independent label". I would love to save you hours of time and effort and even have the chance to work with you in the studio.


The Impact - Why am I doing this?
For me, you will be supporting a 15+ year journey building towards the release of the biggest music project that I have dreamed of. Music means a lot to me and I feel its impact has value, both personally and collectively. I’ve had albums help define times of joy and sadness, rest and work, inspiration and action. I’ve had songs help me to process an experience, to relate to God and to others. Some music has helped me get “unstuck” from a rut, personally and creatively. I strongly believe there is something for everyone on this album—whether it be inspiration, enjoyment, comfort, conviction, or epiphany. My hope is that this music can impact those things for others. I also love getting inspired and supporting the "Dream it, Plan it, Do it" mentality with others and hope you do too. I want to support others in that by contributing my art and providing practical resources for others to do the same. 

Risks & Challenges
We've completed the earlier phases of the album creation, but there are still more critical steps for completing the album (like mastering), getting physical copies, distributing, and marketing. Independent artists rely on direct-to-fan support to make this happen.  

If we don't meet our goals, this release will be very limited (limited physical copies, no marketing, limited  music video content, etc) and heavily impact the ability to record and release follow-up material at the same level we've worked on this album.
The goal is that your support now provides the ability to completely fund this album and build a foundational fan base to create the next one. Perhaps even a small tour. To accomplish this, we need to hit our launch goals on this album.


Stretch Goals

If we hit $11,500 we can get some tee shirts printed up - which would be awesome! We have some designs in mind.
If we hit $14,000 we can also get a limited run of vinyl albums pressed - which would be epic! 

Other Ways You Can Help
We truly appreciate and value your support, but if you can't contribute, no worries! Here are some other ways you can help:

Get the word out on social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.
Tell your friends in person—old fashioned word of mouth!

I am honored that you are here and hope that you enjoy the music!  Please check out the pledges and become a backer. The whole team who is working on this values your support.

story:
A Letter from Garrison Evans

Hello friends, family, and music supporters!

My name is Garrison Evans and I'm an electronic indie-pop singer/songwriter from Englewood, CO currently studying at Berklee College of Music. My fascination for the creative arts has always been evident. Listening to music was one thing, but creating it and feeling it come out of me was a completely different sensation. Music was always a support system for me and I knew that there would be people out there going through the same struggles as I am, and that the predominant way I got through it was through music. I want to tell the stories that are reluctant to be told. I want my music to be an abstract medicine. I want those who listen to know that they're not alone in their experiences. I want to make people think and analyze the world around them and eventually find solace and catharsis.

I have had the amazing opportunity to be surrounded by inspirational and motivational people that have encouraged me to create and release my first EP. With that, I created an amazing team to help me with this project. I hired an amazing manager, Caroline Carlson, an extremely talented producer, Matt Browning, and some amazing instrumentalists. These people have contributed so much of their time to help with the vision of the EP.

Exposing my art creates a rush inside of me and I have a gut feeling that my hard work is going to pay off no matter how big or small the audience is. I’m not making music to show off my voice or to go from rags to riches. I’m making music to tell stories that so desperately need to be told. I get to relate, connect, and heal others the way that music has healed me, and that feeling is truly amazing. By donating, you can help me reward the amazing producer I have on board and help me reach this goal I've had for as long as I can remember.

How Your Donation Can Help

Making an EP is not cheap if you want it to reach it's full potential. Recording an EP requires many vital steps: production, mixing, mastering, instrumentalists, etc. I found an amazing producer to help bring my artistic vision to life, and they deserve to be compensated for their hard work. We've been hard at work in the studio all summer perfecting each song for this record. If we reach our goal, the majority of the money will go towards his production, mixing, and mastering. 

Along with the production of the EP, there are also a few other aspects that we would like to invest in. This EP is set to release before the year ends, and there are a few processes we have to go through in order to make that happen. These include registering each song for copyright, distribution, and merchandise. Any exceeding funds will go towards those three processes and the future of my music. Creating a fundraising campaign was a great way for me to share my music and artistic vision, and I hope you consider donating!

 

What You Get

Your contribution to this project is extremely meaningful to me and I cannot thank you enough if you donate, and your generosity will not go unnoticed. Listed on the right are the gifts I'd like to offer you for donating. Each donation amount comes with a "Perk." Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and thank you so much for donating! Please share this campaign if you get the chance to. You're all amazing!

story:
What's this all about?

I can't thank you enough for your interest in my new release, Shades of Blue. Your time and consideration really does make all of this mean something. For those who don't know me, I'm an acoustic singer-songwriter from Saugerties, NY. I've been writing songs since I was ten years old and have never strayed, and never really wanted to do anything else.  I've always wanted to be able to share my perspective with people, and music is how I do that best. This album is a really transparent commentary on aspects of my life over the past two years, of up's and down's that I believe are relatable since we're all connected in this life.  My goal is to try and make you feel that for a moment.

This album process began last year. I went into the studio with eight songs, for eight days, and came out with three—that still were a ways away from being finished... a crazy, daunting, learning experience for me. During those eight days, I saw how much I had to learn and readjusted my strategy. Being completely tapped of energy, and money, I realized I needed to go deeper into music in every way and partnered up with the very talented Ayla Rector. So, we started an LLC called Nightcap Entertainment. Our focus is on all aspects of the music industry for myself and other independent, original artists. I  worked two jobs and gigged while rewriting the album to get back to the studio, while Ayla took care of the bookings, filming, and management—I love her for staying by my side even though I get myself into crazy debt, and sticky situations at times—but we really do love what we're doing.

The news of my engineer, Dave, moving across the country seemed like a hitch at the time. He accepted the position of Head Engineer at the revitalized, legendary recording studio: Sound City in LA. At first I was afraid I'd have to find a replacement, until he convinced me otherwise. Next thing I knew I was in LA recording vocals in studio A. Dave and I have been making music together for nearly 8 years now and I believe Shades Of Blue is our best sounding record to date. 

Studio days are long. For Dave and I they last fourteen hours on average. Dave is a machine and I do my best to keep up—until I inevitably just, stare at walls. The final night of the recording session we mixed until our ears went silent and packed up for the six AM flight back home. I couldn't tell if the music was good anymore. And there was no time to relax; after a day of sleep it was right back to work. 

In retrospect, it's amazing to me how much time, money, and love I've spent on this album. What is not amazing is how hard I believe in good audio, thoughtful lyrics, and passionate musicians. This album is a product of all of that. I'm so grateful for this process and everyone who was a part of it. Especially you, thank you—more than I can express here—for your contribution. 

Hope Rocks Festival Fundraiser

One of our main focuses in our business, Nightcap Entertainment LLC, is local community. I've put together a fundraiser for Hope Rocks music festival, founded by Joe Defino. Hope Rocks is about raising awareness for addiction and how a community can help bring new life to each other. I myself am over a year sober and these kinds of festivals mean a lot to me. Joe puts on most of these festivals out of pocket. Any contribution will help to ensure that these initiatives continue as annual events. Thank you again.

Are there perks?

So, this is a pre-order, which means any monetary support you give, you'll get back in product form. Everything is already made, or in the process as we speak—it's just waiting for the right home. I really wanted to show my investment by producing the album and the merch before I did any fundraising. I don't believe in talking about something before it has come to fruition.

 

There are some really cool pre-order options. I'm excited to see what you're into. I tried to create an option for everyone. There are some weird options, in-between options, some basic options, and some extreme options... for the risk takers like myself! Every option is awesome in my mind, anything you guys want to invest in is the best.

You contributing to this pre-order means:

  • another album
  • more shows
  • the legitimization of an independent artist
  • If I reach my goal, you are supporting a bigger picture idea. One that believes in independent artists making their own way.

The Impact

This album is the first big step up for me. Good quality audio and content, is the only resume a musician has. The music world isn't a career, it is a way of life, and it takes everything to succeed. The good thing is you can distribute an album, and that is where the recognition comes in. You matter the most in the music industry. You are the ones getting the passion out there. I hope to help fuel myself through a successful campaign, so I can in turn, help others do the same. I just want to see musicians I believe in succeed. Because the music industry is so capitalized, there is no breathing room for independent musicians. They need support, just like I do. 

Risks & Challenges

All pre-orders placed, will be fulfilled by me. I will be sending out a big one-time order of products. The day after the campaign ends is going to be crazy for me, but I'll do my best to get everything to you as soon as humanly possible. Please allow for a week of flex time, after the campaign ends, before you receive your perks. 

This is the first time I'm doing this, so it's all new to me. Always feel free to reach out with requests, or questions. I'm really hoping to make a successful model for the future, and any input from you is very valuable. Please visit my website: www.ianflaniganmusic.com and shoot me an email ianflaniganbooking@gmail.com (also be sure to subscribe). 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you're contributing or not, there are so many ways you can continue to support, and I appreciate all of them. 

  1. Stay connected. Subscribe to my email list via my website: www.ianflaniganmusic.com and follow me on social media:                                         https://www.facebook.com/ianflaniganmusic/          https://www.instagram.com/ian_flanigan/                           https://soundcloud.com/ianflanigan https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiaqXpF26TzQPHJdLPxQJIg https://www.sonicbids.com/band/ian-flanigan/ https://ianflanigan.bandcamp.com/releases Also stay connected to your local community and help in any way you can!
  2.  Share and cross promote my campaign, and the Hope Rocks fundraiser. There is a lot of good stuff here: fundraising for a two-day artists driven festival that creates community support for addiction, an independent artist advocating for success, quality musicians collaborating to make an original project, and community coming together to make it happen. If you can get behind these awesome things, here is your chance to promote your passion.
  3. Spread the word about the CD release parties, and purchase a pre-sale ticket. August 12th, 2017 (119 Main St., Saugerties NY) and August 18th, 2017 (The Falcon, Marlborough NY). Fundraising for Hope Rocks will continue as a raffle at both events, there will be good food and drink available, and most of all full band performances that'll make your night! 
  4. Leave me feedback. I need reviews and feedback from you to continue to cultivate my product. Please follow the link to my short survey. https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/3JCBMTK This is a great, free way, to support my campaign.

story:
If you know Rob Young, then you know, he is no rookie to music or the stage. He has shared the stage with the likes of Lupe Fiasco, Twista, Martin Luther and other Grammy Award Winning artists. He was featured on the 20th anniversary album for the Grammy Award winning group, All-4-One and has performed in front of over 20,000 people at a major NFL game. Rob Young also boasts songwriting credit with some of the industry's most sought after songwriters. Over the course of the last few years, he has gained outstanding performance & songwriting experience and put his creativity (and impeccable ear!) to work with his self-taught production skills!  In this time, he has now developed an exceptional team to dive into his own career!

I have built a crew of killer producers, writers, musicians and industry professionals. Everything is in place for an INCREDIBLE musical launch!

If you love Hip Hop with a message, music that keeps you moving-- I have what you are looking for. The next project will be hard hitting with conscious lyrics over heavy bass and electric sounds. It has always been my personal mission to speak stories of humanity and freedom, that inspire and motivate. My story is our story! This is a chance to be a part of something masterful!

I would love your support in creating the official next project. You will make it possible for me to create a fresh sound, an entirely new movement!  This project will lay the foundation for a tour and performances near you! 

Why is your support so important?

Many of you have supported in the past; with your help, we have made great opportunities extraordinary! You have made it possible for me to perform with the likes of Lupe Fiasco and engage audiences with a small tour!  This time, I am leaping into a full on project-- from scratch-- scheduling performances, and the stretched vision is to secure a publicist, manager and agent. 

Here is the plan:

First- I will give all I have to the writing of the songs. I will hide away in the studio and produce tracks and music that tell powerful stories.

 

Second- I will take these songs to my amazing team; we will fine tune them, get our musicians to play parts over the track for an authentic sound, have the music professionally produced and collaborate with other writers for an amazing piece of work.

 

Third- we will touch-up each song, mix them down and master them. During this time I will be arranging the album artwork, merchandise and printing arrangements.

Then I will send everything off for release and debut the project at (Details Soon To Come)

The long term plan is to take this project and a Press Kit and get it into the hands of industry professionals to schedule tours, book gigs, rock festivals and maybe even boast a successful independent artist career (that's right.)!!!!

I ask for your support because I am willing to do the work, sweat for this and give it all I have.  But, I need some help. Believe it or not, launching a music career can get quite expensive. Your donations and seeds of love will help pay for studio time, producer fees, mixing, mastering, merchandise, album art/production, digital release fees and some marketing of the next project “Dream Roots" and performance expenses (though most of this will be coming out of my pocket). 

So, choose what level of sponsorship you are happy with and enjoy the perks!

I appreciate you and am excited for what we can create together! 

With Love 

Rob Young 

Rob Young Bio:

Born to a man who owned the largest African Art Museum in the Northwest covering Africans from the diaspora, Robert Walker started penning rhymes at an early age balancing basketball, teenage lessons and music. Often tagging with his father's one man shows as an African beat drummer and revered poet, Rob Young begin to gain an appreciation for entertaining and lyrical genius along with developing his own style.

 Rob Young has an uncanny ability to tap into his creative genetics developing a style appreciated by the mainstream arena. Saturating Portland with his charms in his commanding 6'3 frame, Rob young begin to dazzle audiences with his vibrant stage presence and canning ability to win the hearts of his fans.

From the North West to Bay Area, over the years Rob Young has built his reputation and brand as being a seasoned performer, captivating audiences from hosting events and fashions shows to opening for Hip Hop legends any where from the likes of Bay Area's The Jacka, Pep Love and Rapping 4-Tay to Chicago's greats Twista and Lupe Fiasco. He has also been featured on the Grammy award winning All-4-One "Twenty +" with smash record "Who Do You Love"  ​

It does not take a genius to see that Rob Young's passion on and offstage is one that will make the most skeptical a believer. So, brace yourself Hip Hop world and join the voyage with the genre's next level. and note it is never to late to enjoy the Rob Young experience.  

 

Delious Kennedy - Grammy Award Winning Artist (All-4-One) -

Artist Consultant

Delious Kennedy  is a member of  Grammy Award winning group All-4-One. Dubbed the "Dukes of R&B" All-4-One's hit "I Swear" won a Grammy Award in 1995 for Best Pop Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal and enjoyed an eleven-week run at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and a seven-week run at No. 2 in the UK Singles Chart. It has been named by ASCAP as one of the greatest love songs of the 20th Century.

Delious Kennedy is the co-founder of the esteemed Catalina Film Festival, known as the west coast's version of Cannes Film Festival.[8] The Catalina Film Festival is a destination festival located just off the coast of Los Angeles on Santa Catalina Island, California.

In 2016 Delious launched his talk show Flashback Tonight which interviews all your favorite celebrities from the 80's, 90's and early 00's. Guests have included Rick Springfield, Taylor Dayne, Marla Gibbs, & Coolio to name a few. Past episodes can be viewed at www.flashbacktonight.com.[9]

In 2012, Kennedy released a single he co-wrote entitled "My Rose" which peaked at No. 44 on Billboard's Hot Dance/Club charts. The song was done as a favor to Michael Lohan, father of Lindsay Lohan, and was supposed to mark her return to the spotlight. After being released from rehab, Lindsay Lohan was involved in a shoplifting incident involving a necklace. Due to the negative press, Kennedy decided to postpone the release of the single in 2011 and released it in 2012 without the Lohans' involvement.


Lalo Davis- Five Stone Entertainment

Lalo Davis, under the name Five Stone, has specialized in instrumental music for sports television and extreme sports events.  He was the Music Supervisor for two national sports leagues where he composed highlights music, sound effects, theme songs, and background music bed for each game.  His music has been heard on the show Empire on Fox, as well as various programs on the NFL Network, X Games, NBC Sports, MTV2, Fox Sports, and others.  Lalo is now collaborating with MCs, vocalists, and songwriters, aiming to help each write their "best" song.  He believes music is the single most powerful catalyst for creating emotional connection and effective communication.  His website is www.fivestone.net

 

J WELLS- Production

Born in the Bay Area  and now residing in Los Angeles,  Jeremy "J Wells" Wells  grew up with Hip Hop in his blood. Being from the California area he has had the pleasure to work  with artists such as E-40, Too-Short, Baby Bash, Paul Wall Etc. Currently he is making conent and music for the 2 X Champions Golden State Warriors through his Media Company. J Wells expertise doesn't stop with Hip Hop he also produces across genres from Rock, Country and into Jazz! With a seasoned ear and major experience we are happy he is apart of the team! 

 

THE SOON ISN'T SOON ENOUGH POSTER 

FOREVER ISN'T LONG ENOUGH T-SHIRT &  POSTER 

 

SUBSCRIBE AT 

Robyoungmusic.com

Instagram.com/robyoungmusic

Facebook.com/robyoungmusic
story_txt: If you know Rob Young, then you know, he is no rookie to music or the stage. He has shared the stage with the likes of Lupe Fiasco, Twista, Martin Luther and other Grammy Award Winning artists. He was featured on the 20th anniversary album for the Grammy Award winning group, All-4-One and has performed in front of over 20,000 people at a major NFL game. Rob Young also boasts songwriting credit with some of the industry's most sought after songwriters. Over the course of the last few years, he has gained outstanding performance & songwriting experience and put his creativity (and impeccable ear!) to work with his self-taught production skills!  In this time, he has now developed an exceptional team to dive into his own career!I have built a crew of killer producers, writers, musicians and industry professionals. Everything is in place for an INCREDIBLE musical launch!If you love Hip Hop with a message, music that keeps you moving-- I have what you are looking for. The next project will be hard hitting with conscious lyrics over heavy bass and electric sounds. It has always been my personal mission to speak stories of humanity and freedom, that inspire and motivate. My story is our story! This is a chance to be a part of something masterful!I would love your support in creating the official next project. You will make it possible for me to create a fresh sound, an entirely new movement!  This project will lay the foundation for a tour and performances near you! Why is your support so important?Many of you have supported in the past; with your help, we have made great opportunities extraordinary! You have made it possible for me to perform with the likes of Lupe Fiasco and engage audiences with a small tour!  This time, I am leaping into a full on project-- from scratch-- scheduling performances, and the stretched vision is to secure a publicist, manager and agent. Here is the plan:First- I will give all I have to the writing of the songs. I will hide away in the studio and produce tracks and music that tell powerful stories. Second- I will take these songs to my amazing team; we will fine tune them, get our musicians to play parts over the track for an authentic sound, have the music professionally produced and collaborate with other writers for an amazing piece of work. Third- we will touch-up each song, mix them down and master them. During this time I will be arranging the album artwork, merchandise and printing arrangements.Then I will send everything off for release and debut the project at (Details Soon To Come)The long term plan is to take this project and a Press Kit and get it into the hands of industry professionals to schedule tours, book gigs, rock festivals and maybe even boast a successful independent artist career (that's right.)!!!!I ask for your support because I am willing to do the work, sweat for this and give it all I have.  But, I need some help. Believe it or not, launching a music career can get quite expensive. Your donations and seeds of love will help pay for studio time, producer fees, mixing, mastering, merchandise, album art/production, digital release fees and some marketing of the next project “Dream Roots" and performance expenses (though most of this will be coming out of my pocket). So, choose what level of sponsorship you are happy with and enjoy the perks!I appreciate you and am excited for what we can create together! With Love Rob Young Rob Young Bio:Born to a man who owned the largest African Art Museum in the Northwest covering Africans from the diaspora, Robert Walker started penning rhymes at an early age balancing basketball, teenage lessons and music. Often tagging with his father's one man shows as an African beat drummer and revered poet, Rob Young begin to gain an appreciation for entertaining and lyrical genius along with developing his own style. Rob Young has an uncanny ability to tap into his creative genetics developing a style appreciated by the mainstream arena. Saturating Portland with his charms in his commanding 6'3 frame, Rob young begin to dazzle audiences with his vibrant stage presence and canning ability to win the hearts of his fans.From the North West to Bay Area, over the years Rob Young has built his reputation and brand as being a seasoned performer, captivating audiences from hosting events and fashions shows to opening for Hip Hop legends any where from the likes of Bay Area's The Jacka, Pep Love and Rapping 4-Tay to Chicago's greats Twista and Lupe Fiasco. story:
Our Story

We are the Smokin' Armadillos.  Six guys from Bakersfield, California with a quirky name, a little musical talent, and a great deal of passion for making music together.  

It started for us after high school (and during high school for one of us), when we stepped into a local recording studio with 5 songs and $3,000 to make a CD to sell at our shows.  Before long, things took off and we sold over 150,000 copies of our first EP.  Within two years of our first show, we signed a record deal with a major label out of Nashville, and hit the road.  We saw hundreds of thousands of you around the country, and had a great time making music, recording and performing.  But all things must come to an end, and as life happened, we eventually closed our doors and went home to raise our kids, pursue new ventures and get real jobs.   

Fast forward a few years, and the six of us get together one night for dinner, to have a few laughs, share some memories and somehow, start the wheels turning again.  Wouldn't it be fun to do one more show? Maybe write a few new songs?  Maybe even record a couple?  But what if we could do a little more...just for fun?

So that brings us to what we're doing today.  We've spent the last couple of years writing and recording what we believe is the best stuff we've ever done.  Now I'm sure every band thinks their latest stuff is the best stuff they've ever done, but ours actually is...no really.  Well, whether it is or not, we think it's pretty good and we want people out there to have a chance to hear it.  We have a new single ready to hit radio starting September 25, and it's a song called The Other California.  We managed to record and mix all of this project on our own, but getting it to radio, and getting them to play it, is a whole different monster.  That's where you come in. We figured since you guys were the legs that carried our music before (you are a force to be reckoned with!), why reinvent the wheel?

So what's the goal here and how does it effect you?  Let's be honest...we don't need a record deal (been there, done that), we don't need fame and fortune.  We love making music together and we love getting to share it.  We love and miss the interaction we got to have with all of you over the years, and well, we're just not ready to give it up quite yet.  What we want is a chance to share our music with as many people around the country, and the world, as we can.  Every dime you donate will go to promoting that music, whether through radio promoters, social media, videos, and whatever else we can find.  And we have what we think is some pretty cool stuff to give you just for being a part of it.

How will we spend your money?  At the minimum ($4,500), we will use it to pay for startup costs, the mastering and production of CD singles, and distributing that to radio stations around the country.  If we raise more ($8,500 to $12,500), we will hire secondary market promoters that push for airplay in smaller markets around the country.  If we raise more than that ($18,000 to $30,000), we will hire promoters to work the larger markets around the country.  If we raise more than that (????), the push gets bigger until we have every country station in the U.S. playing it, or we die trying!  If there is enough success, there will be a second single and we'll use any left over money to start the promotion for it after the first one is done...we've already got it recorded.  In fact, we've got an album full of songs recorded that we will be releasing one or two at a time over the next year if you want to hear them.

So at very least, we hope you join us and spread the word, throw in a few dollars and get yourself a nice little Armadillo something or other, and enjoy the new music we've been working on for the last few years.  We can't promise a number one, or airplay in every station in the country, but stranger things have happened.  We can guarantee that we will release a new single shortly, and we promise it's going to be a good time getting it out!

Thanks so much and lots of love!!!

 - Rick, Darrin, Scott, Jason, Aaron and Josh...The Smokin' Armadillos

story:
Listen to the new album here: https://soundcloud.com/jaketavill/sets/twisted-...

     Jake Tavill is a soulful, NYC/NJ based indie rock artist that just released his sophomore album Twisted Ideology on June 23rd. By blending his emotional, honest songwriting with a production style akin to the legendary Parliament Funkadelic, Jake has created a sound that is both unique to him and fits right at home in both the indie and mainstream sonic spheres.

     After the release of his first album, Indigo Child, Jake has been both studying at NYU Tisch’s Clive Davis Institute and playing all over the US with his backing band, The Indigo Child Blues Band, including at CMJ Music Marathon, Mondo.NYC, The NAMM Show, Launch Music Festival, and PA’s Musikfest. Twisted Ideology represents the cumulative product of these numerous opportunities for musical experimentation.

     The seven-song album was marked with an NYC release concert prior to the release date at Carroll Place on June 13th, but now Jake will be following up the release with a S.E. US tour with shows in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Washington D.C., Virginia, and Tennessee. Along with stops in Georgia, North Carolina, and Maryland. 

     In order to cover transportation and lodging costs, as well as helping to offset missed work for band members, Jake and the band are offering a ton of different perks, including signed CDs, t-shirts, VIP experiences, signed instruments, and more!

Confirmed Tour Schedule:

7/8 - NYC - Connolly's Klub 45 

7/11 - D.C. - Rooftop Show 

7/15 - Nashville, TN - Two Old Hippies

7/18 - Richmond, VA - The Tin Pan

7/20 - Philly - Ortlieb's

8/1 - NYC - Carroll Place

8/5 - Cape May, NJ - Cape May Craft Beer and Crab Fest

**More Shows To Be Announced!

story:
My Story

I am pretty much a tornado of emotions, and half the time you can bet I am not completely sure what is going on, considering I am always sort of slipping off into my own little world. Singing has always been my favorite thing in the universe to do, with or without an audience; but when I was seven years old, I sang a song from The Pokémon Movie in the school talent show, and I have fallen in love with performing ever since. I got my first electric guitar when I was ten, and pretty much made a wild cacophony with it until I finally got an acoustic guitar, took a few lessons, and began writing comprehensive songs when I was about thirteen. Thanks to so many amazing opportunities and wonderful experiences, music has remained the fulcrum of my life.

My biggest dream in life is to create music that is not only enjoyable to listen to, but tells a story that helps people feel less aloof, more enmeshed in our shared human experience. Indeed, my favorite thing about music is this facet: that my mood can be weird or sad or happy, in the strangest sort of way, and yet often it's seemingly effortless to find a song that easily relates unlike anything else. Some of my closest friends are characters--in songs, books, and movies--and, in my own music, I strive to create a safe space for people to hang with their understanding, fictional comrades. 

The support I've had from the community already--my friends, family, and fans--is so overwhelmingly wonderful. Thanks for helping keep the rock-n-roll dream alive!

story:
Sacred Music Sessions Vol. 1

The award winning Eric Byrd Trio returned to the studio in the summer of 2017 to record their most ambitious project to date.  In a career that has spanned a Jazz Ambassadorship, numerous international tours including a 2017 trip to Chile, playing to thousands of fans in concert venues all over the world, the EBT recorded a program of music that marries their spiritual side with their musical side in a way that's never been done before.  

This new CD will contain original arrangements of Negro Spirituals, Hymns and Gospel music.  Titles include "Blessed Assurance", "Ain-a That Good News", "Joshua Fit The Battle of Jericho" and more.  Grammy winning trumpeter Terell Stafford and 2015's Jazz Saxophonist of the Year Tim Warfield appear on several tracks!  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $2,500.00 to make this dream come true
  • Autographed  CD's, private concerts, a holiday/Christmas concert, concert tickets, and more!
  • Every dollar raised will go toward recording costs - every dollar

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Send this to people in your networks
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Go to http://www.ericbyrdtrio.com and sign up for our mailing list - we'll let you know when the CD is released and where you can see us play the music

story:
"Written in the Parking Lot"

This project is about releasing some of the best songs I have ever written. Songs about real life, struggles, battles, love, and loss. Since the release of my last album, I have had a multitude of life experiences that I have put to song. From Addiction to loss, it's in there. I have poured my heart out on this album and I know you will find a message that you can relate to in these songs. This album is for all the people that have supported me over the years.  I am looking for you all to be a part of the album.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the scoop

  • Looking to raise $3500 for the album. Most of the cost will go to recording and production of the album. Pressing 150 CD's to start, and publishing to online resources (Spotify, Itunes). 
  • There will be a reward for your donations! I have everything from a private in-house show,  to pre-ordering of the CD. Take a look at the Perks section for all the options available. There is something for everyone.  

The Impact

This album is the follow up to my 2014 album, "Living the Dream". After the release of that album my career started to take off. I was playing 200+ dates a year. (THANK YOU TO ALL THAT SUPPORTED ME!!) But I was not writing like I used to and was drinking a lot. Fast forward a couple years, I got sober and music started to flow with me again. The quality of the songs are light-years from where I was in 2014 and I can't wait to share them with you.

  • This project is a personal journey through the past few years. 
  • I released my last album on time and within budget and am hoping to do the same with this one. 
  • I need you to help me make this a reality!! 

Risks & Challenges

As with all projects, there are risks. If this does not fund, the release date may be delayed. The songs, however, are almost ready to record-  together let's make this a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help: If you can't donate please spread the word.

  • Share it out on social media 
  • Tell a friend 
  • Volunteer to help get the word out  

Thank you for reading this. I know we will make a great team!! 

Thank you,

Terry Douglas
