Here is the scoop

Looking to raise $3500 for the album. Most of the cost will go to recording and production of the album. Pressing 150 CD's to start, and publishing to online resources (Spotify, Itunes). 
There will be a reward for your donations! I have everything from a private in-house show,  to pre-ordering of the CD. Take a look at the Perks section for all the options available. There is something for everyone.  


The Impact
This album is the follow up to my 2014 album, "Living the Dream". After the release of that album my career started to take off. I was playing 200+ dates a year. (THANK YOU TO ALL THAT SUPPORTED ME!!) But I was not writing like I used to and was drinking a lot. Fast forward a couple years, I got sober and music started to flow with me again. The quality of the songs are light-years from where I was in 2014 and I can't wait to share them with you.

This project is a personal journey through the past few years. 
I released my last album on time and within budget and am hoping to do the same with this one. 
I need you to help me make this a reality!! 


Risks & Challenges
As with all projects, there are risks. If this does not fund, the release date may be delayed. The songs, however, are almost ready to record-  together let's make this a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help: If you can't donate please spread the word.

Share it out on social media 
Tell a friend 
Volunteer to help get the word out  

Thank you for reading this. I know we will make a great team!! Thank you,Terry Douglas

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hyeseon Hong and I’m a composer from Seoul, South Korea. I’m launching this campaign to raise money for the final stages of my recording project entitled “Ee-Ya-Gi” which is a Korean word that means “Stories”.  Your support will have an enormous impact on this project, ensuring that it will come to life and be heard by as many people as possible.  Your contribution to this music will take me one step close to achieving my dream. I sincerely thank you for taking the time to learn about my stories.

안녕하세요. 
홍혜선 재즈 오케스트라로 뉴욕에서 연주 활동을 하고 있는 작곡자 홍혜선입니다.
곧, 제  일곱곡을 실은 앨범 "이야기"(Ee Ya Gi )가 출시될 예정입니다.
제 음악은 한국의 리듬(장단)과 정서, 클래식 음악과 합창곡들의 영향을 받았으며, 이 앨범을 위해 뉴욕 최고의 연주자들과 특히, 세계적인 색소폰 주자 리치 페리와 트럼펫 주자 잉그리드 젠슨이 앨범녹음에 참여했습니다.
연세대 졸업과 뉴욕 유학후, 홍혜선 앙상블로 뉴욕에서의 활동을 시작했습니다.                                                              귀국후,국내에서의 몇년을 대학에서 후배양성과 홍혜선 앙상블, 홍혜선콰이어를 통하여 작곡자와 편곡자로 활발히 활동하던중,  저의 궁국적인 꿈인 재즈오케스트라로의 활동을 위해 뉴욕으로 돌아와 밴드의 리더와 작곡자로서의 career를 쌓아나가고 있습니다
재즈 앨범 제작과 판매의 후원들이 척박한가운데서도 새로운 음악에로의 아티스트들의 도전은 계속 되듯이 저의 도전도 계속 될 것입니다.
앨범의 중요부분은 끝났지만 나머지 몇 스텝들의 (마스터링, 인쇄, 디자인, 유통, 홍보) 경비를 충당하기 위해 펀드레이징을 합니다. 관심있는 여러분들이 미리 앨범을 구입하시거나, 도네이트 또는 Social Network에 share해주시면 대단히 감사하겠습니다.

I originally came to New York City to study jazz composition at NYU. I started writing music for my own 10 piece band as a student and this ensemble continued to expand, growing larger and larger. We began gigging around the city for a few years before opportunities took me back to Korea. When I arrived in Seoul, I quickly became busy teaching college classes and performing with my other projects. But I missed the creative and vibrant music scene in NYC even though I returned from time to time to perform.  Finally, I had to decide where I really wanted to be based, and the choice for me was clear. I decided to come back to NYC to accomplish my dream of writing and playing with my own orchestra. Out of this dream the album “Ee-Ya-Gi” was born.

The album already sounds amazing. Recorded at Bunker Studio and engineered by Aaron Nevezie the band spent two wonderful days in the studio laying down my compositions. I brought together an amazing group of NYC musicians and featured world-renowned saxophonist Rich Perry and trumpeter Ingrid Jensen. I returned to the studio to do some careful editing, and we spent several days in the studio mixing the music to perfection.

But there are still many final steps that need to be taken to get this music out to the world. And that is where you come in! Your contribution will really make a difference and I have some great rewards to offer you in exchange for your support. 

What We Need & What You Get

So here’s the break down and budget of this project. With my own savings I managed to fund two days at the studio, along with a couple days of editing, and two full days of mixing. I was also able to compensate the 18 musicians for their amazing playing and musicianship (they all gave me a huge break on the price showing their belief in this project!)

 But there are still so many things that need to be funded and done correctly so that this project doesn’t just remain buried on a hard drive. And that’s where your contribution will come into play. These are the remaining items I need to get this project out there:

1. Mastering: $1500 to give the recording that sweet sound that it deserves

2. Replicating and manufacturing: $1500 to create the actual disk for you to posses and enjoy

3. Graphic design: $1000 to help visually represent my musical vision

4. Album promotion: $3000 which includes both radio and print media campaign to get it out there

So I’m seeking to raise a total of $7000 to complete these final steps and to make this recording a reality. In exchange for your contribution, I have created some unique and valuable rewards for you. I have gone into greater detail in the rewards section of this campaign. But a few highlights include:

  • Autographed CDs and digital downloads before the official release date: this will be great because you will have a chance to hear the music before the rest of the world.
  • Uniquely designed poster featuring album images of this project: I’m really excited about this one! The poster will feature pictures from the recording session and gigs as well as album art work. I’ll have a few specially signed by the members of the band.
  • Special hand painted Korean calligraphy art work: This is printed on beautiful paper brought here from Korea. These works look great when placed in a frame and hung on the wall as a decoration.
  • VIP tickets to upcoming performance of the Hyeseon Hong Jazz Orchestra: While we haven’t yet finalized the date, when we do you will have special guest passes for 2 to attend this amazing event! It will be a fabulous evening for sure.

An important note regarding my choice to make this the kind of campaign that will use whatever money is contributed: I will make sure that the first monies received will go directly towards getting the recording finished. If I do not receive all of the funds, I spend less on design and promotion to ensure that I am still able to fulfill all rewards as promised. 

The Impact

I wanted to go into a little more detail about why I think this project is important, tell you a bit more about my music and where it was recorded, and to introduce the musicians to you.  My compositions blend elements of classical music, modern jazz big band and Korean traditional music.  Featuring strong melodies with harmonically-rich, impressionistic backgrounds, my music strives to paint a picture of the natural world in the listener's mind.   I also want to share the uniqueness of my Korean cultural experience with others, raising awareness of both the differences and similarities between the east and the west.  I want to foster musical dialogue which will lead to better understanding and communication.

While there are a variety of big bands performing in NYC these days, I believe my music offers a unique and original take on this particular instrumentation.  The ensemble itself is filled with some of the best jazz musician’s NYC has to offer. Many of the musicians performing in my group can be found in some of the best big bands throughout the world. Special guest soloist Rich Perry brings his multi-decades of experience playing in the Maria Schneider Jazz Orchestra as well as with the Village Vanguard big band to this project. Rich can be heard on countless recordings as both a sideman and leader. Special guest trumpet soloist Ingrid Jensen also joins the ensemble for this recording playing section parts as well as lending her improvisational voice to Ms. Hong's compositions. Ingrid is a world famous performer appearing in The Maria Schneider Jazz Orchestra, Darcy James Argue’s Secret Society and on countless other projects as both a leader and sideman.

The album was recorded at Bunker Studio located in Brooklyn.  The Bunker Studio is a 3000 square foot recording studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn NYC that is owned and operated by producer/musicians John Davis and Aaron Nevezie. Committed to preserving the art and science of analog recording and mixing, they understand the needs of musicians in terms of sound, space, and sightlines. With exceptional microphones, recording gear, and instruments, Bunker Studio offers the perfect environment to record a large ensemble of this size.  

The album will be mastered by Randy Merrill at Sterling Sound. Randy Merrill’s approach to mastering starts by understanding what a recording needs in order to have maximum translatability, musicality, and impact.

The album is going to be released May 12th 2017 on Summit Records.  Summit Records is an internationally renowned record label, with many well-known recording artists on their roster and numerous Grammy awards under their belt.  Summit believes this particular recording has a great chance at a Grammy nomination. They will also be doing a national and international radio campaign utilizing Dr. Jazz for the radio promotion.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge to releasing this recording, and actually any recording these days, is getting the music heard in the crowded marketplace of the internet. There is no longer one central place where everyone goes to find music. I believe many people would enjoy and cherish the music found on this recording, but they simply may never come across it. Increasingly algorithms choose the music that will show up as suggested new music for you, and it takes a lot for me to make sure my music gets equal consideration!

In order to overcome this challenge I’ve put in place a great team of people to help me spread the word.  Summit Records is helping immensely.  Dr. Jazz will be coordinating a radio campaign. And hopefully this crowd funding campaign will launch awareness about the upcoming release. And I hope if you value this kind of project and music that YOU will help me spread the word!  I think once given a chance, the strength of the recording will shine through. The musicians really rose to the occasion and made my music sound great.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially at this time to this campaign, it would mean a lot to me if you could help me spread the word about my project! Indiegogo has a lot of easy share tools that you can use to share my project on Facebook, Twitter, on your own blog, website or anywhere else. If you value this kind of music, share it with your friends and family! 

Thank you very much and I hope to see you soon!

The Hyeseon Hong Jazz Orchestra is:

Composer and director:

Hyeseon Hong

Vocalist:

E.J. Park

Saxes:

Ben Kono (alto, sop., flute)

Matt Vashlishan (alto, EWI, flute)

Rich Perry (tenor)

Jeremy Powell (tenor, clariet)

Andrew Hadro (Bari, bs clarinet)

Trumpets:

Augie Haas

Ingrid Jensen

Jason Wiseman

Colin Brigstocke

Trombones:

Ron Wilkens

Daniel Linden

Ric Becker

Becca Patterson

Rhythm:

Matt Panayides (guitar)

Broc Hempel (piano)

John Lenis (bass)

Mark Ferber (drums)

story: This is a campaign to raise funds for a CD, this would mean a lot to me as this would mean i can use the best of equipment and allow me to make the album of a professional standard.
story_txt: This is a campaign to raise funds for a CD, this would mean a lot to me as this would mean i can use the best of equipment and allow me to make the album of a professional standard.

story:
About me

I'm an Australian musician and composer who has released 11 albums in diverse styles ranging from electronica to folk rock.  My first band B(if)tek (1996-2003) was an electro-femme duo who were described as "Australia's greatest electronic innovators" and received Aria award nominations (Oz equivalent of Grammys).  I've changed musical direction since then as I wanted to explore new sonic territory and write meaningful, poetic lyrics.

In 2008, I was jobless, still recovering from breast cancer and the death of my Mum. I took off to the USA with a filmmaker girlfriend.  We called ourselves The Jilted Brides - a folk-tronica outfit - and by 2009 I had been granted a Green Card on account of being 'an extraordinary alien'. I met incredible musicians during my subsequent years State-side, and some of them are helping me make this album.

I’ve had this album concept - a woman's take on 60s/ early 70s Dylan -  for at least 4 years now, and madly scribbling lyrics and ideas.  When I was in Los Angeles in 2015 , I recorded 3 tracks with my musician friends there. In London this year, I recorded the title track 'Deal with Your Disenchantment' and one other with the help of wonderful musician friends here.  But I've now run out of cash to mix these tracks, record more and master and finally produce the album.

So this is an appeal for help from my extended network of friends and anyone else who might like to hear this wildly ambitious song collection, a mad reflection on current times. And lo, in 2017 it appears we are now living in the apocalyptic political times of the late ‘60s all over again - the times they are a-changing back...

The Band So Far

Songs & Singin': Nicole Skeltys; Bass & Harmonica: Robin Hemmings; Drums (London) Matt Rosewood; Guitar (London) Rich Thomas; Recording (London) Gareth Cobb; Guitar, mandolin, production (Los Angeles): Bobby Cuff; Fiddle (Los Angeles): Karlee Cuff; Drums (Los Angeles): Ray. Audio engineers: Bobby Cuff & Gareth Cobb

What Do I Need?

My target of £3900 will cover the costs of finishing a 7-8 track album including:

Recording studio time

Payments to guest musicians

Mixing

Mastering

100 CD duplications for donors

World-wide postage

Charges by IndieGoGo

What will you get for your generosity?

£10 gets you the full digital album download plus my DIY artwork.

£30 gets you the digital download, plus a limited edition CD version of Disenchantment (100 only will be made)

£150 gets you all of the above plus your name on the artwork and website page credited as a co-producer

£300 gets your name mentioned in a ballad I will compose, record and release on the album

The Impact

The title track 'Deal With Your Disenchantment' is a protest song with echoes of Hard Rain, Desolation Row etc.  But other tracks on the album will explore Dylan's many other sub-genres of this period which include: the Beat poet howl, the Cassady/ Kerouac road story, the mystical incantation, the cryptic sermon, the white blues, the 'three chords and the truth' country tune, the ballads of wronged individuals, the love lament, all strung through with acerbic wit, and surreal phrase turning. And sieved  through a contemporary female consciousness ie my brain and my experiences.

I have a track record of making crazy ideas come true. In the '90s, I had a vision that I could produce a female Kraftwerk sound and B(if)tek ended up headlining festivals, profiled in Rolling Stone, on TV, radio, national press.  In the 2000s, I went to the USA knowing no-one, secured 5 artist residencies and was eventually awarded a Green Card. Before this decade is out, I intend to produce an album which you can put on after Highway 61 and smile - and feel angry -  at the continuity.

What happens if: goal not met? goal exceeded?

If I don't meet the £3900 goal, I won't be able to finish the album - right now.  But I will not spend your money snorting cocaine off the chests of models, it will rest in my account until I am able to scrape up the money from other sources (eg applying for arts grants, personal savings) and all obligations will eventually be met.  That might not be till 2018 however.

If this funding target is exceeded, I’d apply the funds to:

Commissioning professional album artwork from an award winning Melbourne graphic designer (Luke from GrinCreative)

Pressing the album to vinyl (250 copies)

Sending the LP to digital distributors (eg iTunes, Spotify)

Hiring a London based music publicist, with an international brief

That would cost £3500

And if that target is exceeded, I'd apply the funds to:

Shooting a high end, professional video in Los Angeles (in July 2017) with Sundance acclaimed film producer/ videographer Monty Miranda (Dylan co-financed his first feature film)

That would cost £4750

Well, one can dream.  On an idiot wind...

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link far and wide!  Thank you!

About me
I'm an Australian musician and composer who has released 11 albums in diverse styles ranging from electronica to folk rock.  My first band B(if)tek (1996-2003) was an electro-femme duo who were described as "Australia's greatest electronic innovators" and received Aria award nominations (Oz equivalent of Grammys).  I've changed musical direction since then as I wanted to explore new sonic territory and write meaningful, poetic lyrics.
In 2008, I was jobless, still recovering from breast cancer and the death of my Mum. I took off to the USA with a filmmaker girlfriend.  We called ourselves The Jilted Brides - a folk-tronica outfit - and by 2009 I had been granted a Green Card on account of being 'an extraordinary alien'. I met incredible musicians during my subsequent years State-side, and some of them are helping me make this album.
I’ve had this album concept - a woman's take on 60s/ early 70s Dylan -  for at least 4 years now, and madly scribbling lyrics and ideas.  When I was in Los Angeles in 2015 , I recorded 3 tracks with my musician friends there. In London this year, I recorded the title track 'Deal with Your Disenchantment' and one other with the help of wonderful musician friends here.  But I've now run out of cash to mix these tracks, record more and master and finally produce the album.
So this is an appeal for help from my extended network of friends and anyone else who might like to hear this wildly ambitious song collection, a mad reflection on current times. And lo, in 2017 it appears we are now living in the apocalyptic political times of the late ‘60s all over again - the times they are a-changing back...
The Band So Far
Songs & Singin': Nicole Skeltys; Bass & Harmonica: Robin Hemmings; Drums (London) Matt Rosewood; Guitar (London) Rich Thomas; Recording (London) Gareth Cobb; Guitar, mandolin, production (Los Angeles): Bobby Cuff; Fiddle (Los Angeles): Karlee Cuff; Drums (Los Angeles): Ray. Audio engineers: Bobby Cuff & Gareth Cobb

What Do I Need?
My target of £3900 will cover the costs of finishing a 7-8 track album including:
Recording studio time
Payments to guest musicians
Mixing
Mastering
100 CD duplications for donors
World-wide postage
Charges by IndieGoGo
What will you get for your generosity?
£10 gets you the full digital album download plus my DIY artwork.
£30 gets you the digital download, plus a limited edition CD version of Disenchantment (100 only will be made)
£150 gets you all of the above plus your name on the artwork and website page credited as a co-producer
£300 gets your name mentioned in a ballad I will compose, record and release on the album

The Impact
The title track 'Deal With Your Disenchantment' is a protest song with echoes of Hard Rain, Desolation Row etc.  But other tracks on the album will explore Dylan's many other sub-genres of this period which include: the Beat poet howl, the Cassady/ Kerouac road story, the mystical incantation, the cryptic sermon, the white blues, the 'three chords and the truth' country tune, the ballads of wronged individuals, the love lament, all strung through with acerbic wit, and surreal phrase turning. And sieved  through a contemporary female consciousness ie my brain and my experiences.
I have a track record of making crazy ideas come true. In the '90s, I had a vision that I could produce a female Kraftwerk sound and B(if)tek ended up headlining festivals, profiled in Rolling Stone, on TV, radio, national press.  In the 2000s, I went to the USA knowing no-one, secured 5 artist residencies and was eventually awarded a Green Card. Before this decade is out, I intend to produce an album which you can put on after Highway 61 and smile - and feel angry -  at the continuity.

What happens if: goal not met? goal exceeded?
If I don't meet the £3900 goal, I won't be able to finish the album - right now.  But I will not spend your money snorting cocaine off the chests of models, it will rest in my account until I am able to scrape up the money from other sources (eg applying for arts grants, personal savings) and all obligations will eventually be met.  That might not be till 2018 however.
If this funding target is exceeded, I’d apply the funds to:
Commissioning professional album artwork from an award winning Melbourne graphic designer (Luke from GrinCreative)
Pressing the album to vinyl (250 copies)
Sending the LP to digital distributors (eg iTunes, Spotify)
Hiring a London based music publicist, with an international brief
That would cost £3500
And if that target is exceeded, I'd apply the funds to:
Shooting a high end, professional video in Los Angeles (in July 2017) with Sundance acclaimed film producer/ videographer Monty Miranda (Dylan co-financed his first feature film)
That would cost £4750
Well, one can dream.  On an idiot wind...

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this link far and wide!  Thank you!

story:
Summary

  • I am BLinds. I consider myself a passionate Musician, Poet, Artist, and Writer.
    • I have created or helped to create a few small albums in the past.
      • My own album 'I Am Frightened', of which I did all the Lyrics, Music, Recording, Mixing, and Mastering on. Links to that album are below

        • Download;
          https://blindspoetry.bandcamp.com/album/i-am-fr...

        • Stream;
          https://open.spotify.com/album/3yGnfwNKaDdItxK4...

      • 'The Spooky Scary EP' for the band Spooky Scary, where I played drums, Recorded, assisted with Editing, and Mixing. Link below
        • https://spookyscary.bandcamp.com/releases
      • The Editing, Mixing, and partial Production of the 'Oh, Hey' EP by Pistol Winks
        • https://ghostnoting.bandcamp.com/album/oh-hey-2
      • A few select recordings for friends
  • This campaign is to aid in the creation of the album, from creation of the videos all the way to production and distribution of the final physical product.
  • If I gain enough interest, I could put more effort and focus on creation of music, poetry, and art that people enjoy and contribute to in the future, of which I am currently already planning on doing.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Any money put forth will go directly to the production of the album. 
    • Mixing/Mastering of the Audio by professionals for a higher quality finished product
    • Filming/Production of the Videos to be associated with the album
    • Delivery of Physical Portions of the album
    • Indiegogo's 5% fee
    • Any left over funds not used in the above ways will be used for future releases, or donated to a local artists collective.
  • Perks range from physical copies of the album, art, and short story, to personal video thank you's or a poem written for you, to myself being your personal chauffeur for a day, 
  • If the goal is not reached, the album will still be created, but some of the bonuses may not be entirely possible.

The Impact

  • This project will allow myself to create things for others' enjoyment.
  • Any value or worth beyond that is entirely up to you and everyone who participates
  • In an effort to reduce waste, physical copies of the album will not be printed. 

Risks & Challenges

  • I have been having issues with my wrists as of late, and thus making playing certain instruments somewhat difficult. 
  • Making 10 Music videos and 10-15 different Art pieces may take a bit of time.
  • Beyond that, the only challenge will be making something that many people enjoy

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute money, your feedback, opinions, thoughts and concerns are welcome.
  • You could always share this or show this to others to gain interest from those who do have something they can contribute in a monetary fashion.

story:
For those wishing to contribute via Etransfer or Paypal here are the details:

Paypal: paypal.me/faridehmunirih

Etransfer: faridehmusic@gmail.com

_________________________________________________________________________________________

I wasn’t planning on creating more music for the Baha’i community.

I was happy with the two albums I created, I had a child, I pursued my other musical talents and I felt my service in this arena was over. 

But something happened last year. 

A breeze of inspiration passed over me.

Perhaps it was around the time we were celebrating the Bicentenary of the Bab and Baha’u’llah. I knew I would not have the time I needed to create works for those celebrations – so I looked to the future and saw another momentous occasion on the horizon.

In November of 2021 we will be celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Ascension of Abdul Baha.

In March of that same year is also when we will begin a one-year plan. No doubt we’re going to need music to sustain us, to encourage us and to uplift our hearts to carry out the goals of our plan. 

In anticipation of this need, I began writing and composing. 

When COVID happened, my writing stopped as I needed to care for my family. I wasn’t sure what would be possible, and yet I felt sure I was meant to offer this service to my community and as an offering to Abdul Baha. 

In August, I had a moment to myself and I went through what I created. While it wasn’t enough for a full album, I did have two beautiful pieces that inspired peace and hope and I want to share those songs with you and your community.

I want these songs to be produce with the highest of production quality to celebrate this time.

I want these songs to have an orchestral string section, because there is something about the sound of a string section that causes the listener’s heart to break open.

I want us to bring these songs to life with the help of talented filmmakers. I want the film they make to be available on YouTube so everyone can hear and watch and be hit in their heart by the writings of 'Abdu'l Baha'. 

However, this endeavor is beyond my financial ability to invest in – this is where I turn to you for help.

How you can help

  • Financially support this project
  • Telling others about the project is a HUGE help.
  • I’m always accepting prayers too :)

The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page!

 

Perks of getting involved

Perks are available to all who contribute! Whether you want to invest $5 or $500 you have access to all of them. 

  • Firstly my undying gratitude to you :0 
  • You’ll hear the songs (and hopefully see the films) first before everyone else. 
  • You’ll also be invited to an online listening party where we all get together on Zoom and I can personally thank you – and we can all feel together that WE did this (not just me, you too!) 

 

Thank you for your support of this project. It means the world to me.

story:
Short Summary

I’ve been singing as long as I can remember. Church, opry’s, festivals, you name it.  That's why it was such a shock to so many people when I stepped off the stage in 2010.  But the thing was that I had three little girls that needed me and the constraints singing was putting on my marriage had to be addressed.  It took me eight years to figure out that the stage wasn’t the problem and that I had a huge hole in my life that only music could fill.  So, I decided to change my mindset and my life.  My kids were older and my marriage wasn’t broken because I was a singer.  But my life was broken without the music.  I walked away from an eighteen year marriage to chase my passion and haven’t looked back.  Since then, the outpouring of support has come from all over and I finally feel as if I am doing what I was called to do!  But my voice can only reach so far. And that’s why I’m asking for your help.  There is so much more than just writing and recording that goes into making an album successful.  That’s what has brought me to this platform, to your virtual door, to ask that you help support a dream that started a long time ago when a six year old girl sang her first solo and felt the magnitude of what she possessed. 

I’m excited to tell you that the album is finished!  All recording, printing, photographs, album artwork, and packaging have been fully paid for through hard work and my team members who believe in me.  However, if we want to be sure my music is heard far and wide, then we need a strong radio promotion And it’s expensive!  But, I’ve waited this long to pursue my dreams, and it’s important to me to make the most of this opportunity.  After all, I only get one chance to release my debut album, and I want to do it right!  

I am here to ask you for your help in joining my dream team.  And I wouldn’t ask for your help if I wasn’t willing to share a piece of the dream with you!  We have special perks available at various levels of financial support, and these are exclusive offers that you can only receive through this IndieGogo fundraiser.  Some perks have a limited number available so be sure to check them out!    

It is hard to explain just how powerful and pivotal this moment is for me.  This album has been a lifetime in the making and the songs I’ve written flowed from a wealth of life experiences that brought me to this point. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support of my music… and my dream.

What We Need & What You Get

Radio promotion isn't cheap and it is definitely one of those services that you get what you pay for!  Here is a breakdown of the expenses and what you will receive as a perk for your contribution:

  • Promotion for one radio single for sixteen weeks: $4,500.00
  • Unique perks are being offered as part of this campaign that are not available at our merch table or on the website!  Every level of contribution will have something you will receive in return.  Those items range from signed copies of the CD to backyard acoustic shows!  Be sure to check out these perks as there are some that are limited quantities!
  • If for some reason the project is not fully funded, all contributions will go to cover traveling expenses for our spring launch tour.  This will cover gas for the vehicles and hotel rooms for shows that are too far to travel back from the same evening.

The Impact

One thing that I have always believed is that you are never too old to achieve your goals, but moreover, you should always chase your passion!  The impact that the music from this album has already had is incredible!  Every single time I sing "Enough" at a show, I look out into the audience and I see women wiping tears from their face.  I have at least one of them come up to me afterward and say thank you for the reminder!  To me, THAT is true success!  If I can touch one person with my music and change their life, then I've been successful.  But I also want my girls to know that you can't let hardships in life stop you from pursuing your dreams and it's never too late to do it!  As a woman, I think it is very important to instill in young girls that you shouldn't rely on anyone else to take care of you and you should let no-one  dictate your future. I want to be living proof that you aren't too old to overcome circumstances and become successful!

Risks & Challenges

We all know that COVID has created a challenge for us all.  It was a difficult decision to release music during this time, but I know how much music has meant to my life and healed me when nothing else could so I chose to move forward with the project.  

  • Radio Tour: if radio stations close their studios to in-studio interview, we may have to postpone the radio tour campaign.
  • While it is ideal to be able to do in-studio interviews to support the launch, we will still be able to carry out the radio promotion campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on all of your social media platforms and email lists!
  • Join the mailing list and keep up with the happenings in our camp at  www.aprilnsmithmusic.com 
  • Follow me on Facebook and Instagram at @aprilnsmithmusic
  • Come out to a show and support live music!

I want to be living proof that you aren't too old to overcome circumstances and become successful!

Risks & Challenges
We all know that COVID has created a challenge for us all.  It was a difficult decision to release music during this time, but I know how much music has meant to my life and healed me when nothing else could so I chose to move forward with the project.  

Radio Tour: if radio stations close their studios to in-studio interview, we may have to postpone the radio tour campaign.
While it is ideal to be able to do in-studio interviews to support the launch, we will still be able to carry out the radio promotion campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share this campaign on all of your social media platforms and email lists!
Join the mailing list and keep up with the happenings in our camp at  www.aprilnsmithmusic.com 
Follow me on Facebook and Instagram at @aprilnsmithmusic
Come out to a show and support live music!

story:
Hi! I’m Cheyanne from Cheyanne and Company and first of all THANK YOU!!  I have been a musician since I was a little girl following in the footsteps of my rock and roll musician parents.  Now is the time to fulfill TWO generations of dreams and produce the first debut EP Album.  Miracles do happen and somehow some of the most amazing people have shown up to help with this project! Now we just need to pay them - and they only are asking for a fraction of what they are worth!  So naturally I am selling you everything I have to make this dream come true

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down:.

  • $7000 is the goal we are aiming for!! This pays to finish adding ingredients and mixing and mastering the final EP album project, a music video for the first single “Crazy Mary”, and a little bit of advertising help ❤️
  • There are some amazing perks for every level of contribution!  From digital copies and hard autographed copies of the Album, personalize photos, t-shirts, private concerts, vocal lessons, song writing collaborations or even your own personal song and more! We also have some great perks that would make excellent presents like handmade seashell candles, handmade earrings, acroyoga lessons and even a day trip to Mexico!! All the perks will be available for the holiday gift giving season!! And if you want to give away a prepurchase CD-we will send you a gift card to physically present that they can redeem for the music!

The Impact

Dreams don’t work unless you do! So the time has come to put our feet to the ground and start building them!  And why not make the world a little better if not at least wiser with your dreams!  The first single Crazy Mary is written about and highlights the high rate of mental illness within our even higher rate of homeless on the streets.  Each $20+  contribution received over Thanksgiving will be matched with a meal for the homeless and over the gifting holidays  will be matched with a present to a child in need. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread  the word out and make some noise about the campaign.  Dont forget  to try  the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Got  something to donate for a silent auction or raffle that we can use for an event to drive contributions?  That would help a lot as well!

story:
WHO AM I?

My name is Jelena Jovovic. I am a jazz vocalist, composer, lyricist and pedagogue. In all these fields of my profession I always felt –and I will always feel- the need  to connect, to share and to keep growing as a musician and as a human being.

THE PROJECT

I recently  recorded an album, called Heartbeat. I need your support  to finalize the production and spread my music worldwide.

I have put my heart and soul into it, composed most of the music and wrote all of the lyrics, produced it and did all the music and vocal arrangements. I am thrilled about the fact that one of the greatest musicians in jazz History,  Mr. Wayne Shorter, granted me permission to record my lyrics to his composition Witch Hunt.

THE CREW

The musicians that joined me on this musical adventure are some of the most outstanding jazz artists born in my native country of Serbia: Vasil Hadzimanov, Milan Nikolic, Vladimir Kostadinovic and Rastko Obradovic, along with many “OMG” guests.  They are wonderful and generous companions. All of them are performing internationally, exploring different musical paths.

Through our musicianship that brought  this project to life, we came to be  aware that the universal power of music, the language of emotions through sound- can reach every heart. 

THE MOTIVATION

I wanted to talk and share stories about love, about the freedom to choose love as a liberating process, a path for healing . 

Love despite fears, love without fear. 

The music has been inspired by different traditions and material: ancient Balkan folk songs, traditional jazz forms, modern harmonies, different atmospheres. 

I  also drew inspiration from the memories of my childhood, the experience of being a mother, from  living on different continents. From the treasures I found on my path, life has thought me: of  the strength to overcome adversities, to fall and rise again, to be faithful to my beliefs and to my dreams.

 

THE BUDGET

Releasing a non-commercial album is a challenging endeavor  for all musicians around the world. So I need your help to be able to complete the production process, launching campaign ( CD production and digital campaign, video, photo shoot, remix of two songs for mass distribution) culminating with our worldwide premiere concert at a prestigious concert hall in Belgrade. The goal is to share our music with the world and with YOU.

THE PERKS

We have complied an enticing  level of perks for those of you who open your hearts to support our campaign. The info graph provided explains in detail how funds raised will be utilized.

 

Be the Heartbeat of this album. Give and love without fear.

 

Thank you for visiting my campaign page. Any level of support will be greatly appreciated. Please spread the word by using provided links or through your social media contacts.
story_txt:
WHO AM I?
My name is Jelena Jovovic. I am a jazz vocalist, composer, lyricist and pedagogue. In all these fields of my profession I always felt –and I will always feel- the need  to connect, to share and to keep growing as a musician and as a human being.

THE PROJECT
I recently  recorded an album, called Heartbeat. I need your support  to finalize the production and spread my music worldwide.
I have put my heart and soul into it, composed most of the music and wrote all of the lyrics, produced it and did all the music and vocal arrangements. I am thrilled about the fact that one of the greatest musicians in jazz History,  Mr. Wayne Shorter, granted me permission to record my lyrics to his composition Witch Hunt.

the campaign has finished, and although the target was not reached, we will find the rest of the money to complete the project from sales of previous releases.

 

thanks to all those who contributed, you will be informed by e-mail as when to expect your DUB GARDEN 12" LP record.

story:
The Short Version

24 Hour Cardlock is a band that plays songs about driving trucks.  Since 2002, Cardlock has been delivering a unique pileup of old-school country, guitar rawk, humor and pathos--and having a great time doing it.

This campaign is in support of our second studio album, "Semibicoastal."  Most of the album was recorded in Omaha, NE, and a couple songs were recorded with Cardlock's Pacific Division in Vancouver, BC.

We've been lucky enough to play for a lot of people in the last few years, and they've been kind enough to ask if we had any music they could take home with them. We're doing this campaign so that we can finally say "yes" to that, so that more people can find out about Cardlock, and so that we can keep on doing what we do.

Want to Hear Some Cardlock?

Here are a couple tunes off the new album. This is "Chainsmokinggun"

 

And here's a video for "Hit the Road" we shot while we were recording

 

What We Need

This is where we get serious, for just a moment. It's best to be plain about such things, is it not?

We recorded this album using money we earned playing gigs, and when that ran out, money we earned not playing gigs.

Funding from this campaign will go back into the band.  First, we'd like to cover costs of printing CDs and other merch.  If there's enough left over, then we'll try to recoup some of our recording costs.  Anything beyond that will go back into more recording and promoting the band.

What You Get

Well, first of all, we're offering some good songs, well-played and recorded, for download and on CD.  You'll be able to stream this stuff later through most services, but this is a chance to get higher-quality formats, and get them first.

 

If you're a particularly stylish individual, or you think you might need an extra layer later in the spring, we have shirts available as well. 

 

We've also got some special perks in this campaign, which will only be available for campaign supporters. If there's a perk you think we should add, please let us know!*

Beyond that, your support for this campaign will mean Cardlock playing more music, more often.  We hope that's something you'll want.

Other Ways to Help

Not everybody is flush all the time. Not everybody wants a shiny silver disk. And as we have learned at some of our shows, not everyone wears shirts. 

If there's nothing here you want to purchase, but you'd still like to help the band a bit, we would certainly appreciate it if you would tell any friends who might be interested in Cardlock about us, and share this campaign with your friends. There are some sharing tools here to make that easier.
 

*but don't bother asking Bojephus to do his Morrissey impersonation. He just won't, period.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Babatunde Akinboboye and I'm a professional opera singer who loves hip-hop. Ever since I was tricked into joining choir in high school, I have enjoyed combining classical singing styles with popular music. I finally got up the courage to record and share some of my work just a few weeks ago, and I have been overwhelmed by how well it has been received. Who knew that other people would enjoy this as much as I do!? As a performer, this means so much and it has motivated me to create even more music for people to enjoy. If this campaign is successful, it might very well lay the foundation for an entirely new style of popular  music. It will also help me to share my talents and hard-earned skills in the most authentic way that I know how.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is all about raising the funds needed to create a quality EP. My goal of $40,000 will allow me to get the ball rolling and assist with production costs. It will be a great start toward covering cover art, studio fees, accompanists, production fees, producers, editing, mixing and mastering, marketing, physical cd’s, licensing, and launching fees. A total amount of $75,000 should fully cover the project at the most marketable level and buffer against the possible risks and challenges listed below.

I am so appreciative of all of your help as I work towards my goal. Please be sure to check out the perks section to see what is available to you for your contribution.

The Impact

Your contributions can help Hip Hopera become a full-blown genre, enriching the worlds of both opera and hip-hop.

Risks & Challenges

If you have ever participated in or planned an event or project, you know that there are always unforeseen, hidden, and unexpected costs that come up. These are all possible challenges for this current project along with technical difficulties, illness, travel, overall production and launching issues. Fortunately, I have a team of folks working alongside me to help bring this campaign and project through even with the associated risks and challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, as an artist, I completely understand this. You can also help my campaign by sharing it with your friends and on your social media. There may be other people that you know who would like to contribute. Like, share, and comment where appropriate. The more eyes on this the better!

 

http://www.babatundebaritone.com/

story:
Help us change the tune by supporting the release of 'The Golden Pianists'.

Slovenia is home to many successful pianists awarded the world over. Our aim is to make them known to more people. Truth be told, that is not such an easy thing to do. That is why we are releasing 'The Golden Pianists' record, a collection of tracks from seven of the best young pianists attending the 48th Young Musicians Competition of the Republic of Slovenia. 

         
Urban Stanič v PianoRoomu izvaja Chopinovo Etudo op. 10, št. 4 v cis molu.
 

Kaj boste omogočili Zlatim pianistom

Urbanu, Lari, Tobiji, Vidu, Nastasji, Piji in Matiji  vrhunsko tonsko snemanje v specializiranem klavirskem studiu PianoRoom. Poskrbeli bomo še za profesionalno fotografiranje in vizualno celostno podobo, ki nastaja v oblikovalskem studiu IODG, večkrat nagrajenega oblikovalca Dušana Grobovška. Natisnili bomo 500 ploščkov in jih skupaj z digitalnim albumom izdali predvidoma 15. septembra. Premierno jih bomo predstavili na festivalu klavirske glasbe Pianopolis v Kranju.

Enako pomembna, kot izdelek, se nam zdi izkušnja, ki so jo mladi glasbeniki pridobili pri nastajanju in promociji albuma. Karierne veščine resnega, a sodobnega glasbenika v digitalno povezanem svetu vse bolj obsegajo tudi slednje. 

 

 

Kaj boste lahko slišali

Album se bo najverjetneje začel z Etudo v C duru, F. Chopina v izvedbi Matije Drofenika, ki ji bo v nadaljevanju dodal še Sonato v B duru op. 22, L. van Beethovna. Osrednji del bo zgrajen okrog Etude - Tableaux op. 39, št. 9, Sergeia Rahmaninova, ki jo izvaja Urban Stanič, virtuozne Chopinove skladbe Andante Spianato v izvedbi Vida Ibica in Chopinove Balade št. 3 v As duru Lare Oprešnik, ki bo dodala še Romantično fantazijo in fugo v d molu, BWV 903 J. S. Bacha. Slišali  bomo tudi Makedonske plese Alojza Srebotnjaka, ki jih je posnel Urban Stanič. Haydnova Sonata v Es duru in Griegova Klavirska sonata v e molu, op. št. 7-1 bosta zveneli v interpretaciji izjemne Nastasje Češnjevar Ušumović. Pia Landeker bo izvajala še eno slovensko skladbo, tokrat Emila Adamiča. S Sonatino op. 36, št. 6  M. Clementija pa bo zaključil najmlajši Tobija Avšič. 

 


Lara Oprešnik

»Umetnost je zame potreba po izražanju, dotikanju najsvetlejših pa tudi najtemnejših delcev naše duše, nas samih. Tudi če bi hotela, brez umetnosti več ne morem.«. Lara je tudi skladateljica. 2018 je osvojila absolutno prvo nagrado na Mednarodnem skladateljskem tekmovanju Oscar Rieding. Izobražuje se pod mentorstvom profesorja Hinka Haasa in profesorice Milane Chernyavske (Akademija za glasbo v Ljubljani; Univerza za glasbo in upodabljajočo umetnost Gradec).

 

Matija Drofenik

"Moje druženje s klavirjem se je začelo v mojih mladih letih, ko sem z mamo Andreo Seljan Drofenik prihajal v glasbeno šolo v Rogaški Slatini, kjer sem se počutil kot doma." Matija med svojimi dosežki izpostavlja 1. nagrado in 100 točk leta 2011 v Gradežu, 2. nagrado 2011 v Parizu, 2 drugi nagradi na Mladih virtuozih  2012 in 2014 v Zagrebu, 3. nagrado v Newcastlu, 1. nagrado EPTA Osijek, 2. nagrado v Geilenkirchnu,vse v letu 2017, 2. nagrado v Milanu 2018.

Deluje pod vodstvom profesorice Jelice Kuzmin. (Zasebnik)

 

Zakaj potrebujemo vašo podporo

Zato, ker je nismo dobili od institucij ali minstrstev. »Ploščo lahko obrnemo« in izdamo edino z vašim sodelovanjem. S tem ko kupite CD plošček ali enega od paketov,  bomo pridobili sredstva za snemanje, uglaševanje klavirja (uglasili smo ga 6x), montažo, mešanje zvoka, mastering in izdelavo ploščka. 2.100 EUR predstavlja le del proračuna za celovito izvedbo. Sredstva poskušamo pridobiti še na druge načine, vendar se še najbolj zanesemo na vas:)

Urban Stanič

»Sanjam o občutku, ko se na odru čas ustavi in postane glasba vse, kar obstaja.«

Urban Stanič je zmagovalec slovenskega izbora za tekmovanje Evrovizijski mladi glasbeniki 2014 in prejemnik 2. nagrade na finalnem tekmovanju v Kölnu. Kot solist je večkrat sodeloval z najvidnejšimi slovenskimi orkestri in osvajal visoke nagrade na mednarodnih in državnih tekmovanjih. Deluje pod vodstvom profesorice Dubravke Tomšič Srebotnjak. (Akademija za glasbo v Ljubljani). 

Nastasja Češnjevar Ušumović

»Kar v življenju pride zlahka ne ostane dolgo, do tega kar ti bo sledilo skozi življenje pa ni mogoče ubirati bližnjice. Zato se trudim in garam, da si zagotovim, da bodo glasba in literatura vedno ob moji strani.« Nastasja je vsestranska umetnica, ki piše že svoj drugi roman. Na 48. TEMSIG-u je osvojia 100 točk. Zmaguje pa tudi na številnih mednarodnih tekmovanjih. Izobražuje se pod vodstvom  profesorice Valentine Češnjevar. (Glasbena šola Koper)

 

Kako lahko še pomagate

Zelo veliko lahko naredite s tem, da novico o Zlatih pianistih razširite med svojimi prijatelji glasbe na družbenih omrežjih in mailing listah. Če dodate k temu še kakšno dobro besedo, še toliko bolje. 

 

 

Vid Ibic

»Ko glasbe ne izvajam, jo poslušam.« Vid je izjemen v vsem kar počne. Osvojil je že 20 nagrad na pomembnih tekmovanjih. Na TEMSIG-u je prvič zmagal leta 2016. Nastopa tudi kot solist z orkestri, med katerimi je njegov najljubši nastop v Italiji, kjer je izvajal 2. In 3. stavek Beethovenovega koncerta. Deluje pod vodstvom profesorice Selme Chicco Hajdin (Umetniška gimnazija Koper) in profesorice Zuzane Niederdorfer (Univerza za glasbo in upodabljajočo umetnost Gradec).

 

Pia Landeker

»Glasba je nekaj, s čimer lahko izražaš svoje misli ne glede na to kakšne volje si.« Pia  je ena najmlajših zmagovalk, vendar že ima velike načrte za svojo glasbeno prihodnost. Med drugim bi rada postala učiteljica klavirja. Izobražuje se pod mentorstvom profesorice Jerneje Grebenšek (GŠ Fran Korun Koželjski, Velenje)

      

      Tobija Avšič

»Glasba je lahko tudi sprostitev.« Tobija Avšič je najmlajši zlati pianist, ki pa se je s klavirjem  srečal že zelo zgodaj. Med njegovim dosežki je zato že sedem zlatih, pet srebrnih in eno bronasto priznanje z uglednih domačih in mednarodnih tekmovanj. Muzicira tudi v klavirskem duu in komornem godalnem triu. Njegov najljubši skladatelj je W.A. Mozart. Tobija deluje pod mentorstvom profesorice Damijane Avšič.   

 

     Kako bomo porabili denar

Snemanje, editing, mix, mastering in uglaševanje (6X): 2.640,00 EUR

Izdelava CD in promocijske borišure: 1.600,00 EUR

Design & Foto: 900,00 EUR

 

Skupaj: 5.140,00 EUR 

 

Za kaj bomo porabili presežek denarja – če do njega pride 

2.100 EUR predstavlja le del proračuna za celovito izvedbo. Del sredstev poskušamo pridobiti še na druge načine. Zato bo presežek zelo dobrodošel. Porabili ga bomo za art work, promocijo in za organizacijo koncerta. 

 

Kdo stoji za projektom

PianoRoom in Zveza slovenskih glasbenih šol. PianoRoom www.pianoroom.si je sicer specializiran studio za snemanje klavirske glasbe. Naše širše poslanstvo pa je približevanje kakovostne glasbe širši publiki in pomoč pri uveljavitvi mladih glasbenikov. Projekt Zlati pianisti smo prvič izpeljali leta 2016. Naletel je na odličen odziv.  Ogledate si ga lahko na spodnji povezavi.

(Zasebnik) Zakaj potrebujemo vašo podporoZato, ker je nismo dobili od institucij ali minstrstev. »Ploščo lahko obrnemo« in izdamo edino z vašim sodelovanjem. S tem ko kupite CD plošček ali enega od paketov,  bomo pridobili sredstva za snemanje, uglaševanje klavirja (uglasili smo ga 6x), montažo, mešanje zvoka, mastering in izdelavo ploščka. 2.100 EUR predstavlja le del proračuna za celovito izvedbo. Sredstva poskušamo pridobiti še na druge načine, vendar se še najbolj zanesemo na vas:)Urban Stanič»Sanjam o občutku, ko se na odru čas ustavi in postane glasba vse, kar obstaja.«Urban Stanič je zmagovalec slovenskega izbora za tekmovanje Evrovizijski mladi glasbeniki 2014 in prejemnik 2. nagrade na finalnem tekmovanju v Kölnu. Kot solist je večkrat sodeloval z najvidnejšimi slovenskimi orkestri in osvajal visoke nagrade na mednarodnih in državnih tekmovanjih. Deluje pod vodstvom profesorice Dubravke Tomšič Srebotnjak. (Akademija za glasbo v Ljubljani). Nastasja Češnjevar Ušumović»Kar v življenju pride zlahka ne ostane dolgo, do tega kar ti bo sledilo skozi življenje pa ni mogoče ubirati bližnjice. Zato se trudim in garam, da si zagotovim, da bodo glasba in literatura vedno ob moji strani.« Nastasja je vsestranska umetnica, ki piše že svoj drugi roman. Na 48. TEMSIG-u je osvojia 100 točk. Zmaguje pa tudi na številnih mednarodnih tekmovanjih. Izobražuje se pod vodstvom  profesorice Valentine Češnjevar. (Glasbena šola Koper) Kako lahko še pomagateZelo veliko lahko naredite s tem, da novico o Zlatih pianistih razširite med svojimi prijatelji glasbe na družbenih omrežjih in mailing listah. Če dodate k temu še kakšno dobro besedo, še toliko bolje.   Vid Ibic»Ko glasbe ne izvajam, jo poslušam.« Vid je izjemen v vsem kar počne. Osvojil je že 20 nagrad na pomembnih tekmovanjih. Na TEMSIG-u je prvič zmagal leta 2016. Nastopa tudi kot solist z orkestri, med katerimi je njegov najljubši nastop v Italiji, kjer je izvajal 2. In 3. stavek Beethovenovega koncerta. Deluje pod vodstvom profesorice Selme Chicco Hajdin (Umetniška gimnazija Koper) in profesorice Zuzane Niederdorfer (Univerza za glasbo in upodabljajočo umetnost Gradec). Pia Landeker»Glasba je nekaj, s čimer lahko izražaš svoje misli ne glede na to kakšne volje si.« Pia  je ena najmlajših zmagovalk, vendar že ima velike načrte za svojo glasbeno prihodnost. Med drugim bi rada postala učiteljica klavirja. Izobražuje se pod mentorstvom profesorice Jerneje Grebenšek (GŠ Fran Korun Koželjski, Velenje)            Tobija Avšič»Glasba je lahko tudi sprostitev.« Tobija Avšič je najmlajši zlati pianist, ki pa se je s klavirjem  srečal že zelo zgodaj. Med njegovim dosežki je zato že sedem zlatih, pet srebrnih in eno bronasto priznanje z uglednih domačih in mednarodnih tekmovanj. Muzicira tudi v klavirskem duu in komornem godalnem triu. Njegov najljubši skladatelj je W.A. Mozart. Tobija deluje pod mentorstvom profesorice Damijane Avšič.          Kako bomo porabili denarSnemanje, editing, mix, mastering in uglaševanje (6X): 2.640,00 EURIzdelava CD in promocijske borišure: 1.600,00 EURDesign & Foto: 900,00 EUR Skupaj: 5.140,00 EUR  Za kaj bomo porabili presežek denarja – če do njega pride 2.100 EUR predstavlja le del proračuna za celovito izvedbo. Del sredstev poskušamo pridobiti še na druge načine. Zato bo presežek zelo dobrodošel. Porabili ga bomo za art work, promocijo in za organizacijo koncerta.  Kdo stoji za projektomPianoRoom in Zveza slovenskih glasbenih šol. PianoRoom www.pianoroom.si je sicer specializiran studio za snemanje klavirske glasbe. Naše širše poslanstvo pa je približevanje kakovostne glasbe širši publiki in pomoč pri uveljavitvi mladih glasbenikov. Projekt Zlati pianisti smo prvič izpeljali leta 2016. Naletel je na odličen odziv.  Ogledate si ga lahko na spodnji povezavi.

story:
Cherry Chérie en bref


Pour être bref, Cherry Chérie, c'est quatre musiciens, Étienne, Paolo, Alexandre et Gabriel, (communément appelés le monstre à quatre têtes), qui, aux alentours de l'an 2010, sont happés par une illumination :  parcourir le Québec en reprenant les grands classiques des années 50-60. Pourquoi? Pour s'amuser, certes, mais surtout pour extérioriser cette musique qui les habite de bord en bord de leur existence.
Petit à petit et très sournoisement, à travers la bordée de spectacles qui s'enchaînent, quelques chansons jaillissent du ventre du monstre et sont dévoilées au grand jour en octobre 2013 dans un premier EP de cinq titres. L' éboulement d'évènements qui s'ensuit (ainsi qu'un gros brin de folie) amène nos quatre lurons à se lancer à bras-le-corps dans la grande traversée de la Forêt Noire, cette forêt qui est tellement dense qu'aucun rayon de soleil ne parvient à se frayer un chemin jusqu'au sol. En des termes moins métaphoriques, Cherry Chérie tente le destin. Les jobs de messieurs prennent le bord et s'entame la  production d'un album complet à l'automne 2014.
En cohérence avec sa mission originale, voire originelle (faire vivre la musique des années 50-60), Cherry Chérie aborde la production de l'album "J'entends la bête" avec un souci quasi religieux d'authenticité. C'est dans le son et la technique d'enregistrement que la magie doit s'effectuer. Le magicien, Simon Gauthier, muni de ses nombreux trésors sonores vintage, recruté dans sa caverne d'Ali Baba est devenu rapidement cinquième membre du groupe :  il guidera ultimement nos quatre chérubins dans leur épopée créative. 
 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez


  • Les dons que nous allons recueillir nous permettront de faire la duplication d'albums physique et de vinyles; 
  • Nous investirons des montants dans la promotion de l'album, le pistage radio et les relations de presse; 
  • En te procurant l'un des forfaits offerts, tu seras choyé(e) par les membres de Cherry Chérie. Chaque forfait est unique et offert uniquement dans le cadre de cette campagne;
  • Tu pourrais même avoir une chanson à ton nom ou mettre la main sur la première guitare électrique que nous avons utilisée en spectacle!

Cherry Chérie fonde sa propre maison de disques : Les Productions Forêt Noire


Au cours des dernières années, nous avons découvert à quel point le monde regorge d'amateurs de rock n'roll...Et ils attendent impatiemment l'occasion de twister et de se mouvoir le popotin. C'est entre autres grâce à cette énergie transmise par notre public pendant nos spectacles et à l'enthousiasme généré par notre mini-album que nous nous sommes décidés à enregistrer un premier opus, qui l'espère-t-on, sera un catalyseur à cette folie qui habite chacun d'entre-nous. 

Comme nous étions un groupe 100% indépendant, nous avons pris la décision de fonder notre propre maison de disques, Les Productions Forêt Noire. Cet album est donc la première production de notre boîte et nous assumons l'entièreté des coûts de production et de commercialisation de l'album. Nous avons fait ce choix en toute connaissance de cause et bien que les risques financiers soient plus importants, nous conservons toute notre liberté créative et pouvons demeurer encore plus près de notre public. 

C'est donc pour propager le plus possible l'amour du rock n' roll que nous souhaitons que tu participes à cette campagne afin de donner le plus de rayonnement possible à l'album J'entends la bête et à donner le coup d'envoi à notre maison de disques. 

Une dernière confidence pour toi qui t'es rendu jusqu'ici dans le texte. Derrière cette noble mission qui nous anime (partager notre passion pour la musique), se cache un dessein infâme... Oui. Et nous te l'annonçons aujourd'hui et à toi seul :

Nous voulons te faire danser, faire gronder ta bête et la faire jaillir au grand jour. Mais aussi, on veut former des couples, de tous genres, éphémères ou éternels, peu importe... Et ultimement nous atteindrons notre finalité... Faire rayonner le Québec avec un deuxième "Baby Boom".

story:
Dear Music lovers, Friends & extended family members!

This is an invitation to take part, co-create and support the birth of a musical collection to be shared, like Pearls of life's journey:

SatSong - A rosary of heart songs

After so many requests to record them it is finally the right time!

Insights and inspirations created through the community wisdom inherent in all of us.

Including the musical gifts of Deva Premal, Manose and many more incredible musicians, co-produced with Avishai Barnatan.

My name is Amir Paiss, and I've been singing and writing since childhood. I co-founded SHEVA, the Hebrew Arab world music ensemble with which I toured and performed all over Israel, in Europe, the U.S and in Australia, where I have resided for over a decade now. For the last 20 years I have produced music, performed and facilitated workshops focused on establishing Heart, Mind & Body connections through sacred song, vocal practices, natural healing and Interfaith prayers and gatherings.

Satsang is the Sanskrit word for Being in Truth, that's why I have decided to call this album SatSong, as these songs are resonating with what I can only describe as Truth... At times we call it Love, Freedom, and it's always about making connection. 

This is my first English language album. Some of the songs have been with me for years and are being sung in circles and sacred ceremonies around the world, some are more recent and some are newly born. 

This is how the funds will be used:

The sum I am aiming for is $22,000, to include all production and post production costs. 


As many of these songs are inspired by and shared in circle, it is great to create it with the communal involvement. What you contribute is reflected in the album, energetically and in actuality as you receive an offering, and thus we participate in this co-creation, we give and receive. 

The offerings (or Perks in Indiegogo's language) vary from a digital download of the album, to your very own Personal custom made song, designed for you. It's amazingly exciting to be able to share in this way, knowing there is a real exchange amongst our extended local and global community members.

The Impact

I believe in the power of songs and I know first hand that songs can change lives, as songs have shaped my own life's experience. I believe that what comes from the heart can touch the heart. This album is soothing and mostly gentle, spiced with smiles and tears of devotion, surrender, and joy. Your contribution will not only help in manifesting this creation but also act as a proof that we can collaborate as people and grow into a different mode of operation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share it with your community and spread the word!

The songs are written, the musicians are available, the instruments are in tune, the studio is open and so is my heart. Now is the Time, please join in!

story:
IF YOU MISSED OUT ON CONTRIBUTING TO OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN, DON'T WORRY! IT'S NOT TOO LATE!!!

All future DONATIONS should be made out to Veronica C. Combs and sent to:
Veronica C. Combs
2758 22nd Street
San Francisco, CA 94110

If you want to send via PayPal, use email vixen_noir@hotmail.com; for direct online bank deposit/transfer, use veronica.combs@yahoo.com (Bank of America).

THANK YOU!!! Vixen

Mad love SHOUT OUTs and THANK YOUs to everybody who contributed their time, energy, prayers, well-wishes, money, encouragement and more to helping Blackesque: The Queerotic Music Tour get on the road! You helped us raise $1560, YAAAAY! The net amount we get is $1372.80. Below is how it breaks down:

Raised to date                                            $1,560.00

Indiegogo fees deducted                        -     140.40

Payment processor fees deducted     -       46.80 (3%)

Not Yet Disbursed                                     $ 1,372.80

Please continue to send out POSITIVE energy for us, SHARE the news with your friends and community and keep the momentum going! We still need to raise an additional $2127 to cover our travel expenses and get the tour on the road! Don't be shy about SPREADING THE WORD. We truly appreciate it!

HERE'S WHAT WE NEED (These are ACTUAL COSTS):

*Van Rental (21 days)                                                               $ 1610

     Insurance

          Damage Waiver ($19.99/day)                                           420

          Medical ($3.00/day)                                                             63

          Roadside ($4.99/day)                                                         105

          Liability ($12.44/day)                                                          262

Total Van Rental                                                                        $ 2460

Gas (for entire journey)                                                                 540

RT Airfare (for headlining Artist Kaoz)                                      500

TOTAL TO GET US AND KEEP US ON THE ROAD              $ 3500

 

*This was the cheapest we could find in regard to van rental. We will be renting from SFO Airport Van Rental, 650 952-5543. Here is the link to our reservation, which does not include the insurance costs: https://www.acerentacar.com/ViewBooking.aspx?29.... 

Kaoz


The EROTIC is a measure between our sense of self and the chaos of our strongest feelings… For the EROTIC is not a question only of what we do; it is a question of how acutely and fully we can feel in the doing. Once we know the extent to which we are capable of feeling that sense of satisfaction and completion, we can then observe which of our various life endeavors bring us closest to that fullness. ~ Audre Lorde

Hey SupaStars!

What’s up?! I have wonderful news to share with you! But first, for those of you who don’t know me, I’m Vixen Noir (aka Veronica C. Combs). I am a San Francisco, soon-to-be Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, recording artist, performance artist, producer and director. I released my debut EP, DANGEROUS earlier this year and NOW, it's time to really start promoting it. One of the most important and fun ways to promote a new album is to hit the road and take the music to the people!

To do this, I created BLACKESQUE: The QueEROTIC Music Tour, the first and only Music and Burlesque tour featuring an all-Black Queer line-up of show-stopping music artists accentuated by some of the most talented burlesque artists this country has to offer! This inaugural tour is the West Coast Edition, kicking off in Los Angeles, with stops in Phoenix, Flagstaff, Albuquerque, Denver, Seattle, Tacoma, Portland, Eugene, Sacramento, Oakland, and ending in San Francisco!

WHY BLACKESQUE?

My biggest passions are Music, Burlesque, and uplifting and supporting Black and Brown Queer folk to reclaim and celebrate their EROTIC POWER. I’ve been wanting to create a tour to promote my music and all of who I am as an Artist and a person. So I thought, why not a tour that incorporates and celebrates my biggest passions? And why not have other amazing, talented Black Queer Artists join me?

One of my biggest motivations for creating BLACKESQUE is to donate 10% of the proceeds, from fundraising and ticket sales, to an organization that advocates for the lives and welfare of LGBTQ Youth of Color. The beneficiary for this first tour is BreakOUT!, an organization that seeks to end the criminalization of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth to build a safer and more just New Orleans. 

   

http://www.youthbreakout.org/

I also created the tour to provide Black Queer Artists, who are rarely acknowledged, seen, or heard in the music and entertainment industries, with the opportunity to showcase their talents to larger LGBTQ audiences and allies beyond their own backyard. 

WHO WILL BE TAKING THE STAGE?

The all-star line-up features

Alternative Dance-Pop-Soul Artist, Vixen Noir (San Francisco/Los Angeles, CA) 


Alt-Pop Singer-Songwriter, Kim Tillman (Los Angeles, CA)

Hip Hop/Rap Artist, Kaoz (Minneapolis, MN)

and local music and burlesque artists will also join the line-up when the tour hits their city.

HOW CAN I HELP?

We are so excited about this tour and we hope you are too! We’ve already put so much work into it, and we’re very close to finalizing the tour schedule. Yay! But, we need your help to get the tour on the road! Your contribution of $1, $10, $20, $500, $1000, or whatever you can give will make a huge difference! To show our appreciation, we are offering some awesome perks! We just know you will be excited about them! MP3 and album downloads, VIP Tickets, autographed CDs, posters and so much more! And remember, you will also be supporting BreakOUT, one of the only safe havens for LGBTQ Youth of Color in New Orleans!

WHAT WILL MY CONTRIBUTION COVER?

Your support will help cover travel expenses (van rental, insurance, gas, tolls, parking), airfare for one Artist (Kaoz), accommodations for 2 nights (otherwise, community members from each city will host us in their homes), fliers & posters and venue rental. And if you aren’t able to contribute at this time, don’t fret! SPREADING THE WORD is a HUGE help to us. Indiegogo makes it really easy for you to share this campaign with your friends and family. 

THE IMPACT WE HOPE FOR?

With the current climate of racist Police Brutality and the alarming number of Black Trans Women being murdered, it is our hope that BLACKESQUE: The QueEROTIC Music Tour can make a difference. It is our hope that through our music, our voices, our dance, our PRESENCE, we are able to reflect the brilliance that is BLACK, the beauty that is BLACK, the strength and power that is BLACK, the EROTIC that is BLACK; to declare our SupaStardom, resonating the message loud and clear, #BLACKLIVESMATTER!

Mad love…

Vixen Noir
