HERE'S WHAT WE NEED (These are ACTUAL COSTS):*Van Rental (21 days)                                                               $ 1610     Insurance          Damage Waiver ($19.99/day)                                           420          Medical ($3.00/day)                                                             63          Roadside ($4.99/day)                                                         105          Liability ($12.44/day)                                                          262Total Van Rental                                                                        $ 2460Gas (for entire journey)                                                                 540RT Airfare (for headlining Artist Kaoz)                                      500TOTAL TO GET US AND KEEP US ON THE ROAD              $ 3500 *This was the cheapest we could find in regard to van rental. We will be renting from SFO Airport Van Rental, 650 952-5543. Here is the link to our reservation, which does not include the insurance costs: https://www.acerentacar.com/ViewBooking.aspx?29.... KaozThe EROTIC is a measure between our
sense of self and the chaos of our strongest feelings… For the EROTIC is not a
question only of what we do; it is a question of how acutely and fully we can
feel in the doing. Once we know the extent to which we are capable of feeling
that sense of satisfaction and completion, we can then observe which of our
various life endeavors bring us closest to that fullness. ~ Audre Lorde
Hey
SupaStars! 
What’s
up?! I have wonderful news to share with you! But first, for those of you who
don’t know me, I’m Vixen Noir (aka Veronica C. Combs). I am a San
Francisco, soon-to-be Los Angeles-based singer,
songwriter, recording artist, performance artist, producer and director. I
released my debut EP, DANGEROUS earlier this year and NOW, it's time to really
start promoting it. One of the most important and fun ways to promote a new
album is to hit the road and take the music to the people! To do
this, I created BLACKESQUE: The QueEROTIC Music Tour, the first and only Music
and Burlesque tour featuring an all-Black Queer line-up of show-stopping music
artists accentuated by some of the most talented burlesque artists this country
has to offer! This inaugural tour is the West Coast Edition, kicking off in Los Angeles, with stops in Phoenix,
Flagstaff, Albuquerque, Denver, Seattle, Tacoma, Portland, Eugene, Sacramento,
Oakland, and ending in San Francisco!WHY BLACKESQUE? 
My
biggest passions are Music, Burlesque, and uplifting and supporting Black and
Brown Queer folk to reclaim and celebrate their EROTIC POWER. I’ve been wanting
to create a tour to promote my music and all of who I am as an Artist and a
person. So I thought, why not a tour that incorporates and celebrates my
biggest passions? And why not have other amazing, talented Black Queer Artists
join me? 
One
of my biggest motivations for creating BLACKESQUE is to donate 10% of the
proceeds, from fundraising and ticket sales, to an organization that advocates
for the lives and welfare of LGBTQ Youth of Color. The beneficiary for this
first tour is BreakOUT!, an organization that seeks to end the criminalization of lesbian, gay, bisexual,
transgender, and questioning youth to build a safer and more just New Orleans.    http://www.youthbreakout.org/I also created the tour to
provide Black Queer Artists, who are rarely acknowledged, seen, or heard in the
music and entertainment industries, with the opportunity to showcase their
talents to larger LGBTQ audiences and allies beyond their own backyard.  
WHO WILL BE TAKING THE
STAGE?

The
all-star line-up features  Alternative Dance-Pop-Soul Artist,
Vixen Noir (San Francisco/Los Angeles, CA)  Alt-Pop Singer-Songwriter, Kim Tillman (Los Angeles,
CA) Hip Hop/Rap Artist, Kaoz (Minneapolis, MN)and local music and burlesque artists will also
join the line-up when the tour hits their city.HOW CAN I HELP?
We are so excited about this tour and we hope you
are too! We’ve already put so much work into it, and we’re very close to
finalizing the tour schedule. Yay! But, we need your help to get the tour on
the road! Your contribution of $1, $10, $20, $500, $1000, or whatever you can
give will make a huge difference! To show our appreciation, we are offering some awesome perks! We just know you will be excited about them! MP3 and album downloads, VIP Tickets, autographed CDs, posters and so much more! And remember, you will also be supporting
BreakOUT, one of the only safe havens for LGBTQ Youth of Color in New Orleans!
WHAT WILL MY CONTRIBUTION
COVER?
Your support will help cover travel
expenses (van rental, insurance, gas, tolls, parking), airfare for one Artist (Kaoz),
accommodations for 2 nights (otherwise, community members from each city will
host us in their homes), fliers & posters and venue rental. And if you aren’t
able to contribute at this time, don’t fret! SPREADING THE WORD is a HUGE help
to us. Indiegogo makes it really easy for you to share this campaign with your friends and family. THE IMPACT WE HOPE FOR?
With the current climate of racist
Police Brutality and the alarming number of Black Trans Women being murdered,
it is our hope that BLACKESQUE: The QueEROTIC Music Tour can make a difference.
It is our hope that through our music, our voices, our dance, our PRESENCE, we
are able to reflect the brilliance that is BLACK, the beauty that is BLACK, the
strength and power that is BLACK, the EROTIC that is BLACK; to declare our
SupaStardom, resonating the message loud and clear, #BLACKLIVESMATTER!
Mad love…
Vixen Noir

story:
What is OpCon?

OpCon is a project that focuses on bringing critical conversations around race, gender, resistance, history, improvisation, struggle and healing to experimental and creative music spaces world wide. We attempt to rehistoricize the role of folks of color in improvisation at home (the US) and abroad and bring in depth understanding to the role of capitalism and white supremacy to the erasure of those histories. We also focus on the ways in which improvisation can be used as strategies for resistance, and especially ways that improvisation and creative music performance can be used as a mode of resilience in marginalized communities.

We perform together (some dope music) and talk together.

Why are you going to Europe?

We have been accepted into the International Society of Improvised Music Annual Festival. We are presenting our unique workshop and performance series and have been invited to do a number of concerts in neighboring countries and cities including in Paris, Berlin, Amsterdam, and Geneva. We are doing a research project in conjunction with our performance and workshop, interviewing organizations and people of color in creative and experimental music in these specific spaces. We hope to learn resistance strategies and gain insight into individual experiences.

You can learn about the ISIM here: http://www.improvisedmusic.org/index.html

DONATIONS GO TO:

Airfare: $3000 ($1500 / person)

Registration: $150 ($75 / person)

Hostel Fees over 5 cities: $1000 ($200 / person)

EU Travel Pass: $260 ($130 / person)

All donations go to our travel costs. We literally cannot go without your support. It's really important to both of us to make this work global. The decolonization struggle is an international affaire, and making these connections between our aesthetics, art practices, and our material struggle is necessary for us to foster an awakened culture of resiliency!



What is this workshop?

This workshop creates intersectional conversations around resistance, music, race, gender, and spirituality. We will highlight the cultural work that we conduct via our workshop series Oppositional Consciousness (OpCon) which primarily involves empowering people of color with historicizing poc in improvisation,  and then open up discussion. To continue the legacy of oppositional consciousness, ‘appropriate’ interventions to oppression, and the establishment of emancipatory sites of opposition, we are investigating a process called Decolonizing the Imagination created by Chicana feminist Chela Sandoval. This work has been developed to (1) decode experiences & interventions pertaining to oppressive factors in society; (2) acquire a shared identity, vernacular and worldview amongst allies; and (3) deploy healthy and critical formations of both emancipatory technologies and engagement democratic solutions.

As an arts practicum for musicians and non-musicians alike, we unravel imprinted ideologies of dominance and harm rampant in our society and consciousness. Utilizing the modified Harm Free Zone framework, social science methods (worksheet) and developing & enacting OpCon, we can better analyze and address causes & inflections of harm embedded on our communities, our world-views & on the band stand.

FORMAT

  • Opening with Introductions and Sharing

  • Political and Musical Moments & Sharing Our Work through Oppositional Consciousness

  • Worksheet:

    • 7 Questions on allyship, resistance, identity, struggle, and presence in performance as a means of liberation.

  • Sharing: How can we use our performance and sounds as a language that challenges systemic, institutional, and interpersonal violence? Open discussion on Oppositional Consciousness
---

HISTORY

Focus on Oakland, CA & Applied Cultural Work in Sites of Opposition

In 2014 a small group of African American and South Asian Creative Musicians based in Oakland, CA (USA) organized a series of cultural events that challenged, transformed and buttressed current modes of community-based resistance technologies. This "fighting formation" engendered new dynamics in our relationships as musicians, laborers & cultural workers, social scientists and activists. Oppositional Consciousness (OpCon), as a social science, analytical and performance platform, is an emergent intervention bridging modes of artists labor-value towards a decolonized imagination, in which differential movement & democratic formations move beyond the plane of the stage into street-level practices. OpCon utilizes aspects of US Third World Feminist Chela Sandoval’s 5 Technologies of the Methodologies of the Oppressed and former Black Panther/Black Liberation Army (BPP/BLA) political prisoner Russell Shoatz’ "Black Fighting Formations" as jumping off point tied to history and deep analyses of resistance formations.

OpCon members include 

Zachary James Watkins (http://zacharyjameswatkins.com/)

Sharmi Basu (www.sharmi.info // www.soundcloud.com/olgadagod)  

Marshall Trammell (http://mrtrammell.wix.com/researchstrategies)

Sharmi & Marshall will represent OpCon for this workshop series.


DESTINATIONS

Berlin, Germany

Paris, France

Amsterdam, Netherlands

Geneva, Switzerland

Chateau de Duex, Switzerland

-----

BIOS

SHARMI BASU is an Oakland born and based queer South Asian woman of color creating experimental music as a means of decolonizing musical language. She attempts to catalyze a political, yet ethereal aesthetic by combining her anti-colonial and anti-imperialist politics with a commitment to spirituality within the arts. She is a MFA graduate from Mills College in Electronic Music and Recording Media and has worked with Fred Frith, Roscoe Mitchell, John Bischoff, Dr. Nalini Ghuman, Maggi Payne, Pauline Oliveros, and more. She teaches electronic music and multimedia classes at Ex'pression College and hosts DIY workshops in Decolonial Aesthetics. She also hosts a people-of-color performance and improvisation collective called MARA Performance group every other Wednesday in North Oakland.

http://www.sharmi.info

MARSHALL TRAMMELL is a cultural producer & Creative Music percussionist for 20+ years  and  responsible for such Bay Area music series as Decolonizing the Imagination. He was recruited for a MFA Fellowship in Electronic Arts at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in 2004. He now sits on the Board of Directors of the Merced County Arts Council in California. Mr Trammell has shared a stage with John Tchicai, Roscoe Mitchell, Pauline Oliveros, Jon Jang, Francis Wong, India Cooke, Dylan Carlson of Earth and more.

http://mrtrammell.wix.com/researchstrategies



Beast Nest taken by Joseph Dwyer


Marshall Trammell in Black Spirituals

story:
Inspired by passionate audience demand, we now feel both a responsibility and urgency to finish production on the recording project that was started in celebrated documentary, Lowdown Tracks. And we need your support!

For those of you who haven't seen the film--please do!  Director Shelley Saywell  takes us on a challenging journey to the back streets of Toronto where we are introduced to six unforgettable musicians with lived experience of homelessness. Giving a voice to the otherwise voiceless, Lowdown Tracks has been hailed as a highly effective call to action documentary that explores mental health stigma, Canada's housing crisis and above all hope and the healing powers of music.

The film was created in collaboration with Singer / Activist Lorraine Segato and features music never heard or recorded before, from people who should be listened to.

“The songs they’ve written come directly from their experiences – the hell of their lives,” says Segato, who was first exposed to the caliber of street music at a benefit concert for homeless relief.

From folk, punk hobo, Americana, and blues, their music resonates with hard times, eerily resembles past times, and throws a new perspective on our times. 

Introducing: Katt-Budd (above), Bruce Bathgate, Woody Cormier,

Maryanne Epp and Chris Dempster.

"Heartbreaking... the talent is wondrous." NOW Magazine

When they strap on their guitars -and this is the film's genius- it's possible to envision every one of them on a stage in front of hundreds of people. They're that good." - Hamilton Spectator

Let's make the Music Heals recording project happen together:


Our campaign goal

We need to raise $10,000 to get the job done. This involves a final sound edit and selection of authentic location recordings; as well as heading back to the studio with each musician for a day to get professionally polished tracks of their original songs. Lastly, there are costs associated with packaging and producing CDs and digital files.

The recordings will be made available for download online and CDs will be sold at future screenings and community events. (Read more about our  screening tour at www.lowdowntracks4impact.com)

Proceeds go directly to the featured musicians and help local groups raise awareness and support for their efforts to solve homelessness.

All Indiegogo contributions over $20 automatically receive a complimentary CD/set of recordings when they are complete!

Thank you for believing in the healing power of music! 


Sincerely, 

Shelley Saywell
Director/Writer/Producer

Deborah Parks
Producer

story:
Hello!

We are "America's Sweethearts" and we can't wait to share our music with you! Thank you for visiting our page and for joining us as we begin this musical journey of "History Through Harmony." 

                               

  • We are a group of 10 fabulous singers, based out of New York City, with experience singing in jazz, musical theater, and opera. We've had the honor of performing in exciting venues from Madison Square Garden, Lincoln Center, and 54 Below in New York City to the Theatre du Chatelet in Paris and the Sony Sound Stage in Los Angeles! We've also stormed the stage in national television singing competitions as well as Broadway musical national tours across the country.
  • We met each other singing the music of the Andrews Sisters and have loved the musical homage to the 1930s-1940s WWII era of music. Because of this inspiration, we travel in trios and keep the harmony alive. We have also expanded our repertoire to the decades of 1910-2010, bringing you a "century of sweetness!"
  • "America's Sweethearts" is a new venture for us. We want to share our music across the country and globally, and we need some help to cover our initial costs of starting this group. 

How you can help!

We've met so many wonderful people along our travels, and we want to continue to sing for you! We also want to grow our company and meet even more folks through future performances!

  • It takes a lot to start a new company, and we have put in lots of work on our own to make this happen. We are resourceful, hard working, unstoppable New Yorkers (though we hail from various parts of the country), but we need your help to make sure we make this group as strong as it can be from the start.
  • Your donations will help us buy the sound equipment, costumes, and publicity materials (videos, photos, marketing materials) we need to jumpstart our group.
  • Our goal of $15,000 covers our rehearsal costs, costumes, handmade hats (!) shoes, a photoshoot, and musical equipment needs, in addition to website and LLC costs. If we don't make our goal (but hopefully we WILL because we have such amazing family, friends, and fans!), all of the funds we get will still go toward these items.

Mission and Vision

We met each other singing the music of The Andrews Sisters. This is an era of music that we want to preserve and share with future generations. We also want to pay tribute to the veterans and their families who grew up with this music, whether it's the Bing Crosby and Andrews Sisters music of the World War II era, or the Doo Wop golden oldies that charmed our hearts and rocked the nation. We are expanding our audience worldwide and want to bring the classic hits of each decade wherever we go. There is such a rich history that can be told through the musical eras; our music has brought a great deal of joy to those who hear it and it has made so many people feel young and inspired again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for contributing to our campaign. We'd also love if you could help us spread the word and encourage your friends and family to help! Please share our page via Facebook, email, and Twitter! Be sure to check out our website for more info, photos, and to "Meet the Sweets!"

story:
What We Need & What You Get

The Pros and Cons:

  • We are needing only 1,000.00 within 30 days! We are needing this for new music, new merchandise, and to help us with food on the road.
  • We can't even described how excited we are to get out on the road and showing off our new unique sound with you guys! 
  • If we don't reach our goal, then it'll take a long time to get more music out. (sad face)
  • HERE'S WHAT YOU GET WHEN YOU HELP US OUT!
  • Any Donations UNDER $25.00 will get you our E.P. and new single FREE with an invitation to be in our next music video!
  • Donations OVER $25.00 will get our E.P., New Single, and a t-shirt FREE
  • Donations OVER $50.00 will Get everything above plus 2 tickets to any of our upcoming shows
  • Donations OVER $100.00 will Get Everything above plus 2 tickets and an extra new t-shirt with a physical copy of our EP Signed by everyone 
  • Thanks for Reading this and hope to catch all of you guys at our show soon!

story:
Summary 

My name is Korey. My friends call me Korey Kingston. I am a professional drummer, music teacher, and the owner and creator of Drum Brigade. This Indiegogo campaign is so exciting for me because I've wanted to launch this project for a LONG time. I've started a unique collaboration project with some of my favorite musicians in San Diego. But even more exciting is that I am doing this music project with my dad- Kim "Pops" Horn. Pops and I have both had separate music careers over the years. We've occasionally played together on each others gigs from time to time, but NOTHING like this! 

It all started with an impromptu experiment on a gig with Pops. We thought it would be fun to try a vocal rendition of Coltrane's Naima in a Roots Reggae feel. What happened was amazing! It allowed Pops and I to play comfortably in two different styles of music, at the same time!  From then on, if we were playing Naima, it was played as a Jazz/ Reggae song. The rest is history...

Combining two styles of music: Pop's style of Classic Jazz and my style of Classic Jamaican rhythms is what Shuffle & Bang is all about! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise the funds to launch this unique music project/ collaboration between some amazing musicians and a father and his son. We want to do this on the level we believe this project deserves. Every penny of your donations will contribute to this project. Our $10,000 goal will give us the funds to:

  • Release a debut album as digital download, and vinyl record
  • Song licensing (for cover songs)
  • Studio time to record
  • Album artwork
  • Purchase band merchandise 
    • Tee shirts
    • Sweat shirts/ hoodies
    • Stickers
    • Other merch
  • Purchase band branding tools
    • logo
    • stage backdrop
    • music stands with band logo
    • kickdrum logo
    • Other
  • Band Photoshoot
  • Band Music Video
  • Tour Expenses 
  • and more

Your help on this campaign will help us in amazing ways!

We have some amazing perks to offer. Some of our perks include receiving a digital download before anyone else, receiving a secret bonus track you can only get through this campaign, special Shuffle & Bang merchandise, and more. You can even hire us for a private event!

 

The Impact

Throughout my career I've played in a lot of different bands. I've toured all over the world with different bands (The Aggrolites, Hepcat, Tim Armstrong, Western Standard Time, Sharp Shock, Suedehead). I've played on a lot of albums. But never my own band. And more importantly I've never had the opportunity to record and be in an official music project with my dad. In fact, I don't know any musicians who have had that unique opportunity. Thats what makes this project so special! 

Through out this journey we have faced a few challenges. Mostly financially. This is a DIY band, meaning we have literally done everything on our own. Musicians have donated their time and energy playing, recording, writing charts, arranging tunes. Pops and I did all the web design, video filming and editing. But all along the way, the entire band has pulled together, out of sheer belief in the project. All the musicians in this group are full-time, working musicians. We all use music as our profession to make a living. Getting the financial backing to support this project would mean we could do this at the level this project deserves and have the tools to do it right!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with others! 

Telling people in person is also a big help. In this day and age we sometimes forget that the old-fashioned word of mouth works too.

Host a fundraising show at your house?  Contact us if you're interested: www.shuffle&bang.com

If you've made it to the bottom of this campaign, thanks for reading!  Please share, please share, PLEASE SHARRRRRRE! :)

Thanks again!
story_txt:
Summary 
My name is Korey. My friends call me Korey Kingston. I am a professional drummer, music teacher, and the owner and creator of Drum Brigade. This Indiegogo campaign is so exciting for me because I've wanted to launch this project for a LONG time. I've started a unique collaboration project with some of my favorite musicians in San Diego. But even more exciting is that I am doing this music project with my dad- Kim "Pops" Horn. Pops and I have both had separate music careers over the years. We've occasionally played together on each others gigs from time to time, but NOTHING like this! 
It all started with an impromptu experiment on a gig with Pops. We thought it would be fun to try a vocal rendition of Coltrane's Naima in a Roots Reggae feel. What happened was amazing! It allowed Pops and I to play comfortably in two different styles of music, at the same time!  From then on, if we were playing Naima, it was played as a Jazz/ Reggae song. The rest is history...
Combining two styles of music: Pop's style of Classic Jazz and my style of Classic Jamaican rhythms is what Shuffle & Bang is all about! 
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise the funds to launch this unique music project/ collaboration between some amazing musicians and a father and his son. We want to do this on the level we believe this project deserves. Every penny of your donations will contribute to this project. Our $10,000 goal will give us the funds to:

story:
CELESTE IN THE SEVENTIES

The sound of PRINCIPE DI UN GIORNO can best be described as a very gentle interpretation of the symphonic prog scene with a lot folkish and classical music influences. A perfect combination of acoustic instruments like guitar, piano and wind-instruments with a slight electronic symphonic edge. Mellotrons all over the place!
 


The songwriting is very strong and has an atmospheric, devoted feel.

'I Talk to the Wind' of the King Crimson debut could be seen as a good point of reference here. Celeste's Principe di un Giorno has songs with this amazing impacts with the same amazing wind-instruments. A warm bath of acoustic/symphonic music.

A great artistic symphonic record from the italian progressive .scene. Due to it's different approach on the symphonic prog genre this is an excellent addition to almost any- ones collection.
This is a record about beauty, progressive and always gentle.

 

CELESTE NOW

46 years have passed since "La Danza del Fato" was written. In fact it was in September of 1972 that I met with Mariano Schiavolini to lay the foundations of what would become the CELESTE project.
So much time passed and about two years ago I felt a strong desire and the impulse to find myself immersed in those atmospheres again, in those spells that had been the most important and evident aspect of the adventure of PRINCIPE DI UN GIORNO

In addition over the years I have collected the invitation of many supporters, professionals who asked me to follow the first and only album of CELESTE.
And now I find myself happily talking about what is now no longer just an idea, an abstraction but also a reality.

The natural evolution of the Prince's path is ready. The seal of the registration has begun.
All the parts have been written, the lyrics that illustrate the new path of the solitary hero, who finds himself in a new world, have found the right words. The tests with all the musicians who will participate now have highlighted the goodness of the structures and the validity of the musical proposals.
Who loved the air that you breathed, and you breathe again listening to "Prince of a Day" can not fail to appreciate this new chapter where are repeated and consolidated the melodies, the harmonies, the sound of the same instruments, my beloved Mellotron 400, acoustic guitars, flutes and saxophones, the delicate touches of the small percussion reinvigorated by the presence of the acoustic drums.
Everything has been thought in respect of the true Spirit of CELESTE. A recovery dictated by the desire to recreate BEAUTY and to make it even more present and current.

There will be guest stars joining CELESTE:
Elisa Montaldo from Il TEMPIO DELLE CLESSIDRE
Alfio COSTA from PROWLERS & TILION

story:
The who, what and why of GG Amos~

 I've been honing my skills and carving my sound over a few decades. I released a few recordings but it's been a while. As a singer since the age of 4 or 5, and a guitar player since 10 years old, I've gone through several evolutions as a musician. 

 In the mid 80's I started really getting serious about learning blues music, and related styles such as rhythm & blues and jazz. Funk and funky beats always grabbed me! 

 During the 80's, 90's and 00's I had the privilege and pleasure of learning from the best around me: Sacramento legends Nate 'Snakeboy' Shiner, the late Johnny Heartsman, the late Gene Chambers..  then I was so lucky to get to know and play with Guitar Shorty, the late John Lee Hooker and more recently one of my top blues heroes, Chris Cain. Being on the San Francisco bay area scene for the last 10 years, I've grown even more as a singer and as a guitarist. Still learning .. also teaching others!  

 Fast forward to now– my style is still firmly rooted in blues tradition, but definitely a modern west coast sound, with jazz, funk and California latin elements to it. My songs are personal experiences of love, loneliness, empowerment, a good dose of humor and a take on the harsh realities of this world.

 This crowdfunding campaign is very important to me because it still takes money to produce a well crafted album, one that I feel will stand the test of time. Record labels used to cover these initial costs but the industry has changed to the point that it's on us artists to produce a product first– whether it gets picked up by a label later or stays independent. 

 As contributors, you all will be my Executive Producers! And not only will you receive a great album (or 2 or 3), you will get extra perks as well! See below for more about the perks! 

 And you will seriously help me to get to another level in the music universe >> radio play (airwaves and internet), magazine and blog reviews, help with publicists, agents and booking tours! 


What we are asking for & What you will get~

  • $28,000. is what we are asking. After Indiegogo takes its % we'll net around $26,300.
    SEE BUDGET BELOW 

    NOTE>>
    Indiegogo's platform fee on all funds raised is 5%. In addition, Stripe (credit card processor) charges a processing fee of 3% + 0.30 per transaction.

    This money will go to: Studio time (Initial tracking & overdubs), Musician fees (I'll be hiring 10-12 other musicians), Mixing & Mastering fees, Design & Layout for the CD/Album cover, Manufacturing of the product (including physical CDs, Vinyl LPs and Digital formats for download), and hiring a Publicist to spread the news Nationwide and beyond. 
     
  • PERKS! Depending on the amount of your contribution, you will not only get CDs (and high quality digital downloads of the entire album) but you may get a few extra autographed copies, 12" Vinyl LP!!, Extra download cards, T-shirts or Water canteens with the album artwork printed on them, Full color autographed Posters, Autographed Legacy photo, Lyric sheets, Private performances by my band! ..cool stuff!
     
  • Your Contribution! I really really hope to reach our final goal for this campaign, but even if we don't reach it all by the 60 day deadline, every bit of your contribution will be used for this project and nothing else!  That's a promise.


The Album~ "Content Under Pressure"

This is my album title and the title song is a fast, funky, humorous auto (audio?) biography of yours truly!   Also a play on words... :-)

10 original songs for you>>

  • Tell Me
  • My Sandbox
  • Dangerous Days
  • Man That U R
  • Right Now
  • Why Does Love
  • Come Down with the Blues
  • Weakness
  • Out of Your League
  • Content Under Pressure (Title Track!)

 Recording this album is so important to me .. to leave a piece of something beautiful, maybe thought provoking, maybe heart evoking.. or maybe dance inducing! This music will swing hard, some of it's driving, some are slow moody grooves, one has a super rhythmic latin beat, one is a reggae shuffle, and the title track 'Content Under Pressure' is funky as all get out! This album will be ear candy for your soul! 

 I will be producing this project with the help of some very seasoned, experienced professionals! 

 The Musicians:  Randy Lee Odell (drums); Artis 'AJ' Joyce (bass); Parris Bertolucci (organ/keys); Tony Stead (organ/keys); Greg Rahn (organ/keys); Sue McCracklin & Maureen Smith a.k.a. 'Sweet Nectar' (backing vocals); Salvador Aguilera (saxophone); Mike Rinta (trombone & horn section arrangements).

 All of these wonderful musicians have played and recorded with some of the biggest names in the industry– Ralph Carney, Charlie Musselwhite, Chris Cain, Jimmie McCracklin, John Lee Hooker, Lowell Fulson, The Dynatones, Sly & The Family Stone, Jimmie Vaughan, Buddy Guy, Elvin Bishop, Santana, The Gospel Hummingbirds, Chris Isaac, Ike Turner, Sista Monica Parker, Lydia Pense, The Pointer Sisters, Joe Louis Walker, The Coasters, The Drifters and so many others there's no room to list them all!  
I'm honored to be playing and recording with them! 

 The Engineer:  Robert Preston of GetReel Productions in San Francisco CA!  Robert has decades of engineering under his belt and has done countless projects in his very cool recording studio. He's warm, friendly, funny and knows his stuff!  I always feel comfortable here.


 The Mastering Maestro:  Gary Hobish of A. Hammer Mastering, also in San Francisco, has mastered thousands of recordings and is in demand by Major labels for re-mastering their back catalogs as well as making independent artists' records sound amazing. He truly has 'golden ears'! 


Challenges~

 Every recording project is a big undertaking. I have produced my own recordings in the past, and I always had a lot of help and guidance from those much more experienced than me. This will be no different. There will be a lot of pre-production planning and organizing. Lots of rehearsals before we go in to track. Time is money in the studio and we will be very mindful of that as we work. 

 The first challenge, obviously, is achieving our financial goal so that the rehearsals can be scheduled, the studio booked, even pre-ordering some of the perks you will get as our Executive producers!   

 Another challenge is to stay within our budget throughout the whole process; from the first day of  rehearsal to delivering the finished product and perks to you.
I have a detailed outline of  the process and have already been coordinating with my studio engineer Robert Preston on a schedule and timeline. Working closely with everyone involved and being open to their input is crucial to success.

 We need to get some BIG contributions in the first week to get the momentum rolling and to inspire others to jump in.  So please spread the word– Share, share, share! Email, Social media, Phone, Text and by the water cooler at work! 

Once our goal is met or is close, I can start scheduling everything. 

The Budget:  An overview and estimate–

Musician Fees – $7,500 (includes rehearsals, tracking, horn arrangements)

Studio Fees (tracking) – $60/hour @ 80 hours = $4,800.

Studio Fees (mix down) – $60/hour @ 20 hours = $1,200.

Studio Fees (mastering) – $100/hour @ 8 hours = $800

Design & Layout for CD and 12" Vinyl LP – $400

Duplication/Manufacturing 1,000 CDs (with 6panel insert) – $1,504. (includes shipping)

12" Vinyl LP  (4 panel) - Qty. 300 - $3,390. (includes shipping)

UPC codes, Copyright registrations, ISRC codes for royalty tracking, - $200

T-shirts / Water Canteens / 11 x 17 Posters/ Misc swag – $500

Hiring a Publicist for 4 month campaign – $6,000

Total:  $26,294  So if we make our goal of $28,000 and after Indiegogo takes its % and card processing fees we'll net around $26,300. 
 
I have always been a very detail oriented, methodical person. I would rather aim for quality rather than quantity. To do this project right will require the right budget and that's where you all come in. You can trust that I won't squander a penny on anything BUT this project!


Other Ways You Can Help~

If you want to support this but just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help us get the word out by making some noise about our campaign!
  • Indiegogo has share tools.. Please use them freely!
  • Use your own email lists, social media accounts: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat etc..
  • Talk about it to folks.. I will have flyers for you to hand out to your peeps!

    Let's do this!

    SPECIAL THANKS>>> Turki Al Rwaita - My wonderful videographer without whom I could not have made our promo video! Thank you little brother :-)

    Cathy Lemons, my really talented, hard-working good friend in blues who believes in me, inspires me and encouraged me all the way through this process. Thanks awesome woman! 

    Richard & Inci Pennington, for your total unwavering support and the use of your beautiful home where we taped my interviews.. with special assistance from Inci! I love you both 4 eva!

    All of the amazing musicians (including my partner in life and music– Randy Lee Odell!) and friends you see/hear on this video (you'll be hearing many  of them on the album!! I am blessed to know you and work with you. Can't wait to get in that studio with you!

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Este proyecto surge del trabajo de dos de las agrupaciones especializadas en música antigua más activas en la recuperación del patrimonio musical en España: la Orquesta Barroca de Granada e Íliber Ensemble.

Fundada en 2002 por Pablo Heras-Casado, la Orquesta Barroca de Granada es un conjunto profesional dedicado a la interpretación de música barroca de autores originarios de Europa —y, especialmente, de compositores españoles — con criterios historicistas e instrumentos antiguos. Desde 2007, su director titular es el clavecinista Darío Moreno.

La OBG realiza también una intensa labor pedagógica realizando cursos de interpretación con instrumentos de época y criterios historicistas dedicados a jóvenes estudiantes que desean recibir una formación orquestal especializada en este tipo de repertorio. Desde su refundación en 2007, la orquesta ha sido dirigida por importantes directores invitados, como los maestros Barry Sargent, Peter Biely, Peter Zajicek, Alfred Cañamero o Elena Borderías. La formación ha participado, asimismo, en relevantes citas musicales, ofreciendo conciertos en salas tan importantes como el Auditorio Manuel de Falla de Granada o el Auditorio Nacional de Madrid, donde interpretaron en 2013 el oratorio El Mesías de Händel, obteniendo los elogios de público y crítica. Además, la orquesta ha contado con solistas tan prestigiosos como Bob Van Asperen, Bart Vandewege, Michael Form, David Hernández Anfruns, Raquel Andueza o Marta Infante.

En el año 2011, vio la luz su primer disco, titulado Ciel e terra. En el álbum, publicado por la discográfica IBS Classical, la Orquesta Barroca de Granada interpreta una selección de arias de Händel, junto al tenor David Hernández Anfruns y bajo la dirección de Darío Moreno. El disco fue ampliamente alabado por la crítica especializada tanto nacional como internacional.

En 2017 la OBG inicia la primera temporada de ópera barroca en la ciudad de Granada con la puesta en escena de La Guerra de los Gigantes de Sebastián Durón, bajo la dirección escénica de Alejandro Gómez Lopera y un elenco de primeras figuras a nivel internacional que continuará el próximo año con la puesta en escena de la Zarzuela barroca "Acis y Galatea" de Antonio de Literes (1673-1747) en lo que supone un ambicioso proyecto de recuperación de música escénica de compositores del barroco español con el máximo rigor histórico y bajo el asesoramiento de la Asociación "Ars Hispana".

Por su parte, Íliber Ensemble es una formación de cámara dedicada al estudio y la interpretación de música barroca con criterios historicistas e instrumentos antiguos, fundada en Granada en mayo de 2013 e integrada por jóvenes músicos de distintos puntos de la geografía española. Sus objetivos son la recuperación y difusión del patrimonio musical barroco español (y, particularmente, andaluz), a la par que la divulgación de composiciones de autores europeos poco conocidos y la interpretación de obras de los grandes maestros de los siglos XVII y XVIII.

En abril de 2014, realizó su concierto de presentación, con gran éxito, en el Centro de Documentación Musical de Andalucía. Desde entonces, han actuado en ciclos tan importantes como el Meet In Beijing Arts Festival, el Festival Internacional de Música y Danza de Granada o el Proyecto MusaE del Ministerio de Cultura, así como en los festivales de música antigua de Granada, Córdoba, Vélez Blanco y Lorquí. Han ofrecido conciertos por toda la geografía española y, en 2018, realizan su debut internacional con una gira por China. Esto los ha llevado a actuar en salas como el Auditorio Manuel de Falla de Granada o el Daning Theatre de Shanghái, así como en espacios tan emblemáticos como el Ateneo de Madrid, la Catedral de Granada o el Tribunal Constitucional, recibiendo los elogios de la crítica especializada. Asimismo, a lo largo de su trayectoria han efectuado colaboraciones con conjuntos como la Orquesta Barroca de Granada, el Coro Tomás Luis de Victoria o Todos los Tonos y Ayres, y su labor ha sido reconocida con galardones como el Premio HEBE 2016 en la categoría de Música.

Os presentamos al fantástico equipo que formará parte de esta grabación:

Marta Infante | Palante

Eva Juárez | Júpiter

Aurora Peña | Minerva

Solomía Antonyak | Hércules

Pilar Alva | La Fama

Soledad Cardoso | El Tiempo

Laura Sabatel | La Inmortalidad

Olalla Alemán | El Silencio

Luis David Barrios |Tenor

Lorea Aranzasti | Violín I

Marina García | Violín II

Vicente Alcaide | Trompeta natural

Candela Gómez | Violonchelo

Javier Utrabo | Contrabajo

Aníbal Soriano | Guitarra Barroca y Tiorba

Luis Vives | Percusión

DARÍO TAMAYO | Clave, Órgano y Dirección Artística

DARÍO MORENO | Clave y Dirección Musical

 

El proyecto

El objetivo de esta campaña es iniciar la que será la primera grabación mundial de la integral de la música escénica de Sebastián Durón (1660-1716), uno de los compositores más importantes e influyentes del Barroco español. Para ello, comenzaremos esta serie de 10 volúmenes con la ópera La guerra de los gigantes, una de las obras más relevantes en la historia de la música escénica española, al ser la última ópera genuinamente española. Este proyecto pretende registrar estas obras con el máximo rigor histórico y con la mayor calidad musical, contando para ello con elencos vocales especializados de primer nivel internacional, así como con el asesoramiento musicológico de la Asociación Ars Hispana.

Sin embargo, al no disponer de ninguna fuente de financiación pública ni privada, el proyecto depende enteramente de financiación por micromecenazgo, a través de donaciones de particulares y de la ayuda que nos presten los colaboradores que así lo deseen.

Nuestra grabación comenzará el 30 de julio de este año y se desarrollará los días 30, 31 de julio y 1 de agosto en el Auditorio Manuel de Falla de Granada.

¿Nos ayudas a lanzar este proyecto único?

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Pero para hacer realidad este proyecto... ¡te necesitamos! Nuestro objetivo es alcanzar 10.000 euros, lo que nos permitirá hacer frente a todos los gastos de una grabación de estas características: salario de los músicos, viajes y alojamiento del equipo, alquiler y afinación de instrumentos, así como los costes de producción y posproducción de la grabación. Servirá asimismo para cubrir el alquiler de la sala en que efectuaremos la grabación: el Auditorio Manuel de Falla de Granada, con una de las mejores acústicas de Europa.

Si superamos el objetivo marcado en esta campaña, utilizaremos los fondos extra para cubrir los gastos de publicidad y lanzamiento del disco. Y, en caso de no alcanzar nuestra meta total, haremos uso de los fondos recaudados hasta el cierre de la campaña para cubrir parte de los gastos de grabación del disco, y trataremos de buscar el resto de financiación por otros medios privados.

Además, ¡tu ayuda tiene premio! Hemos diseñado un completo programa de recompensas a las que podréis acceder como agradecimiento a vuestra imprescindible ayuda, y que incluye desde discos firmados hasta pases VIP exclusivos para disfrutar de nuestra próxima interpretación de La guerra de los gigantes, el 25 de julio de este año en el Festival de Música Renacentista y Barroca de  Vélez Blanco (Almería).

Y, si no puedes hacer una donación... ¡no hay problema! Aún puedes ayudarnos compartiendo y dándole la máxima difusión a esta campaña entre tus familiares y amigos. ¡Cuantas más personas conozcan el proyecto, más posibilidades tendremos de alcanzar la meta!
story_txt:
¿Quiénes somos?
Este proyecto surge del trabajo de dos de las agrupaciones especializadas en música antigua más activas en la recuperación del patrimonio musical en España: la Orquesta Barroca de Granada e Íliber Ensemble.
Fundada en 2002 por Pablo Heras-Casado, la Orquesta Barroca de Granada es un conjunto profesional dedicado a la interpretación de música barroca de autores originarios de Europa —y, especialmente, de compositores españoles — con criterios historicistas e instrumentos antiguos. Desde 2007, su director titular es el clavecinista Darío Moreno.
La OBG realiza también una intensa labor pedagógica realizando cursos de interpretación con instrumentos de época y criterios historicistas dedicados a jóvenes estudiantes que desean recibir una formación orquestal especializada en este tipo de repertorio. Asimismo, a lo largo de su trayectoria han efectuado colaboraciones con conjuntos como la Orquesta Barroca de Granada, el Coro Tomás Luis de Victoria o Todos los Tonos y Ayres, y su labor ha sido reconocida con galardones como el Premio HEBE 2016 en la categoría de Música.

Solomía Antonyak | Hércules

Luis David Barrios |Tenor

Vicente Alcaide | Trompeta natural
Candela Gómez | Violonchelo
Javier Utrabo | Contrabajo
Aníbal Soriano | Guitarra Barroca y Tiorba

story:
So I’m Joylin, the combination of joy and the thing i love the most : violin. Let me tell you my story from the begining.
Everything started with my mom, who didn’t had the chance to enter the Music University, so when she gave me birth, she only had this hard and obsessive wish, that her babygirl will have “the chance that she never had”, so she put the violin in my hands and started teaching me at the age of 5. Starting from that point, I didn’t had a normal childhood. At that moment I couldn’t stand the feeling that other kids were out playing and I have no friends because I’m stuck home, conditioned by violin on everything else I wanted to do. I won every contest, played on every audition and concert, but I had no friends. This thing caused me social problems until the age of 15. Don’t worry, now I am just fine, I have a lot of friends and a lovely boyfriend. I just had a hard start..
But, you see.. I would sacrifice it over and over again if someone throws me back in that period. I’m one of that lucky kids where this way of doing things worked. I thank her day and night for the way that she did everything. I am 22 now, and even if she had a hard period getting used with the idea that I don’t want to play classical music anymore, she’s now very proud of me, because she realized that she raised a musical kid, and her work is complete now.
So, now, after 17 years (out of 22), I make violin shows in clubs and I’m invited to events, recording violin parts for artists and play with some of them in their live concerts. I enjoy every second of it, I gain more experience from it everyday and I build my confidence and self-trust.
I dream that one day I’ll bring thousands of people together and I’ll do exactly the kind of music that I have in mind, wich I could not define, unfortunatly, because it’s a combination of all stiles, with elements from all stiles.

 

 

I want to start working for myself independently instead of working for others. I want to build my own recording studio, create my own album, film some professionally music videos and gather a bunch of nice people and call them “my team”, who believe in me and my vision.
It’s hard to build a career by knocking on doors. There are a lot of awesome voices to be explored. I’m just a violin girl who believes in herself. I don’t have a voice, unfortunatly, but i think that my gift can be equal with one, even if there are some people saying that I’m very talented but there’s no way that I will succeed to the level I want just by playing some instrument. They are so wrong! Have you noticed that no matter what gender a song is, when a violin comes on it’s part, you feel different? The only diference is that i can’t have words out of it, but i can share emotions and cool vibes, because out of all instruments, the violin is the most sensible one, nearest to human’s voice. So why can’t I just create a career based on no words, just emotions? 
I don’t want to compete with human voice, I just want to do my own thing. 
My goal is simple. Someday, I’m gonna be as “good” as a singer, I’ll have gigs all around the world, travel and be happy doing what i love more than anything in the world. 
I want to deliver my feelings, my undying love and compassion, my dreamy way of creating music and of course, my story. 
And my vision is quite simple too. Make music and be loved for what I do by as many persons as I can handle.
I want to make people happy and compose things that will be forever in people’s hearts and minds. 

 

My parents support me on everything I want to do, even if they broke up. They love me more than anything in the world, but unfortunatly they are not able to support this project financially, so I decided to make a call here, to anyone who loves music just like I do.
My plan for the project sounds like this :
- I want to build my own decently equipped recording studio, for me and maybe any other artist that I will colaborate with in the future as a solo artist. 
So I need a big list of things for that.. 
I know how to manage everything, I learned about studio equipment, tech details and how to produce by wathing others, but i’m definetly not a pro yet. In a few years, I know that I’ll get there with some hard work, because I want to do my own work. Nobody can recreate my vision 100%.
- besides studio equipment, I need the guy behind every sound and effect. I’ll need him to work with me on the album that I want to create, translate my vision and words into sounds, and good producers are expensive and hard to be found with free time. But, beeing  a part of the music industry can be good, because you get to know them all. So, I found my good guy that can help me with my project, but not for free.
- I want to make 3 out of the 10 music videos for selected songs I’ll have for the album. Again, music videos are expensive if you want them to be really good. There are a lot of things that counts, like hiring the camera guy, the montage, the places and effects, the road, make-up, hair-styling, and much more.
- Banks of sounds and music production licenses. I have the Logic Pro Program that is awesome and also my favourite, but it’s impossible to have all functions that you need on one platform. 

Those are the big categories, other beeing smaller or attached to the big ones.

story:
Eliot Cardinaux - Piano, Voice, Poetry

Asger Thomsen - Bass, Objects

Jeppe Høi Justesen - Drums, Percussion

A thief is sauntering down the road with his catch, a beautiful copy of Magpie’s new LP, Six Feet on Solid Ground. He runs into a merchant at a milestone near the village. He hails the merchant who invites him to stay with her at the Inn. The thief quickly apologizes for his lack of money and the merchant says, “it’s on my dime, I just happen to be rich.”

Later that night while they’re sitting at a table, the thief is loosening up. The merchant’s got him drunk. The musicians in the bar are playing a tune. The singer sings the lyrics in a mystifying way… like this:

Child of the other sun,
how latent pass the blossoms
of our hearts as thieves
bristle their leaves,
how late the speaker turns the thorn.

And now as yellow forelimbs fall,
their voided caskets irritate the sparrow –
like you, to whom no thistle
rises in the bread.

And when my heart swings gently,
avoiding the price it leaves there,
glowing so coldly without a name,

this egret of a stone-stiff back –
one feather, it winters no number.

Eventually the thief admits to being a thief. The merchant nods, and slowly begins to unravel this story:

"We’ve all stolen something in this life,” the merchant says, “and we’ve all been stolen from, for sure. But what shiny trinket do we escape with, onto what wet black bough where no one can reach it – and into what tender region of the conscience does its shadow grow, and remain there burrowed, without us being aware?

“But we as thieves, as well as the thieved, look up at this branch, and according to that pitch in our hearts, the sinking of our gut into a trench – clearly have some vendetta to lay upon ourselves, upon the world who has wronged us; just as the magpie picks at its new possession, taunting us until it flits away, out of sight, we ask first, “where is its nest?” And then we ask who is to blame. And then our life crumbles around us, like our friendships, our relationships, and our peace of mind, as we set out on this hunt to retrieve our stolen artifact.

“But what is it in this stolen object – other than its tangible absence, as felt in our empty hands, the hollow it leaves in our hearts, and the trench where it leaves our guts – that can inflict such doubt, as to the groundedness of all things?”

The merchant tilts her glass and the thief sits up.

“Is it not the object but the magpie itself, who impinges such dark magic upon us, like a mage? Because, while we can still see it, the object, flashing with light at the magpie’s feet – while they’re up there in the tree, picking at it – it seems that he or she is toying with us, this bird – is taunting us, with something more absurd: the notion that somehow we, the thieved, can’t do without. And we the thieves, as well as the thieved; no?

“For certainly, our hearts have taken something from it every day – from this beauty, this dark magic – some bright secret. It lifts from us the weight of the absolute – if only for a moment; and what it lifts from us is not ours to keep, nor lose – that which, even as we seek it, remains there tethered, rooted in us, like – what? – some good, perhaps, some hope. Otherwise we might be killers.”

The thief listens carefully.

“But the magpie is not murderous; even as a murder of ravens only flock around the dead, and the dying, they have no part in killing. The magpie is the cause of murder, don’t you see? It is the manifestation of our need to blame others for our loss, the need to strike out, the flashing of brilliance in the killer's eye. That's what the magpie has taught us.

“Now go listen to this music on the LP you have stolen from me, and I promise not to kill you. I must move on with my life.”

The merchant stands up to go, but pauses. The thief is shocked, and gestures to her. The merchant gestures to him, resigned, and walks away.
story_txt: Eliot Cardinaux - Piano, Voice, PoetryAsger Thomsen - Bass, ObjectsJeppe Høi Justesen - Drums, PercussionA thief is sauntering down the road with his catch, a beautiful copy of Magpie’s new LP, Six Feet on Solid Ground. He runs into a merchant at a milestone near the village. He hails the merchant who invites him to stay with her at the Inn. The thief quickly apologizes for his lack of money and the merchant says, “it’s on my dime, I just happen to be rich.”Later that night while they’re sitting at a table, the thief is loosening up. The merchant’s got him drunk. The musicians in the bar are playing a tune. The singer sings the lyrics in a mystifying way… like this:Child of the other sun,how latent pass the blossomsof our hearts as thievesbristle their leaves,how late the speaker turns the thorn.And now as yellow forelimbs fall,their voided caskets irritate the sparrow –like you, to whom no thistlerises in the bread.And when my heart swings gently,avoiding the price it leaves there,glowing so coldly without a name,this egret of a stone-stiff back –one feather, it winters no number.Eventually the thief admits to being a thief. The merchant nods, and slowly begins to unravel this story:"We’ve all stolen something in this life,” the merchant says, “and we’ve all been stolen from, for sure. But what shiny trinket do we escape with, onto what wet black bough where no one can reach it – and into what tender region of the conscience does its shadow grow, and remain there burrowed, without us being aware?“But we as thieves, as well as the thieved, look up at this branch, and according to that pitch in our hearts, the sinking of our gut into a trench – clearly have some vendetta to lay upon ourselves, upon the world who has wronged us; just as the magpie picks at its new possession, taunting us until it flits away, out of sight, we ask first, “where is its nest?” And then we ask who is to blame. And then our life crumbles around us, like our friendships, our relationships, and our peace of mind, as we set out on this hunt to retrieve our stolen artifact.“But what is it in this stolen object – other than its tangible absence, as felt in our empty hands, the hollow it leaves in our hearts, and the trench where it leaves our guts – that can inflict such doubt, as to the groundedness of all things?”The merchant tilts her glass and the thief sits up.“Is it not the object but the magpie itself, who impinges such dark magic upon us, like a mage? Because, while we can still see it, the object, flashing with light at the magpie’s feet – while they’re up there in the tree, picking at it – it seems that he or she is toying with us, this bird – is taunting us, with something more absurd: the notion that somehow we, the thieved, can’t do without. And we the thieves, as well as the thieved; no?“For certainly, our hearts have taken something from it every day – from this beauty, this dark magic – some bright secret. It lifts from us the weight of the absolute – if only for a moment; and what it lifts from us is not ours to keep, nor lose – that which, even as we seek it, remains there tethered, rooted in us, like – what? – some good, perhaps, some hope. Otherwise we might be killers.”The thief listens carefully.“But the magpie is not murderous; even as a murder of ravens only flock around the dead, and the dying, they have no part in killing. The magpie is the cause of murder, don’t you see? It is the manifestation of our need to blame others for our loss, the need to strike out, the flashing of brilliance in the killer's eye. That's what the magpie has taught us.“Now go listen to this music on the LP you have stolen from me, and I promise not to kill you. I must move on with my life.”The merchant stands up to go, but pauses. The thief is shocked, and gestures to her. The merchant gestures to him, resigned, and walks away.

story:
• About Me

I began writing and performing music at an age when I didn't realize the power that it had.  Throughout my musical journey, ultimately I've learned that music at it's best was not about music, but rather expressing life's realities through song.  Raised in Cleveland Heights, Ohio - an area rich in culture and diversity, my community served as an anchor in shaping my artistic philosophy. 

With my debut single “Can’t Forget” and the follow-up single/video “Miss My Love” charting in the Top 20 on the Billboard Chart, I've shown my commitment and dedication to my craft. Blessed to be picked as the opening act of Anthony Hamilton’s national “Back to Love Tour” (with Estelle), I learned the importance of seizing the opportunity while further developing my performance skills. 

“Holistically, so much keeps us separated – sexual preferences, economics, neighborhoods. My goal is to help break down barriers. At a concert when everyone is vibing on the music, no one cares whether the person sitting next to them has the exact same beliefs that they do. As an artist, I want to do things that reveal me as unlimited in my creativity and with the purpose of unity.”

  • The Campaign

The #AntoineDunn1Million campaign is the key to reaching the next chapter in my music career.  My goal is to reach one million hearts, one million ears and touch one million souls with my sophomore album.  With your pledge, together we can bring this movement to people all over the world!

  • Project Completion 

Your contribution will assist me in achieving the most important step of all... Project Completion!  Many creative people have ideas and concepts which seldom reach completion.  With your pledge I'll be one step closer to my goal.

 

What I Need & What You Get!

 

  • If Fully Funded

If fully funded for our goal of $6,500 the funds will be disbursed as follows:

Gross Proceeds ($6,500.00)

         -5% Indiegogo fee | $325.00

         -T-Shirt Manufacturing Costs | $1,040.00

Net Proceeds ($5,135.00)

         -50% Studio & Musicians Fees | $2,567.50

         -25% Travel Expenses | $1,283.75

         -25% Lodging Expenses | $1,283.75

 

  • What Makes This Cool

This album will be recorded at Power Station New England, an exact replica of New York Cities world famous Avatar Studio's.  Avatar has historically recorded albums for artist like Paul McCartney, Bruno Mars, Barbara Streisand and David Bowie to name a few.  A song from the new album has already caught the attention of one of Europe's hottest new screenwriters, Christoph Silber, an International Emmy Winner.  The song will be featured in one of his upcoming film projects.  Lastly, the project will be produced along side Grammy Award winning music producer Scott Jacoby who has worked with numerous artists in various genres including Coldplay, Cory Henry, and John Legend to name a few

 

  • If Only Partially Funded

If partially funded for our goal, funds will be disbursed as follows:

Gross Proceeds

        -5% of Gross Proceeds | Indiegogo Fee

        -T-Shirt Manufacturing Cost

Net Proceeds 

         -50% of Net Proceeds | Studio & Musicians Fees

         -25%  of Net Proceeds | Travel Expenses 

         -25%  of Net Proceeds | Lodging Expenses

 

The Impact

  • Your pledge will help impact the tremendous need for positive change in the world and the music industry. Messages filled with love and positivity will surely reinforce the power that music has in changing our perspectives on life.  We are what we consume; so let's spread the love in every song!

 

  • The new project is 100% complete as it relates to songwriting and now simply needs to be produced for an early fourth quarter release.  My first album "Truth Of The Matter" produced two Billboard Top 20 records, sold 17,000 singles and  2,500 albums.  With your support, my new album will surely surpass my previous  project! 

Risks & Challenges

  • The primary risk associated with this project is the timeline to completion.  In the event that the project is not completed in time for a 2018 release, we will push the release back to the next best quarter (likely 1st or 2nd quarter of 2019)

 

  • To minimize the occurrence of a delayed project, our team of staff and producers will combine our years of experience to ensure the best practices for a timely release.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that the demands of life may prevent some of you from being able to contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

 

If you are unable to contribute, Simply:

  • Text the #AntoineDunn1Million  Indiegogo Campaign to your family, friends and co-workers who LOVE Good Music!
  • Take 5 minutes to share the #AntoineDunn1Million Campaign on FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM and your other Social Media Platforms!

Thank you for your support!

-Antoine

story:
Short Summary

We have been self-managed for six years now, which means that we have personally overseen every creative decision to date since the formation of Vivace! We'd love for you to be a personal part of our new project and follow our story! 

  • Who We Are - Our short story! ~ELEGANT - VIVID - VIVACIOUS ~ Vivace is a modern and thrilling combination of four unique and exceptional pop and classical singers. Based primarily out of Vancouver, Vivace started merging their talents in 2010 performing at the Vancouver Winter Olympic Games. Since then, they have gone on to tour extensively through the United States and Canada. Members have shared the stage and billed events with David Foster, Ben Harper, Jackson Browne, Katy Perry, Loverboy, Colin James, Mark Masri, the former Canadian Tenors, with key appearances at TedxVancouver 2010, in addition to the 2010 Vancouver Olympics.
  • Our Campaign! We are campaigning to be able to record and release our new title EP, 'Diamonds,' in September 2018. We are thrilled to be back in the studio with up-and-coming producer Xander Miller (Victoria Duffield, Expo Line Recordings), with arrangements by Roy Tan (The Canadian Tenors, Destino), and strings performed by 'Blackdog String Quartet' (Michael Buble, Kanye West). 'Diamonds' will be a combination of powerful and emotionally driven vocals, with a diverse repertoire ranging from pop to arias. As Vivace, we love to put a fresh new take on the classical and modern music of today, and we have some very unexpected songs that we are excited to interpret and cover on this album! It is important to us to bridge the gap between pop and classical, and as our last album release was six years ago, we figured it's time to spin our wheels again! The album release includes not just recording vocals, but strings and brass. We are including a photoshoot and cover video shoot to artistically support the recording.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the goods!

Recording:

Studio Time x 4 days = $1785

String Quartet: 3 hours = $1000

Brass Trio: 1 hour = $300

Arrangement Fee (Vocals, Strings, Brass) = $1500

Production, Vocal Editing and Mixing Fees x 6 songs = $7740

Mastering at Sound Suite Labs x 6 songs = $540

CMRRA Mechanical Licenses x 6 songs = $540

CD Manufacturing x 1000 CD's = $1800

*TOTAL: $15,205

Photoshoot:

Photography = $750

Styling = $800

Hair & Makeup = $900

*TOTAL: $2450

Cover Video Shoot:

Videography & Editing = $800

*TOTAL: $800

Album Artwork & Design: $500

***GRAND TOTAL: $18,955 (amounts subject to slightly vary)

 

Here are some of our FAVOURITE, FUN PERKS!

- Chill out for an hour in the studio with us NEXT WEEK, OR chill out for an hour in the studio with us AND have lunch on us!

- Sponsor a song and either your name, your company or with permission, your charity of choice's logo on the album artwork

- Sponsor half of the Hair/Makeup cost for the shoot and receive a pallet of the type of makeup that was used by our makeup artist

- Receive behind-the-scenes photos that will not be shared with anyone else, or on social media

EVERY bit helps. So even if we don't reach our entire goal, every penny goes towards the production costs of the album. We will cover the rest but it will take some time and a lot of shows to get us there! 

The Impact

  • As Vivace, we love to bridge the gap between classical and modern genres, and to create unexpected and unique interpretations in the popera genre. As a supporter, your contribution will support our music, and ignite an interest of classical music to younger generations. We went through HUNDREDS of songs, and the choices we have picked are traditional Italian to songs you grew up on to modern pop.
  • In 2012, we released our very first EP, which included classical standards such as 'Nessun dorma' with a pop twist, and self-written material such as 'The World to Me.' We sold this album at over 100 shows across Canada and the US, and received a major compliment on 'Prayer in the Night' from the writers who mentioned that our version was their favourite. Our goal is to make a similar project happen all over again.

Risks & Challenges

You may have noticed we have gone through many changes in the past. Despite the curveballs music, life and the industry have thrown at us, we keep trucking on. We've held the group together, at times truly by a thread, for six years. Our zest for music, insatiable desire to understand what works and what doesn't, love for our followers and audience, and stubbornness to not give up has gotten us through trials in the past and will continue for the future. Truth be told, a reality is that we never did fully pay off our first album in album sales. The intent of this album is not to profit financially - it is to please our fans and followers.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you'd rather not receive a perk and are unable to donate, it would still mean the world to us if you could please get the word out and SHARE like wildfire! Please help us spread the word through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and WORD of MOUTH! IndieGogo has some great share tools to help too!

story:
Hello everyone,

My name is Vince Royale, I'm a stand up comedian/actor/recording artist that has been in the comedy circuit for nearly 10 years and been writing music since I was a kid. I've had the opportunity to travel to different cities, performed for the troops, the homeless, orphans, and helped raised funds for people in need. I've met some interesting people and also shared the stage with some great comedians like Trevor Noah, Jim Gaffigan, Alonzo Bodden, Chris Rock, and Amy Schumer . I've also appeared in some  television shows such as "Bad Sex" on Logo/MTV, "Stand Up & Deliver" on Hulu, "Laughs" on FOX, and currently a show "Not for Nothin" on Amazon Prime.

I’m planning to release my comedy rap album in the next few months. This is one of my dreams since I was 12 years old. I’ve been rapping and producing music before I started comedy and acting and I thought it would be fun to finally get this out of my system. The album concept is called “Character Flaws” which features 7 different character/personas of mine. So it will have a compilation album feel, sort of like a one man Wu-Tang. For those that enjoy classic hip hop from the 90s and early 2000s, that was the vibe I was trying to capture. I was inspired by to the comedic rap styles of Redman, Ol Dirty, Ludacris, Eminem, Big L, and Biggie. Even though I am a comedian, my first love was hip hop. I finally found a way to bring both worlds together with this album. So if your a classic hip hop, music, and comedy fan this album might be for you. I’m taking the independent route with the release of this album, meaning that I won’t have the marketing and production budget of a major label. I’ve always been an advocate of full creative control through the independent and grassroots movement of the arts. I’m asking my supporters, fans, friends, and family to contribute to the marketing of this project. I plan to raise funds to produce, promote, and market this project.

 

I need to finish the album by renting a recording studio, hire a sound engineer for mixing and mastering, and hiring producers. I also plan to promote through online social media ads, hiring a publicist, filming music videos, flyers/posters, and special events. Contributors will have the first priority in receiving a digital download of the album or physical copy along with other promotional materials.

In addition, I plan to donate 20% of the money raised to the Angels 2 Angels. Angels 2 Angels is a non-profit organization that works with orphanages and abandoned children. They feed, clothe, nourish, mentor and educate vulnerable children so that they may experience a sense of belonging, and lead a life of independence and purpose. They work with orphanages on sustainability programs designed to empower and equip them, to ensure that the highest quality of protected, loving care is provided to the kids. Here is their website: https://angels2angels.org

I've personally worked with Angels 2 Angels to volunteer at an orphanage "Siempre Para Los Ninos" in Mexico to help bring donations to orphans and spend time with them.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I will need an estimate of $8,000-$10,000 for this campaign.

My costs:

A recording studio, sound engineer to mix and master the the album: $1500

Music Production: $1500

Marketing (Album launch party, Flyers, Publication Ad, online advertising): $4000

Web Designer to design my website to promote my art and music: $800

CD Duplication and Packaging for 1000 DVDs: $1200 

All I am asking is for a minimum donation of $10 and you will receive an advanced digital copy of the album. $20 will get you advanced signed copy. Extra donations are welcome and have more perks..

Even if I raise half of the $8,000 goal, I can still place the order for 1000 CDs with minimal marketing, but it would be nice to be able to raise awareness of my comedy rap album through a new website, online ads, launch party, and some flyers.

Risks & Challenges

I believe we can achieve this goal with the help of my supporters and loyal fans.  I've contacted over 200  people personally and most agreed to donate a minimum of $20 for a advanced copy of the album. The album will be released no matter what the results of the campaign. I strongly believe in this project and look forward to the release.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can also help by spreading the word and make some noise about the campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your continued support and look forward to sharing my creative endeavors with everyone. Much love, light, and blessings.

Sincerely,

Vince Royale

I was inspired by to the comedic rap styles of Redman, Ol Dirty, Ludacris, Eminem, Big L, and Biggie. Even though I am a comedian, my first love was hip hop. I finally found a way to bring both worlds together with this album. So if your a classic hip hop, music, and comedy fan this album might be for you. I’m taking the independent route with the release of this album, meaning that I won’t have the marketing and production budget of a major label. I’ve always been an advocate of full creative control through the independent and grassroots movement of the arts. I’m asking my supporters, fans, friends, and family to contribute to the marketing of this project. I plan to raise funds to produce, promote, and market this project. I need to finish the album by renting a recording studio, hire a sound engineer for mixing and mastering, and hiring producers. I also plan to promote through online social media ads, hiring a publicist, filming music videos, flyers/posters, and special events. Contributors will have the first priority in receiving a digital download of the album or physical copy along with other promotional materials.In addition, I plan to donate 20% of the money raised to the Angels 2 Angels. Angels 2 Angels is a non-profit organization that works with orphanages and abandoned children. They feed, clothe, nourish, mentor and educate vulnerable children so that they may experience a sense of belonging, and lead a life of independence and purpose. They work with orphanages on sustainability programs designed to empower and equip them, to ensure that the highest quality of protected, loving care is provided to the kids. Here is their website: https://angels2angels.orgI've personally worked with Angels 2 Angels to volunteer at an orphanage "Siempre Para Los Ninos" in Mexico to help bring donations to orphans and spend time with them. What I Need & What You GetI will need an estimate of $8,000-$10,000 for this campaign.My costs:A recording studio, sound engineer to mix and master the the album: $1500Music Production: $1500Marketing (Album launch party, Flyers, Publication Ad, online advertising): $4000Web Designer to design my website to promote my art and music: $800CD Duplication and Packaging for 1000 DVDs: $1200 All I am asking is for a minimum donation of $10 and you will receive an advanced digital copy of the album. $20 will get you advanced signed copy. Extra donations are welcome and have more perks..Even if I raise half of the $8,000 goal, I can still place the order for 1000 CDs with minimal marketing, but it would be nice to be able to raise awareness of my comedy rap album through a new website, online ads, launch party, and some flyers.Risks & ChallengesI believe we can achieve this goal with the help of my supporters and loyal fans.  I've contacted over 200  people personally and most agreed to donate a minimum of $20 for a advanced copy of the album. The album will be released no matter what the results of the campaign. I strongly believe in this project and look forward to the release.Other Ways You Can HelpI understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:You can also help by spreading the word and make some noise about the campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you so much for your continued support and look forward to sharing my creative endeavors with everyone. Much love, light, and blessings.Sincerely,Vince Royale

story:
Hey folks! Kai here! If you hadn't yet heard, Superdigital and CDPDX are calling it quits after 30 years!  Donny and I want to make sure people still have local access to excellent CD production services, and pro audio supplies that aren't from a chain store. To do that, we're going to start our own business called Astro Audio PDX.

Any amount of money we raise will help offset the start up cost. Machinery is expensive and so are supplies! But the more people that help us in the beginning, the better of a chance we'll have of surviving the long run and serving the community for many harmonious years to come.

Not only do we want to keep doing what we're doing, we also want to expand and offer even more options- vinyl, t shirts, and more swag. We've already set up a way to do flyers and stickers- we want to keep expanding until were a one stop music shop! No more getting some of your merch from one place and the rest from another.

We know it won't be easy, but we're determined to keep the dream alive, and to continue empowering the music community to keep their projects in their own two hands and out of the claws of big business or record labels.

Please share our story! We want to get the word out as much as possible! We're opening those doors April 1st, and we want as many people as possible to know we exist! We would be especially pleased if you dropped by opening day just to say hello!
