story:
THE WHO

My name is Joe Armstrong, and I have many passions. If you know me, you’ve likely seen me making beer in my yard, having adventures in the woods with my dog or standing on top of a mountain somewhere. You also may have seen me creating and fixing things, or interviewing musicians from around the world on my long-running podcast, Independent’s Day.

You may have seen me doing all manner of things, but my first and biggest love is music - and I am asking for your help making my next record.
 

"Joe Armstrong's music swaggers with an urban toughness at the same time that it swings with a rural gait."

- Performing Songwriter
 

THE WHY

In 1958, The Beatles (billed as The Quarrymen) stepped into their first recording session and paid what today would be about $24 to record two songs. Things have changed. Even with the proliferation of cheap digital recording technology, making records is an expensive proposition.

My mantra is Do-It-Yourself, and I’ve made two albums of my own - Sidewalk Chalk Manifesto and Silverface Champs - as well as produced albums for other artists on a shoestring budget, and I remain proud of the results. Necessity is the mother of invention, limitations foster creativity, and it if sounds good, it is good.

I am asking for your help because I believe that my new batch of songs deserves a chance to be recorded in a proper studio with the best musicians I can find.

GOALS

I’m hoping to raise $10,000 to make my next album. It’s not much in the grand scheme of things, but it’s a windfall for an independent musician like me. If I hit this goal and kick in some of my own money, I can do everything necessary for my new record: preproduction, hiring musicians and a producer, tracking in a professional studio, overdubbing in my home studio, mixing with an experienced audio engineer, mastering, replication, and distribution.

You have the power to elevate the process this time around. A less spartan budget means better studios with better recording gear. It also means I can focus on being a musician, which has been my dream since I played a tennis racket guitar to a cornfield audience of thousands when I was a kid.

GUARANTEES

How do you know that I won’t pocket all the cash and run off to Costa Rica? For one, my mother didn’t raise me that way - and she was the best person I’ve ever met. A better answer is that music is my avocation, and I’ve devoted my life to it. I can’t not do it.  

After the fundraising campaign is complete, I will have a transparent album production process as I finish songs and get into the studio. Anyone and everyone can follow me on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and on my website, www.joearmstrong.com to watch the magical process unfold. I can’t wait to bring you along for the ride. 

WHAT YOU GET

Aside from the copy of the new record you’ll receive at the end of all this, I’ve got some other perks and incentives for different monetary contributions. Everyone who donates gets a sticker suitable for bathroom stalls, road cases, dorm room fridges, mud flaps, Trapper Keepers, etc. I’ve also got some stylin’ ‘Rock and Roll Will Never Die’ t-shirts and pint glasses for your favorite beverage.


“I don't think there's a man, woman or child alive who doesn't enjoy a tasty beverage.”

- David Letterman


If you're fortunate enough to be a wealthy patron of the arts, I'll be happy to ruin your favorite song by recording a cover of your choosing, play a private house concert for you and yours (within 100 miles of 91205), take you on a hike up a 10,000-foot mountain, or make you a custom batch of beer. What other songwriter can do that, eh?

As a proof of concept - and with a little help from some exceedingly talented friends - I made a music video for one of my brand-new songs, and I'll be premiering it during the campaign. Stay tuned!



If you contribute to this fundraising campaign, when you eventually press ‘play’ on my new record you will have an intrinsic sense of fulfillment that you were part of the process. You made someone’s dream come true. That’s a pretty damn good feeling.

Here’s the bottom line: I am going to make an album regardless of what happens. But we can make one hell of an album if we do this together. Thanks for reading, thanks for listening, thanks for watching, and please be kind to one another!

- Joe Armstrong  8.13.18


ADDENDUM (YOU CAN STILL HELP IF YOU’RE BROKE!)

Times are hard. I know this. There are countless great songs about money troubles. But there are other ways you can pitch in. If you’re strapped, please consider sharing any of the content I’ll be posting over the course of this campaign.

The power of social media means that everyone’s networks are interconnected, and you never know who might dig my new music video. Nearly everyone has a rich uncle, right? Indiegogo also has some sharing tools built right in – so help me spread the word!

story:
About Eldraco and "State of Nature" 

       Born in Chicago, Illinois and raised in Saint Louis, Missouri, multimedia artist: Eldraco Price employs music, dance, and visual medias to create dynamic and lively performance experiences. A graduate with Honors from the Webster University Music Conservatory, he is a trained performer and composer of music.  

      His debut album's title, "State of Nature", gleaned from the Thomas Hobbes philosophy of the same name, is a declaration and call for change. 

     As a minority, Eldraco encourages the act of love, and fights for unity through the creation of his art and music. By using provocative lyrics, sophisticated melodies, and colorful harmonies, Eldraco hopes to not only inspire and mobilize his audience, but provide a quality listening experience. 

         Additionally, a large factor of his artistic mission is to always encourage and take a hand in collaborations with other artists. His attitude is that the most impactful art is that of the collaborator.  He believes that combining artistic ideas and passions garner a truth and beauty that  would otherwise be one-sided and clouded. 

        So far, on  his journey to creating the music behind "State of Nature", Eldraco has met many other local artists with talent and  inspiring voices, that he feels need to be heard. To this end, he has created a collective of artists  called Free Nation with whom he works and performs . By giving, you not only allow his vision to come to fruition, but also allow him to continue to  partner with other young artists ,and create content that provokes thought and represent's the voices of today. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal: We, Eldraco and Free Nation, hope to raise  $4500, all of which would go towards the production of the most quality album we can make! To this end, very talented music producers are being brought onto the project to help craft, a truly professional first album release . However, with this comes a plethora of expenses.

With or without reaching the full prospective goal. Funds raised will go towards: 

  • Recording session time 
  • Compensation of audio producers 
  • Compensation of executive production 
  • Compensation of  performance personnel 
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Production of physical copies of the album 
  • Licensing/ publishing fees 
  • Distribution and Marketing 

Risks & Challenges

Never one to shy away from large, and challenging projects, for the sake of creating quality art, Eldraco's debut album is no exception in it's projected scope, and it requirements. Creating an album that mixes live performance, and studio production in an aurally satisfying manner is expensive, and he will need your help. 

Some of the many challenges you donation will assist to alleviate: 

  • hiring professional session players 
  • Compensation for a small vocal chorus 
  • Compensating a professional production team 
  • Marketing, and getting the product to the broadest audience possible

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 if you cannot give monetarily,  please do not feel that you cannot help! 

You can still: 

  • 1. Follow  me,  @eldracoprice,  on all social media platforms including: Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and Snapchat! 
  • 2. Like and share this campaign  and help spread the word!  
  • 3. Come and support Eldraco and Free Nation at their events in promotion of the upcoming album!

story:
Six years ago Stark Folk evolved from a two-man recording project to Stark Folk Band, a live four-piece unit & this set of recordings represents the full fruits of this half-decade collaboration. 

 

THE ALBUM

• Titled: When Odysseus Wept...a nod to the classic Greek epic and coincidentally(?) an apt metaphor for the making of this album: a grand labor-of-love, a struggle, a joy, an expansion of our consciousness! 

• Composed as an album in the traditional sense.  A ten song musical journey. 

• Recorded on modest equipment, in domestic spaces, without the financial support /or dictates of any corporate overlords.

THE LOWDOWN

• 300 vinyl records, in colorful gate-fold jackets, designed by the band (see mock-up at the top of this page). 

• Total cost: about $3500.  Includes the cost of mastering (professional preparation of the songs), manufacturing, and color printing. 

• We currently do not have the support of a record label and are thus financing this ourselves, so contributions made now, in the form of pre-orders, will wonderfully assist us by providing upfront cash to put towards down-payments , etc.

• Completion date: November 2018

THE PERKS

• ALL contributors will get thanked in the album liner notes.

• ALL contributors, at any level, will immediately receive a link to digital versions of our previous two albums.  Stark Folk-Self-titled(2008) & Stark Folk Band-Well Oiled(2010)

• Those who pre-order the new vinyl record (at $25) will receive (in August) their choice of a vinyl copy of Well Oiled (2010) or our 7" single Modern Times (2014) or hard-to-find CD of For Seasons (2003) by pre-Stark Folk project A Landscape Yesterday. 

• The top perk includes an ULTRA-RARE copy of the first Stark Folk record (2008).  This was originally a pressing of 100, 25 of which were lost by American Airlines, thus only 75 exist.  Of those, we only have a few left in our possession, so it really is a rare piece of our history. 

• ALL contributors will be entered into a drawing to win a copy of the above mentioned Stark Folk album & collector test pressings of Well Oiled and Odysseus Wept!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

* JUST WANT TO MAKE A DONATION? Don't do vinyl?  Click the PINK 'BACK IT' button near the top of the page & enter any donation amount.  You will be loved!

** Click on each 'PERK' to reveal additional details.

*** Please share this campaign online or by good old fashion word-of-mouth!

**** THANK YOU!!!!!

------------------------------------------------

Additional info about Stark Folk Band & our previous albums:

RECORD REVIEWS
Self-titled LP (2008) - http://agitreader.com/perfect/stark_folk.html
Well Oiled LP (2010) - http://agitreader.com/primitivefutures/stark_fo...
Modern Times 45 (2014) - http://agitreader.com/wp2/stark-folk-band-moder...

A Landscape Yesterday CD (2003) - http://yesterscape.tripod.com/id6.html

INTERVIEW  https://robertfreemanwexler.com/2010/06/17/star...

story:
You've discovered a precious stone!!

THE MISSION TO MOONROCK BEGINS:

Other Families presents MOONROCK coming in the summer of 2018. 

An album of nu-jazz electro-fusion from your favourite genre-swappin' bunch of punks:

Where will your much appreciated moon-bucks be going you ask? Well...

  • Booking some killer guest jazz musicians to feature on the album 
  • Photography and art design costs
  • A plethora of pre-release live events
  • And for the very first time in OF history... VINYL production baby

Help us deliver you a sleek musical experience that combines acoustic jazz recordings, electro-funk production, live drama, rock-n-roll, spectacular live events and bits of glowing space juice!

"Together, We'll Swing Among The Stars!"

story:
Purpose: Raise money to create a professional world class music studio

I have a strong vision and aspiration of being able to act as a producer to help bands create something new, fresh and interesting with music.  

I have been managing, performing and playing music since the early 2000s.  In the last 10 years I have mixed and or mastered material for Troldmand, Damo Suzuki, Carlton Melton, Sonic Shamen, Thor Boding, Syreregn, Doctors of Space, Astral Visions, Dr Space,  Aural Hallucinations and Øresund Space Collective. 

I have appeared on over 80 releases (LPs, CDs, 7”, CD-R, DVDs, etc..- see link below) including the bands Øresund Space Collective, Black Moon Circle, Syreregn, White Hills, Gas Giant, West Space and Love, The Sonic Shamen, Carlton Melton, Maat Lander, 3rd Ear Experience, Albino Rhino, Automaton, Doctors of Space, Dr Space’s Alien Planet Trip, Aural Hallucinations and others. 

I have been part of the music scene for 30 years as a music fan, attending, writing about and reviewing music (see links below). Since 2000, I have also performed with many bands and been part of two record companies (Burnt Hippie Recordings, Space Rock Productions).

I created my first home studio in 2009 as a simple place with focus on great acoustics.  I have gained a lot of experience and expertize over these years and found the acoustic environment is extremely important to creating impressive mixes. I have invested a lot of time studying acoustics, trying to find just the right people to design, and to build a world class studio (see details below).

In 2015, I retired from my job as a senior Diabetes Research scientist to focus on my passion in music. Having my own professional studio is my complete focus in life now. I really want to create my own music but also help other realise their own music and be able to record it for them in high quality. A studio like this simply does not exist in Central Portugal.

Running my own music studio is not a mere pipedream, but rather something that I will commit the next many years on my life on. As such, work on the studio has already started, and I've currently invested €5600 of my own money, and plan on investing another €40,000 of my own money. In addition, a lot of the required equipment for the studio is also already in-house (see below).

This is where the money has gone so far:

Studio Design- (2500€)

Designed by Stuart Allsop in Chile. Professional acoustic engineer.

http://spartanew.digistar.cl/Forum/index.php

Local Council Fees- 500€

Structural Engineer- 600€

Local Architect- 2000€

Where your money will go:

1. Constructing the main studio building- 80m2 (26,000€)

I will use local builders that have worked with me before.

Construction is due to start in October 2020. The building will be completed by the end of November. 

2. Studio Build- ~40-50,000€

The design for the inside is as follows: Control room (24m2), live room with equipment storage room (32m2), and entrance room that can also be used as a vocal booth (15m2). The inside will be built by Joules Newell, a world class studio builder based in Portugal. His father was a famous studio builder and also mixed GONG!! He will also work with other locals to insure we have a great studio. 

http://www.newellacousticengineering.com/

3. Other equipment (5-15,000€)

The equipment we have is as follows:

24 channels UAD Apollo interface running Logic. Yamaha HS80M Studio monitors, 4 channels of TL audio tube pre-amps, 2 channel TL audio equalizer, Audient ASP880 8 channel preamp, 19” Roland Space Echo unit, Roland Re101 and RE201 space echos, many microphones (4 handmade Swedish condenser Line CM3 mics, 2 SM57, SM58, Studio Projects B1 Vocal Microphone, Omnitronic DSM-500 drum kit microphone set, AKG D112 Mark II, Audix D6 and Prosonus PRM1).

As for studio instruments, we have a lot of keyboards and synthesizers (Hammond XB-2, Nord lead 2, Octave CAT, ARP Odyssey, Roland D-50, Novation Ultranova, Yamaha CS-10, Custom Modular Synth), as that is what I play and collect. We also have an Yamaha acoustic guitar, mandolin, misc percussion instruments, Squire precision bass, Ludwig drum kit (on the way), Custom 2 cabinet Bass stack (Made by Bass Labs in Copenhagen), Marshall Cabinet (circa 1982-83). Bongos, various small percussion instruments. 

What we still need:

I am still in need of a guitar head, bass head, 2nd guitar amplifier, cables, microphone stands, Leslie speaker for the Hammond XB-2,  16 channels of Pre-amps, more high quality microphones, headphones, etc.... As well as a new computer.  

4. Kickstarter fees (about 2000€)

Goal- About 70,000€ is the total budget but the goal is to raise about 20-30,000€.  IF we raise even more money, then I will be able to get some even better microphones, pre-amps, guitar amps. perhaps set up to do 5.1 mixing.

Risks and challenges

The Risk is extremely low as we have already started to build the studio, have a lot of the necessary equipment and are working with some of the best in the world (Joules Newell and Stuart Allsop).

Timeline- Expect the studio to be finished in mid 2021

The studio construction has begun.  The sooner we have the funding, the sooner we can finish creating this amazing place to make music! Thank YOU!

Links to my music and production credits:

https://www.discogs.com/artist/2126969-Dr-Space-2?filter_anv=0&type=Credits

http://oresundspacecollective.com

http://oresundspacecollective.bandcamp.com

http://doctorsofspace.bandcamp.com

http://drspace1.bandcamp.com

http://writingaboutmusic.blogspot.com

http://www.spacerockproductions.com 

Http://blackmooncircle.bandcamp.com

http://auralhallucinations.bandcamp.com
story_txt:
Purpose: Raise money to create a professional world class music studio
I have a strong vision and aspiration of being able to act as a producer to help bands create something new, fresh and interesting with music.  
I have been managing, performing and playing music since the early 2000s.  In the last 10 years I have mixed and or mastered material for Troldmand, Damo Suzuki, Carlton Melton, Sonic Shamen, Thor Boding, Syreregn, Doctors of Space, Astral Visions, Dr Space,  Aural Hallucinations and Øresund Space Collective. 
I have appeared on over 80 releases (LPs, CDs, 7”, CD-R, DVDs, etc..- see link below) including the bands Øresund Space Collective, Black Moon Circle, Syreregn, White Hills, Gas Giant, West Space and Love, The Sonic Shamen, Carlton Melton, Maat Lander, 3rd Ear Experience, Albino Rhino, Automaton, Doctors of Space, Dr Space’s Alien Planet Trip, Aural Hallucinations and others. 
I have been part of the music scene for 30 years as a music fan, attending, writing about and reviewing music (see links below). Since 2000, I have also performed with many bands and been part of two record companies (Burnt Hippie Recordings, Space Rock Productions).
I created my first home studio in 2009 as a simple place with focus on great acoustics.  I have gained a lot of experience and expertize over these years and found the acoustic environment is extremely important to creating impressive mixes. I have invested a lot of time studying acoustics, trying to find just the right people to design, and to build a world class studio (see details below).
In 2015, I retired from my job as a senior Diabetes Research scientist to focus on my passion in music. Having my own professional studio is my complete focus in life now. I really want to create my own music but also help other realise their own music and be able to record it for them in high quality. A studio like this simply does not exist in Central Portugal.
Running my own music studio is not a mere pipedream, but rather something that I will commit the next many years on my life on. As such, work on the studio has already started, and I've currently invested €5600 of my own money, and plan on investing another €40,000 of my own money. In addition, a lot of the required equipment for the studio is also already in-house (see below).
This is where the money has gone so far:
Studio Design- (2500€)
Designed by Stuart Allsop in Chile. Professional acoustic engineer.
http://spartanew.digistar.cl/Forum/index.php

He will also work with other locals to insure we have a great studio. 
http://www.newellacousticengineering.com/

The equipment we have is as follows:
24 channels UAD Apollo interface running Logic. Yamaha HS80M Studio monitors, 4 channels of TL audio tube pre-amps, 2 channel TL audio equalizer, Audient ASP880 8 channel preamp, 19” Roland Space Echo unit, Roland Re101 and RE201 space echos, many microphones (4 handmade Swedish condenser Line CM3 mics, 2 SM57, SM58, Studio Projects B1 Vocal Microphone, Omnitronic DSM-500 drum kit microphone set, AKG D112 Mark II, Audix D6 and Prosonus PRM1).
As for studio instruments, we have a lot of keyboards and synthesizers (Hammond XB-2, Nord lead 2, Octave CAT, ARP Odyssey, Roland D-50, Novation Ultranova, Yamaha CS-10, Custom Modular Synth), as that is what I play and collect. We also have an Yamaha acoustic guitar, mandolin, misc percussion instruments, Squire precision bass, Ludwig drum kit (on the way), Custom 2 cabinet Bass stack (Made by Bass Labs in Copenhagen), Marshall Cabinet (circa 1982-83). Bongos, various small percussion instruments. 
What we still need:
I am still in need of a guitar head, bass head, 2nd guitar amplifier, cables, microphone stands, Leslie speaker for the Hammond XB-2,  16 channels of Pre-amps, more high quality microphones, headphones, etc.... As well as a new computer.  
4. Kickstarter fees (about 2000€)
Goal- About 70,000€ is the total budget but the goal is to raise about 20-30,000€.  IF we raise even more money, then I will be able to get some even better microphones, pre-amps, guitar amps. perhaps set up to do 5.1 mixing.

story:
Short Summary

  • Slamuel Cunningham a  Singer Songwriter. Writes and performs his version Americana and Alternative music across Texas and else where.
  • This campaign kills 2 birds with one stone! These songs have been stacking up in my basement and attic for too long. People should hear them and listen at their own risk... lol they are "Demos" rough recordings but with these junk drawer gems we want to make smooth, well tracked professionally  mixed well played studio recordings of  new songs! Out with the old in with the new. But if you are like me and appreciate odd things maybe you will like or even love "Whiskey Gut Shot Demos."
  • By saying yes! And taking advantages of these perks you will help myself and my band greatly. We will be able to record some quality new music in an excellent way!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • If we raise $1000 we should be able to record one high quality single. Where does the money go? Good question. Well I want to record at Sound Arts Recording Studio is Houston Texas. I have found Brian Baker to be the best engineer getting the best out of me in his state of the art recording studio. If we record original tracks $70 an hour times 8 hours that's $560 plus $125 per session player we may use 2-3 because these guys are the best 3 session players $375, so $560 + $375 = $935 not to mention mixing and mastering... but it gets me started and we can use more of our own money if need be... but the struggle is real, laugh out loud, 
  • $5 Perks: For pledges of $5.00 or more you get all the digital downloads of "Whiskey Gut Shot Demos."
  • $15 Perks: For Pledges of $15.00 or more you get the digital downloads of "WGSD" and a limited edition poster print of the album art signed and numbered by the artist 1-100 0f 100.
  • $25 Perks: For Pledges of $25.00 or more you get the digital downloads of " WGSD (Whiskey Gut Shot Demos)" and a T-shirt they come in black or white they have hot pink in them.
  • $35 Perks: For Pledges of $35.00 or more you get: The Downloads! The Limited edition signed art! and The Shirt!
  • $55 Perks: For Pledges of $55.00 or more you get: The Downloads! The Limited edition signed art! And 2 Shirts!
  • $500 Perk: For Pledges of $500 or more you get everything in the $55 Perk plus a house Concert at your house with Slamuel Cunningham and Drummer Jesse Babyak on a Saturday TBD.

The Impact

 

  • Your partnership with artist like me keeps independent and alternative art alive! What would the world be like if only big corporations could make music; or if underground art wasn't there to give us something different?
  • I've never done a crowd campaign before but I know how to make music in the studio. Check out my previous band "Runes of Eden- Chiffondle Me" EP on itunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/chiffondle-me...
  • This is and has been my dream since I was a little boy actually and being able to write and record these songs is a complete dream come true. Thank you all I love you.

Risks & Challenges

Normally there are a lot of Risk to the contributors or pledgers of a crowd funding campaign but I have taken all the risk upon myself by already producing all the content and merchandise in advance for the Perks so everything will be ready to deliver to you once this campaign is over. The Only risk really are those I've taken, I hope you like "Whiskey Gut Shot Demos" and the Art we have created.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I understand some people cannot contribute by pledging at least $5 dollars, in that situation find one penny and repeat that 500 times then pledge!
  • But Please Share like Crazy!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short SummaryDoris Fields aka Lady D...is known as W.Va’s First Lady of Soul.

Lady D has been singing since the age of three years old. She is an actress, songwriter, director, playwright, promoter and poet. She has toured her one-woman show, “The Lady and the Empress” since 2003. It is a musical stage play based on the life and music of blues legend, Bessie Smith. She has performed her award winning song, "Go Higher" at one of President Barack Obama's 2009 inaugural balls. She has performed with blues stars such as Johnny Rawls and Bruce Katz.

Lady D returns with her sixth studio recording; an all original offering rooted firmly in the Blues and her Appalachian upbringing. With a little bit of help from friends, fans and anyone who loves the blues, she hopes to showcase not only her vocal and songwriting capabilities but also her talent as a poet.

Along with her album titled "Disturbing My Peace" Lady D is finally sharing the fruits of another of her artistic outlets. “Appalachian BluesSpeak” is a book that will feature poetry, spoken word, essays and song lyrics that paint a picture of what it has been like being a black female creative, growing up and living in Appalachia.

“Appalachian BluesSpeak” is scheduled to be released ahead of the album and will be offered as one of the perks of donating to the cd production. It is also a live performance piece that may be booked as a perk for upper level donations.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Honestly! The cost of studio recording is not cheap, especially when you are using quality musicians and engineering. I am trying to raise $7500 for this project. Here is what it will help cover:

  • Studio time/engineering
  • Musician fees
  • Copyright
  • Promotional video
  • CD artwork & printing
  • CD duplication

In return for your appreciated support, you'll receive some really cool perks! So check out that section to see what could be coming your way.

The Impact

This will be my first attempt at such a heavily blues filled recording. As my performances have lead me into that genre more and more and I have been embraced by the Blues community. I feel it's time to take the leap and do something for those fans of my blues performances that really reflects who I am and my artistic expression of the life I have lived. Being from West Virginia, I think of it as Appalachian Blues, creating my own lane!

Risks & Challenges

Life is risk! I'm a singer/songwriter and actress. Whenever I present my work, there's a risk that someone will not like it. There's also a risk that someone will. I'm betting on those people!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute. I understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Hoi, landgenoot! Onderaan de pagina vind je de Nederlandstalige tekst.)

Introduction

Around 12 months ago, I started working out a big ambition: to record a professional album. After hunderds of working hours (brainstorming, composing, rehearsing, recording and designing the product) the final result is finally in my hands. However, the best part is yet to come: bringing this album in the hands of music lovers like you!

'Inner Home' will be released on limited edition transparent vinyl and on a beautifully designed cd. To cover the production costs, I am asking for your support. To thank you for a donation, you will be among the first to receive the album or a related reward. More about that below.

 

About The Creator & The Production

My name is Simon Hölscher and I'm from the Netherlands. At the age of 7, I had my first drum lesson on a simple rubber practice pad. Little did I know, drumming would become my biggest passion and I would be playing hundreds of concerts, both in the Netherlands and abroad.

After four years of intensive music study at the Conservatory of Utrecht, I was still hungry for more. I moved to Denmark in 2018 for a two-year study called 'Master of Music' at the Royal Academy of Music. This is where my album came about. I made many new friends, who often amazed me with their musical abilities. Watch the video on top of this page to see them in action. Two of our singles have been released earlier this year.

I used to be drummer of a British/Dutch indie band called Alcuna Wilds. We recorded the EP Nothing Is Nothing in 2018, which has taught me some of the ins and outs of album production. That knowledge has enabled us to work in the most creative, cost-efficient and professional way. 

The album has been recorded in the House of Music in Aalborg, DK. Most of the recording has been done by the skilled engineer Martin Korsgaard. Jon Alexander was in charge of mixing and mastering. Before moving to Copenhagen, Jon has been in the recording team at Abbey Road Studios in London (best known from The Beatles). The visual appearance of the album has been created by photographer Sam Tomajko.

 

What I Ask For & What You Get

I hear you thinking: "So all the work has been done already?" Yes, the album is finished and the CD copies are made. Vinyl records will be ready for shipping at the end of March.

Speaking of vinyl...

Getting your record pressed on vinyl is quite expensive. Your donation will help me cover the manufacturing costs. And that's where you get to reap the benefits: 150 of those special transparent vinyl records are available to donors. If you donate before 25th of March, you will even receive it before the official release date.  Do you prefer CD or digital? Got you covered!

There will be two moments of shipping for all the perks:

  • March 26th (delivered before the official release date)
  • Early May (tbd)

 

 

The Impact You Make

Creative people usually don't like the business side of things, but I go about my future as if I'm running a startup. This album release is an investment in my future. One of the highest achievements for artists is being able to make a sustainable living from their art. Our connection between artist and audience is indispensible here. I will soon leave the safe music academy life behind me. Your support illuminates the path towards a succesful career with many concerts, music releases and other milestones to come! We can enjoy that together for a lifetime.

 

The Workings Of This Campaign

If 75% of the goal is reached, I will upload a full length studio clip of one album track.

If 100% of the goal is reached, I will give away one extremely rare test pressing of Inner Home to one of the donors. This one is pressed on black vinyl and will be signed with a personal message.

If we don't get to 100% of the goal, nothing changes for better or for worse. You will get your perk and I will still receive the donations. That's the value of Indiegogo.

Your donation will cover the following costs:

  • 70-80% of the donations will go towards the manufacturing costs (after taxes).
  • 12-22% will be used to cover postage stamps and packaging.
  • 8% will be used to cover the platform fee of Indiegogo.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you unable to donate? Sharing this page with your friends, family and network would make me just as happy. I hope to see you at one of my concerts or at another occasion!

Thank you in advance!

 

(Nederlands)

Hoe het begon

Ongeveer twaalf maanden geleden besloot ik een grote ambitie waar te gaan maken: een professioneel album opnemen. Na honderden uren werk (brainstormen, componeren, repeteren, opnemen en het product ontwerpen) is het eindresultaat dan eindelijk in handen. Maar het beste komt nog: het album in handen geven bij muziekliefhebbers zoals jij!

'Inner Home' komt uit op limited edition transparant vinyl en op een prachtig ontworpen cd. Om de productiekosten te dekken, vraag ik om jouw steun. Als dank voor je donatie ben je een van de eersten die het album of een andere beloning ontvangt. Hieronder lees je meer.

 

Over de maker & de productie

Mijn naam is Simon Hölscher. Op mijn zevende kreeg ik mijn eerste trommelles op een simpel rubberen oefenpadje. Ik had niet kunnen voorzien dat drummen mijn grootste passie werd en dat ik nu al honderden concerten zou hebben gespeeld in binnen- en buitenland.

Na vier jaar intensief studeren aan het Utrechts Conservatorium wilde ik nóg meer. Daarom verhuisde ik in 2018 naar Denemarken voor de twee-jarige studie 'Master of Music' aan de Royal Academy of Music. Hier kwam tevens het album tot stand. Ik maakte veel nieuwe vrienden, die me vaak versteld deden staan door hun muzikaliteit. Tot mijn grote vreugde heb ik een album met ze op kunnen nemen. Bekijk de video bovenaan deze pagina om ze in actie te zien. Er zijn zelfs al twee singles uitgebracht eerder dit jaar.

Ik was lange tijd drummer van de Brits-Nederlandse band Alcuna Wilds. Dankzij de opnames van onze EP Nothing Is Nothing heb ik veel geleerd over het produceren van een album. Die kennis kwam goed van pas om zo creatief, efficiënt en professioneel mogelijk te werk te gaan.

Het album is opgenomen in het House of Music in Aalborg, DK. Het opnameproces is geleid door de getalenteerde producer Martin Korsgaard. Jon Alexander was verantwoordelijk voor het mixen en masteren. Voordat hij naar Kopenhagen verhuisde, zat Jon in het opnameteam van de Abbey Road Studios in London (bekend van The Beatles). Het album artwork is gemaakt door fotograaf Sam Tomajko.

 

Wat ik vraag & wat jij krijgt

Ik hoor je denken: "Dus al het werk is al gedaan?" Ja, het album is af en de cd's zijn al geperst. De vinylplaten kunnen eind maart ook naar je verzonden worden.

Over vinyl gesproken...

Je album op vinyl laten persen is nogal duur. Jouw donatie helpt mij om die uitgaven te compenseren. En nu komt het leukste: 150 van die speciale transparante vinylplaten zijn beschikbaar voor donateurs. Als je vóór 25 maart bestelt, heb je 'm zelfs voor de officiële releasedatum in huis. Liever een cd of een digitaal album? Dat kan natuurlijk ook!

Er komen twee momenten voor het verzenden van de tegenprestaties:

  • 26 maart (geleverd vóór de officiële releasedatum)
  • Begin mei (ntb)

 

 

De impact van je donatie

Creatievelingen houden doorgaans niet van de zakelijke kant, maar ik zie mijn toekomst als een startup. Dit album is een investering in mijn toekomst. Een van de hoogste prestaties van artiesten is om te kunnen leven van hun kunst. Onze connectie, die tussen artiest en publiek, is daarbij onmisbaar. Ik laat binnenkort het veilige conservatoriumleventje achter me liggen. Jouw steun verlicht de weg naar een succesvolle carrière met veel concerten, nieuwe releases en andere mijlpalen! Daar kunnen we samen een leven lang van genieten.

 

Hoe deze campagne werkt

Bij 75% van het doelbedrag upload ik een volledige studio clip van een album track.

Bij 100% van het doelbedrag verloot ik een extreem zeldzame test pressing van Inner Home onder de donateurs. Deze is geperst op zwart vinyl en zal natuurlijk worden gesigneerd met een persoonlijke boodschap.

Als we de 100% niet halen is er niets aan de hand. Je krijgt gewoon je tegenprestatie en ik ontvang de donaties alsnog. Dat is de meerwaarde van Indiegogo.

Jouw donatie dekt de volgende kosten:

  • 70-80% van de donaties gaat naar de productie van het album (na belastingen).
  • 12-22% zal worden gebruikt voor postzegels en verpakking.
  • 8% zal worden gebruikt voor het platformgebruik van Indiegogo.

 

Andere manieren om te helpen

Heb je niet het vermogen om te doneren? Je maakt mij net zo blij als je deze pagina deelt met je vrienden, familie en netwerk. Hopelijk tot ziens bij een optreden of andere gelegenheid!

 

Alvast hartelijk bedankt!
story_txt:
(Hoi, landgenoot! Onderaan de pagina vind je de Nederlandstalige tekst.)
Introduction

Around 12 months ago, I started working out a big ambition: to record a professional album. After hunderds of working hours (brainstorming, composing, rehearsing, recording and designing the product) the final result is finally in my hands. However, the best part is yet to come: bringing this album in the hands of music lovers like you!
'Inner Home' will be released on limited edition transparent vinyl and on a beautifully designed cd. To cover the production costs, I am asking for your support. To thank you for a donation, you will be among the first to receive the album or a related reward. More about that below.
 
About The Creator & The Production

My name is Simon Hölscher and I'm from the Netherlands. At the age of 7, I had my first drum lesson on a simple rubber practice pad. Little did I know, drumming would become my biggest passion and I would be playing hundreds of concerts, both in the Netherlands and abroad.
After four years of intensive music study at the Conservatory of Utrecht, I was still hungry for more. I moved to Denmark in 2018 for a two-year study called 'Master of Music' at the Royal Academy of Music. This is where my album came about. I made many new friends, who often amazed me with their musical abilities. Watch the video on top of this page to see them in action. Two of our singles have been released earlier this year.
I used to be drummer of a British/Dutch indie band called Alcuna Wilds. We recorded the EP Nothing Is Nothing in 2018, which has taught me some of the ins and outs of album production. That knowledge has enabled us to work in the most creative, cost-efficient and professional way. 
The album has been recorded in the House of Music in Aalborg, DK. Most of the recording has been done by the skilled engineer Martin Korsgaard. Jon Alexander was in charge of mixing and mastering. Before moving to Copenhagen, Jon has been in the recording team at Abbey Road Studios in London (best known from The Beatles). The visual appearance of the album has been created by photographer Sam Tomajko.

 

What I Ask For & What You Get

I hear you thinking: "So all the work has been done already?" Yes, the album is finished and the CD copies are made. Vinyl records will be ready for shipping at the end of March.
Speaking of vinyl...
Getting your record pressed on vinyl is quite expensive. Your donation will help me cover the manufacturing costs. And that's where you get to reap the benefits: 150 of those special transparent vinyl records are available to donors. If you donate before 25th of March, you will even receive it before the official release date.  Do you prefer CD or digital? Got you covered!
There will be two moments of shipping for all the perks:

March 26th (delivered before the official release date)
Early May (tbd)

 

 

The Impact You Make
Creative people usually don't like the business side of things, but I go about my future as if I'm running a startup. This album release is an investment in my future. One of the highest achievements for artists is being able to make a sustainable living from their art. Our connection between artist and audience is indispensible here. I will soon leave the safe music academy life behind me. Your support illuminates the path towards a succesful career with many concerts, music releases and other milestones to come! We can enjoy that together for a lifetime.

 
The Workings Of This Campaign

If 75% of the goal is reached, I will upload a full length studio clip of one album track.
If 100% of the goal is reached, I will give away one extremely rare test pressing of Inner Home to one of the donors. This one is pressed on black vinyl and will be signed with a personal message.
If we don't get to 100% of the goal, nothing changes for better or for worse. You will get your perk and I will still receive the donations. That's the value of Indiegogo.
Your donation will cover the following costs:

70-80% of the donations will go towards the manufacturing costs (after taxes).
12-22% will be used to cover postage stamps and packaging.
8% will be used to cover the platform fee of Indiegogo.


 

Other Ways You Can Help
Are you unable to donate? Sharing this page with your friends, family and network would make me just as happy. I hope to see you at one of my concerts or at another occasion!
Thank you in advance!

 
(Nederlands)
Hoe het begon

Ongeveer twaalf maanden geleden besloot ik een grote ambitie waar te gaan maken: een professioneel album opnemen. Na honderden uren werk (brainstormen, componeren, repeteren, opnemen en het product ontwerpen) is het eindresultaat dan eindelijk in handen. Maar het beste komt nog: het album in handen geven bij muziekliefhebbers zoals jij!
'Inner Home' komt uit op limited edition transparant vinyl en op een prachtig ontworpen cd. Om de productiekosten te dekken, vraag ik om jouw steun. Als dank voor je donatie ben je een van de eersten die het album of een andere beloning ontvangt. Hieronder lees je meer.
 
Over de maker & de productie

Mijn naam is Simon Hölscher. Op mijn zevende kreeg ik mijn eerste trommelles op een simpel rubberen oefenpadje. Ik had niet kunnen voorzien dat drummen mijn grootste passie werd en dat ik nu al honderden concerten zou hebben gespeeld in binnen- en buitenland.
Na vier jaar intensief studeren aan het Utrechts Conservatorium wilde ik nóg meer. Daarom verhuisde ik in 2018 naar Denemarken voor de twee-jarige studie 'Master of Music' aan de Royal Academy of Music. Hier kwam tevens het album tot stand. Ik maakte veel nieuwe vrienden, die me vaak versteld deden staan door hun muzikaliteit. Tot mijn grote vreugde heb ik een album met ze op kunnen nemen. Bekijk de video bovenaan deze pagina om ze in actie te zien. Er zijn zelfs al twee singles uitgebracht eerder dit jaar.
Ik was lange tijd drummer van de Brits-Nederlandse band Alcuna Wilds. Dankzij de opnames van onze EP Nothing Is Nothing heb ik veel geleerd over het produceren van een album. Die kennis kwam goed van pas om zo creatief, efficiënt en professioneel mogelijk te werk te gaan.
Het album is opgenomen in het House of Music in Aalborg, DK. Het opnameproces is geleid door de getalenteerde producer Martin Korsgaard. Jon Alexander was verantwoordelijk voor het mixen en masteren. Voordat hij naar Kopenhagen verhuisde, zat Jon in het opnameteam van de Abbey Road Studios in London (bekend van The Beatles). Het album artwork is gemaakt door fotograaf Sam Tomajko.

 
Wat ik vraag & wat jij krijgt

Ik hoor je denken: "Dus al het werk is al gedaan?" Ja, het album is af en de cd's zijn al geperst. De vinylplaten kunnen eind maart ook naar je verzonden worden.
Over vinyl gesproken...
Je album op vinyl laten persen is nogal duur. Jouw donatie helpt mij om die uitgaven te compenseren. En nu komt het leukste: 150 van die speciale transparante vinylplaten zijn beschikbaar voor donateurs. Als je vóór 25 maart bestelt, heb je 'm zelfs voor de officiële releasedatum in huis. Liever een cd of een digitaal album? Dat kan natuurlijk ook!
Er komen twee momenten voor het verzenden van de tegenprestaties:

26 maart (geleverd vóór de officiële releasedatum)
Begin mei (ntb)

 

 
De impact van je donatie
Creatievelingen houden doorgaans niet van de zakelijke kant, maar ik zie mijn toekomst als een startup. Dit album is een investering in mijn toekomst. Een van de hoogste prestaties van artiesten is om te kunnen leven van hun kunst. Onze connectie, die tussen artiest en publiek, is daarbij onmisbaar. Ik laat binnenkort het veilige conservatoriumleventje achter me liggen. Jouw steun verlicht de weg naar een succesvolle carrière met veel concerten, nieuwe releases en andere mijlpalen! Daar kunnen we samen een leven lang van genieten.

 
Hoe deze campagne werkt
Bij 75% van het doelbedrag upload ik een volledige studio clip van een album track.
Bij 100% van het doelbedrag verloot ik een extreem zeldzame test pressing van Inner Home onder de donateurs. Deze is geperst op zwart vinyl en zal natuurlijk worden gesigneerd met een persoonlijke boodschap.
Als we de 100% niet halen is er niets aan de hand. Je krijgt gewoon je tegenprestatie en ik ontvang de donaties alsnog. Dat is de meerwaarde van Indiegogo.
Jouw donatie dekt de volgende kosten:

70-80% van de donaties gaat naar de productie van het album (na belastingen).
12-22% zal worden gebruikt voor postzegels en verpakking.
8% zal worden gebruikt voor het platformgebruik van Indiegogo.


 
Andere manieren om te helpen
Heb je niet het vermogen om te doneren? Je maakt mij net zo blij als je deze pagina deelt met je vrienden, familie en netwerk. Hopelijk tot ziens bij een optreden of andere gelegenheid!
 
Alvast hartelijk bedankt!

story:
Hi, i'm Johan.  Previously i runned the Toothpick and Kraak labels.  Nowadays i'm doing basically the same with Knotwilg Records. In the past i financed most stuff on a personal level but seeing the "niche" of this experimental field i need some financial backbone to keep the label running in support of the artists which are seeking a wider audience.

 

Being passionate about something is no crime but i think small scaled labels should be honest towards themselves/artists.  Facts remain what they are.  Releasing stuff in small scaled editions need to sell out to break even.  Sometimes that works, but there's hardly any profit left to invest in a new project.  But while a wider audience does embrace the vinyl hype mainly buying unnecessary reiusses, young or unknown artists are often obliged to turn themselves into either doing everything themselves or towards small labels.

Knotwilg provides a platform for unheard melodies/sounds.  But without financial backing i can not provide, nor plan, a decent Knotwilg release schedule without garanty towards a small, but dedicated fanbase.  Been there, done that but my job wages are way too low to provide that garanty.

 

 

I'm looking into a flex funding so i can go ahead with contacting bands and starting to release the so far 5 lps and a couple of 7"'s planned.   Depending on how this funding goes i will give out new names by the end of 2017.  

 

The easiest way to support is simply clicking the "back it" button.  But there are goodies as well. Each release will have a small edition of a maximum run of 300 copies (most even less, in case of a lathe cut maximum 150 copies).  Every release also has a initial edition which is different to the "standard" release.  The highest perks will get a testpressing on top of it.

 

I can't give out names  (besides Saule (B) & Weiland (B) but will do so every time one goal is achieved.

Previous artists released  are Noel Meek (NZ), Sandoz Lab Technicians (NZ), Gangalai & Gourabai (B), Weird Dust (B) and Kanker Kommando (B)

Future schedule

KW07: Stefan Christensen (US) : City Code LP

KW08: TBA: Tba LP

KW09: Weiland (B): Perouche 7"

KW10: TBA: Tba 7" or LP

KW11: Saule (B): tba LP

 

In the past i financed almost everything myself but seeing the costs in mastering, distributing and promoting music i must seek alternative ways.  Especially seeing  Nationwide (and internationally) funding is put onto a low level.  Some of the projects also need extensive research and restoration of old audio material which turns out to be unreachable without any funding so....  A whole range of creative elements do benefit from this be it visual, or audio artists.

It also opens doors towards co-productions, provided it settles comfortable within Knotwilg standards.

If the funding exceeds its goal some of the money can go towards f.i. helping out with a contribution towards a Knotwilg artist planning to tour.  Transport (plane, train, car) can cost a lot of money.  Seeing the fees most bands/artists sometimes are getting it hardly covers even that.  But playing live remains one of the best way to introduce yourself to a new audience.

Initial campaign goes off for 60 days but will continue after that as well. It does not stop here and helps musicians throughout the world to get their things heard.  

 

 

Let's make this work, johan

story:
The wonderful Creative Scotland have funded the recording of an albums worth of material with Chris Marshall and Johnny Madden at Glasgow's 7 West Studios.

We now need your help to raise the funds to promote and release the music in 2018. We'll kick the year off with a 6 track EP on 10'' vinyl in April, with no plans to slow down with the release of more material.

We need your help to fund the promo costs, video costs and the printing of vinyl and merch.
story_txt:
The wonderful Creative Scotland have funded the recording of an albums worth of material with Chris Marshall and Johnny Madden at Glasgow's 7 West Studios.
We now need your help to raise the funds to promote and release the music in 2018. We'll kick the year off with a 6 track EP on 10'' vinyl in April, with no plans to slow down with the release of more material.
We need your help to fund the promo costs, video costs and the printing of vinyl and merch.

story:
"I have a basic mechanical knowledge of the operation of the instrument, and I got an imagination, and when the time comes up in the song to play a solo it's me against the laws of nature. I don't know what I'm going to play, I don't know what I'm going to do. I know roughly how long I have to play it, and it's a game, where you have a piece of time and you get to decorate it." - Frank Zappa

Decorating Time

 

I'm James Gilmore, a guitarist from North Carolina. In January 2020 I recorded a trio album of my own original music with Kassem Williams and Butler Knowles. We are raising funds to pay for the production and release of the record, which I'm calling Decorating Time.

This record is a product of our individual and joint musical identities, forged in central North Carolina's fertile musical environment. When I met Kassem and Butler at jam sessions at The Shed, a short-lived but important venue in Durham, I had an injury that prevented me from playing for about a year and a half. During this time I listened to music constantly and intensely, sometimes listening to only one record for a period of one or two weeks. Especially on repeat were 'big' sounding albums, music with lots of space, like Sonny Rollins' epic Live at The Village Vanguard and Miles Davis' complete Live at The Plugged Nickel. I also transcribed, composed, and explored meditation and other ways to deal mentally and emotionally with the fact that I could not play. What emerged from this time, after an eventual surgery and return to playing, were the pieces of a new relationship with music, as well as a number of compositions that eventually morphed into this musical document, Decorating Time.

The music is not mine, though. The group and the songs evolved to fit one another, and right now I can't imagine playing it with anyone but Butler and Kassem: I love everything they did on this record and I think you will love it too.

Kris Hilbert was a gift to this group. Plenty of engineers and musicians know about him already: I hope more musicians in this vein will seek him out.  

Enjoy the pitch video by Kassem Williams / Hodari Productions. All the still photos are by Daniel White. 

The CD and visual materials related to the record will feature photos of amazing artworks by Jenna Schwartz. The photos of her work were taken by Harrison Haynes, and they are works of art in their own right!

story:
Hello I am Tony Luck, a Los Angeles music artist who blends truth/conspiracies with catchy melodies and quality choruses. My next album project "Super NOVA" has been 2 years in the making and in its final steps to being finished. I had to swallow my pride and ask for help to get the new album out to the people.

 

My goal is to $2500 which would cover such costs as:

  • Last of Recording Studio Time/Mastering of Album - $300
  • Album Artwork - $200
  • 1000 Hardcopy CD's of the new Album - $800
  • Tee-Shirts made - $300
  • Website Upgrade  - $100
  • 2 Music Videos from album - $600
  • Marketing the new album - $200

 

In exchange for Donating $20 - $50

  • You get a FREE copy of the New Album. Signed and Shipped anywhere in the US for FREE.
  • A copy of my last album "Universally Privileged" thrown in for FREE for Supporting me.

In exchange for Donating $51 - $250

  • You get EVERYTHING mentioned before.
  • A Custom Tee-Shirt of your choice and size.
  • A Story Shout out on my Instagram Stories
  • A 15 min Phone Call (On an Agreed Upon Day & Time) Where We Can Discuss Any & All Topics

In exchange for Donating $251 - $500

  • You get EVERYTHING mentioned before in both packages.
  • 30 min Skype Call (On an Agreed Upon Day & Time) Where We Can Discuss life or Aliens.
  • Follow you on Instagram!
  • Make A special Post for those in this category w Raffle Give Away!!!!

The Vision!

This support will help catapult my music grind for 2020 in many ways such as: 

  • It will give me an opportunity to open an online store to support myself and my family.
  • Open doors for more shows and performances of new songs.
  • Create more Music Videos for the new songs on the album.
  • Open peoples eyes and ears to the truth.

If the Initial Goal is Not Fully Reached:

The received donations would go to finishing the recording of the album, cost of album Artwork and the creation of the physical CD's of the Album "Super NOVA".

Other ways to Support if you can't Donate:

  • You can share this campaign link on Social Media & through word or mouth.
  • Search "Tony Luck" on any Music Platform and Stream or Buy the music.
  • Go to @_TonyLuck on Instagram. Follow, Like and Comment on his music posts.

Thank you All so much for taking the time out for us sometimes forgotten Independent Artists!

story:
The year 2020 will be remembered for a long time as a very difficult year for the economy and more particularly the entertainment world. Government provisions and their applications did not allow us, "the artists" to perform in concert. All our shows being postponed to 2021, Chris Holmes has decided to take advantage of this period of non-live activity to offer you new projects.The end of 2020 will see the release of a DVD / Blu-ray documentary that is sure to get you excited and heralds Chris's comeback in 2021!Participating in this campaign will allow Chris to bring you a new high quality album for the year 2021.You can therefore make a donation in exchange for a consideration such as a CD or guitar picks, you can even acquire Chris's leather jacket with its personalized paint or see your name inscribed in the booklet for the new album.Along with the album, you'll be able to pre-order a collector’s collection of gorgeous never-before-seen photos embellished with Chris’s thoughts to help you get to know him better. The book will be in very limited quantities, numbered and signed by Chris himself.All the products offered in the Indiegogo campaign are new and exclusive. Now is the time to join the adventure and acquire limited edition coins that you will never see again.There is no small donation, all donations are important so that Chris can realize his projects and share them with you "the Fans" through new music.

Chris Holmes is back and gonna make the powder talk !!!

 

 

L’année 2020 restera longtemps dans nos mémoires comme une année bien difficile pour l’économie et plus particulièrement le monde du spectacle. Les dispositions gouvernementales et leurs applications ne nous ont pas permis à nous, « les artistes » de nous produire en concert.  Tous nos shows étant reportés en 2021, Chris Holmes a décidé de profiter de cette période d'inactivité live pour vous proposer de nouveaux projets. 
Le début de l’année 2021 verra la publication d’un DVD/Blu-ray documentaire qui va vous passionner à coup sûr et annoncera le grand retour de Chris !
Participer à cette campagne permettra à Chris de vous proposer un nouvel album de grande qualité pour l’année 2021. 
Vous pouvez donc faire un don en échange d’une contrepartie comme un CD ou encore des médiators, vous pourrez même acquérir le blouson en cuir de Chris avec sa peinture personnalisée ou encore voir votre nom inscrit dans le livret du nouvel album.
Parallèlement à l’album, vous pourrez commander en avant-première un recueil collector de magnifiques photos inédites agrémenté des pensées de Chris qui vous permettront de mieux le connaître. L’ouvrage sera en quantité très limitée, numéroté et signé par Chris lui-même.
Tous les produits proposés dans la campagne Indiegogo sont nouveaux et exclusifs. C’est le moment de participer à l’aventure et d’acquérir des pièces en tirage limité que vous ne verrez plus jamais. 
Il n’y a pas de petit don, tous les dons sont importants afin que Chris puisse réaliser ses projets et les partager avec vous « les Fans » à travers de la nouveauté musicale.
Chris Holmes est de retour et va faire parler la poudre !!!

 

 

El año 2020 será recordado durante mucho tiempo como un año muy difícil para la economía y más particularmente para el mundo del entretenimiento. Las disposiciones gubernamentales y sus aplicaciones no nos permitían a nosotros, "los artistas" actuar en concierto. Aplazados todos nuestros espectáculos hasta el 2021, Chris Holmes decidio aprovechar en este periodo de inactividad en vivo para ofreceros nuevos proyectos.
¡A fines de 2020 verá el lanzamiento de un documental en DVD / Blu-ray que seguramente lo emocionará y anuncia el regreso de Chris en 2021!
Participar en esta campaña le permitirá a Chris traerles un nuevo álbum de alta calidad para el año 2021.
Por lo tanto, puede hacer donaciones simples o incluso hacer una donación a cambio de una consideración como un CD o púas de guitarra, incluso puedes adquirir la chaqueta de cuero de Chris con su pintura personalizada o ver su nombre inscrito en el folleto para el nuevo álbum.
Junto con el álbum, podrás reservar una colección para coleccionistas de hermosas fotos nunca antes vistas adornadas con los pensamientos de Chris para que puedas conocerlo mejor. El libro estará en cantidades muy limitadas, numerado y firmado por el mismo Chris.
Todos los productos ofrecidos en la campaña de Indiegogo son nuevos y exclusivos. Ahora es el momento de unirte a la aventura y adquirir monedas de edición limitada que nunca volverás a ver.
No hay donación pequeña, todas las donaciones son importantes para que Chris pueda realizar sus proyectos y compartirlos con ustedes "los Fans" a través de nueva música.

Chris Holmes ha vuelto y hará que la pólvora hable !!!

 

 

Das Jahr 2020 wird lange Zeit als ein sehr schwieriges Jahr für die Wirtschaft und insbesondere für die Unterhaltungswelt in Erinnerung bleiben. Die Bestimmungen der Regierung und ihre Anwendungen erlaubten uns, "den Künstlern", nicht, gemeinsam aufzutreten. Da alle unsere Shows auf 2021 verschoben wurden, hat Chris Holmes beschlossen, diese Zeit der Nicht-Live-Aktivitäten zu nutzen, um Ihnen neue Projekte anzubieten.
Ende 2020 wird eine DVD / Blu-ray-Dokumentation veröffentlicht, die Sie mit Sicherheit begeistern und das Comeback von Chris im Jahr 2021 einläuten wird!
Durch die Teilnahme an dieser Kampagne kann Chris Ihnen ein neues hochwertiges Album für das Jahr 2021 bringen.
Sie können also einfach für etwas spenden, wie eine CD oder Gitarrenpicks. Sie können sogar Chris 'Leder-Bühnenjacke mit einer benutzerdefinierten Farbe oder Ihrem Namen aus der neuen Albumbroschüre kaufen.
Zusammen mit dem Album können Sie eine Sammlersammlung wunderschöner, nie zuvor gesehener Fotos vorbestellen, die mit Chris 'Gedanken verziert sind, damit Sie ihn besser kennenlernen können. Das Buch wird in sehr begrenzten Mengen von Chris selbst nummeriert und signiert sein.
Alle in der Indiegogo-Kampagne angebotenen Produkte sind neu und exklusiv. Jetzt ist es an der Zeit, sich dem Abenteuer anzuschließen und limitierte Münzen zu erwerben, die Sie nie wieder sehen werden.
Es gibt keine kleinen Spenden, alle Spenden sind wichtig, damit Chris seine Projekte realisieren und sie durch neue Musik mit euch "Fans" teilen kann.
Chris Holmes ist zurück und wird das Pulver zum Reden bringen !!!

 

 

L'anno 2020 sarà ricordato a lungo come un anno molto difficile per l'economia e più in particolare per il mondo dello spettacolo. Le disposizioni governative e le loro applicazioni non permettevano a noi "artisti" di esibirci in concerto. Posticipati tutti i nostri spettacoli al 2021, Chris Holmes ha deciso di approfittare di questo periodo di attività non live per proporvi nuovi progetti.
La fine del 2020 vedrà l'uscita di un documentario in DVD / Blu-ray che sicuramente ti entusiasmerà e preannuncia il ritorno di Chris nel 2021!
La partecipazione a questa campagna consentirà a Chris di offrirti un nuovo album di alta qualità per l'anno 2021.
Puoi quindi fare una donazione in cambio di un corrispettivo come un CD o plettri per chitarra, puoi persino acquistare la giacca in pelle di Chris con la sua vernice personalizzata o vedere il tuo nome inscritto nel libretto per il nuovo album.
Insieme all'album, potrai preordinare una raccolta da collezione di splendide foto mai viste prima impreziosite dai pensieri di Chris per aiutarti a conoscerlo meglio. Il libro sarà in quantità molto limitate, numerato e firmato da Chris stesso.
Tutti i prodotti offerti nella campagna Indiegogo sono nuovi ed esclusivi. Ora è il momento di unirti all'avventura e acquisire monete in edizione limitata che non vedrai mai più.
Non c'è una piccola donazione, tutte le donazioni sono importanti in modo che Chris possa realizzare i suoi progetti e condividerli con voi "i Fans" attraverso la nuova musica.
Chris Holmes è tornato e farà parlare la polvere !!!

 

 

2020年は、経済、特にエンターテインメントの世界にとって非常に困難な年として長い間記憶されます。政府の規定とその適用により、「アーティスト」が私たちと協調して演奏することはできませんでした。私たちのすべてのショーは2021年に延期され、Chris Holmesはこの非ライブアクティビティの期間を利用して新しいプロジェクトを提供することを決定しました.2020年の終わりには、確実に入手できるDVD / Blu-rayドキュメンタリーのリリースが見られますこのキャンペーンに参加することで、Chrisは2021年の新しい高品質のアルバムを手に入れることができます。したがって、CDやギターピックなどの対価と引き換えに寄付をすることができます。クリスのパーソナライズされた絵の具でレザージャケットを手に入れたり、新しいアルバムのブックレットに名前が刻まれているのを確認したりすることができます。あなたが彼をもっとよく知るのを助けるための考え。この本の数量は非常に限られており、クリス自身が番号を付けて署名します。今こそ冒険に参加して、二度と見られない限定版のコインを手に入れるときです。小さな寄付はありません。すべての寄付は、クリスがプロジェクトを実現し、新しい音楽を通じてあなたと「ファン」と共有するために重要です。

クリス・ホームズが帰ってきて、パウダートークをします!!

 

 

O ano de 2020 será lembrado por muito tempo como um ano muito difícil para a economia e mais particularmente para o mundo do entretenimento. As disposições governamentais e suas aplicações não permitiam que nós, "os artistas", tocássemos em concerto. Todos os nossos shows sendo adiados para 2021, Chris Holmes decidiu aproveitar este período de atividades não ao vivo para lhe oferecer novos projetos.
O início de 2021 verá o lançamento de um documentário em DVD / Blu-ray que com certeza irá empolgar você e anunciar a volta de Chris!
A participação nesta campanha permitirá que Chris traga a você um novo álbum de alta qualidade para o ano de 2021.
Para que você possa fazer uma doação em troca de uma consideração como um CD ou palhetas de guitarra, você pode até adquirir a jaqueta de couro de Chris com sua pintura personalizada ou ver seu nome escrito no livreto do novo álbum.
Junto com o álbum, você poderá pré-encomendar uma coleção de lindas fotos nunca antes vistas de colecionador, embelezadas com os pensamentos de Chris, que o ajudarão a conhecê-lo melhor. O livro será em quantidade muito limitada, numerado e assinado pelo próprio Chris.
Todos os produtos oferecidos na campanha Indiegogo são novos e exclusivos. Agora é a hora de entrar na aventura e adquirir moedas de edição limitada que você nunca verá novamente.
Não é uma pequena doação, todas as doações são importantes para que Chris possa realizar seus projetos e compartilhá-los com vocês, "fãs", através de novas músicas.
Chris Holmes está de volta e vai fazer a pólvora falar !!!

story:
Little Journeys to the Homes of the Great

Liminal Space Ensemble, Buffalo’s new music collective, is partnering with local production company, Green Buffalo Productions, to commission and present five new musical works and five new literary works celebrating the founder of the Roycroft community, Elbert Hubbard. The works will be premiered by LSE at the Roycroft Campus in East Aurora, NY in June 2021, Hubbard’s 165th birthday month.

The project, Little Journeys to the Homes of the Great, aims to breathe fresh life into all of Hubbard’s contributions to American culture.

LSE and GBP have hand-chosen five talented composers, five incredible writers, and seven musicians to collaborate on this project (read about them here!). Each composer is paired with a writer and will choose a notable time or event from the life of Elbert Hubbard to inspire both a literary and musical work. The pairs will collaborate on the form and instrumentation of their pieces and the final result will be premiered in June 2021, Hubbard’s 165th birthday month in East Aurora, New York, the home of the Roycroft campus.

LSE and GBP are proud to collaborate with the Roycroft campus for this event.

A snowy day at our first meeting on the Roycroft campus.

The Impact

This project is a celebration of community. Elbert Hubbard’s Roycroft artisan community brought together like-minded individuals to create art, discuss new ideas, and bring high-quality goods and products to WNY. We could think of no better way to honor his legacy than to once again, bring together a group of artists to create something new for the community to enjoy.

Little Journeys to the Homes of the Great aims to breathe fresh life into all of Hubbard’s contributions to American culture. While known to many locals in the Western New York area as the founder of the Roycroft campus, few are aware of the intricacies and complexities of the man himself, and fewer still of the global reach of his influence. Western New Yorkers take pride in their cultural exports, and we think this project will go a long way towards building a stronger understanding of the man at the center of an entire cultural movement.

Now more than ever, society is turning to music and art to lift our spirits and bring us together. This will be a project that was born out of turmoil and its timely completion will be a constant reminder to us all that beauty and new life can always be found even in the darkest of circumstances.

 

Why we need your help

During the time of COVID-19, the performing arts have been hit particularly hard. Both LSE and GBP have had to cancel the remainder of their performing seasons, resulting in a significant loss of revenue. LSE and GBP are small sole-proprietorships and therefore ineligible to receive emergency funding from the state and other arts organizations. Many of the composers and writers involved in this project have lost work and many of them are depending on the income from this project to sustain their livelihoods.

Your participation in this campaign will go directly to our composers and writers to pay their commission fees.

We understand that this pandemic has affected so many of members of our community. That's why we are creating this "give-what-you-can" campaign. Any sized donation helps - whether it's $1 or $5. If you are in a position to help, please consider contributing and supporting these amazing young composers and writers!

Our project meeting from April 21st, social distancing style! (With pet guest appearances)

 

Risks & Challenges

The official launch date of our project is set for June 1st, 2020 where our commissioned artists will receive the first half of their commissions. If we are unable to complete this campaign, the project will have to be delayed and our composers and writers will not receive the income they are relying on to sustain themselves during the pandemic.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign widely!
  • Get project updates by joining the Liminal Space Ensemble mailing list
  • "Like" Liminal Space Ensemble and Green Buffalo Productions on social media

story:
Legacy Project by Adam Traum

Fundraising goal: $3600 (240 CDs)

The inspiration of “Legacy,” Adam Traum’s latest recording project came from his musically-rich family heritage and his passion to move that tradition forward in his own voice. This project is his most intimate collection of songs to date. Stylistically diverse, these tunes remain cohesive as they tell stories of love, heartbreak, natural beauty and joy. 

By purchasing an advanced copy of “Legacy” you are helping to bring an independent artist’s vision to market. Any donation will get you a digital copy and a $20 pre-sale gets you a signed CD. Benefits for donations of $50-$100 include a 50-minute private guitar lesson (online or local to Adam). $800 or more gets you a house concert in the Continental United States.

Adam’s goal of $3600 represents the pre-sale of 240 CDs. Projected costs: design ($800), Replication ($1200) and promotional expenses ($1600).

A little more about the project:

Adam started to make home demos of his original material for reference in the late fall of 2019. It started to snowball into something bigger, becoming a deeper sonic exploration into songs that he has been feverishly composing over the past few years. 

Adam brought in his father, Happy Traum, for two tunes, including the title track, “Legacy.” Adam’s longtime musical partner and bassist Jack Hines (The Mosey Boys, Wolf Run, Straw Wattles) appears on several tracks. Mandolin master David Thom (Mosey Boys) appears as does fellow Straw Wattles bandmate and renowned sideman Josh Yenne. 

In addition to originals he covers Steve Earle’s “Hometown Blues,” an early inspiration in his transition from a country blues fingerpicker to a bonafide songwriter. He also plans a few other surprises in the traditional song department.

Adam needs your help to bring this project for released this fall. His budget to put “Legacy” out has been decimated by the loss of live performances and festivals during the Covid-19 shutdown. 

As a sponsor of this album you become a partner in the success of the project. Every dollar counts and will be greatly appreciated!

Tiers of Donations:

Under $20 Download

$20 Signed copy of CD

$45 CD and T-shirt

$50 50-minute private lesson

$100  2-50 minute private lessons

$250 Live (Zoom) workshop on guitar, mandolin or ukulele (for your and a group of friends)

$400 House  concert in the S.F. Bay Area 

$800+ House concert in Continental U.S.

A la cart option:

3 or more CDs ($15 each-shipping including)

2 or more T-shirts ($20 each-shipping included)
story_txt: Legacy Project by Adam TraumFundraising goal: $3600 (240 CDs)The inspiration of “Legacy,” Adam Traum’s latest recording project came from his musically-rich family heritage and his passion to move that tradition forward in his own voice. This project is his most intimate collection of songs to date. Stylistically diverse, these tunes remain cohesive as they tell stories of love, heartbreak, natural beauty and joy. By purchasing an advanced copy of “Legacy” you are helping to bring an independent artist’s vision to market. Any donation will get you a digital copy and a $20 pre-sale gets you a signed CD. Benefits for donations of $50-$100 include a 50-minute private guitar lesson (online or local to Adam). $800 or more gets you a house concert in the Continental United States.Adam’s goal of $3600 represents the pre-sale of 240 CDs. Projected costs: design ($800), Replication ($1200) and promotional expenses ($1600).A little more about the project:Adam started to make home demos of his original material for reference in the late fall of 2019. It started to snowball into something bigger, becoming a deeper sonic exploration into songs that he has been feverishly composing over the past few years. Adam brought in his father, Happy Traum, for two tunes, including the title track, “Legacy.” Adam’s longtime musical partner and bassist Jack Hines (The Mosey Boys, Wolf Run, Straw Wattles) appears on several tracks. Mandolin master David Thom (Mosey Boys) appears as does fellow Straw Wattles bandmate and renowned sideman Josh Yenne. In addition to originals he covers Steve Earle’s “Hometown Blues,” an early inspiration in his transition from a country blues fingerpicker to a bonafide songwriter. He also plans a few other surprises in the traditional song department.Adam needs your help to bring this project for released this fall. story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Shawn, and I'm extremely excited to announce the release of my new album, Puzzles. These ten songs are the culmination of the last five years of my life, following me as I went through college, started a relationship, and moved across the country. Puzzles takes musical queues from the last album, but growth is apparent in every aspect. There's more instruments, better songwriting, better recording, and an amazing and growing group of people involved. 

By supporting this campaign, you're preordering the album and merch, and helping to fund some of the up-front costs associated with mastering and manufacturing. We'd like to make this album the best that it can be, and we'll need your help to do that. 

Who are you?

I'm Shawn, a singer and songwriter from Syracuse, NY and now living in San Francisco. I didn't start singing until the end of high school, but quickly fell in love with it. I had been playing guitar and piano and writing things here and there, but singing brought the opportunity for me to write lyrics to tell a story in my songwriting. I started writing songs continuously, quickly coming out with my first album, The Dream, at the beginning of college. Now that I'm done with school and moving on to the next chapter of my life, I'm ready to tell my story through my new music.

What's in it for me?

An album of course! Releasing on digital, CD, and vinyl. You can also get stickers, t-shirts, and every physical release will come with a polaroid taken during the recording process (while supplies last). Some packages even include mystery merch items handmade by John and I! 

If you can't contribute financially: 

You can support in other ways! Sharing the campaign with your friends and family will make a big difference. This doesn't just mean sharing it on Facebook, word-of-mouth is the most impactful!

story:
Dear Mother...

Two years ago, a parcel was discovered in an old suitcase during a house clearance in Hartlepool. In it were letters home from Illingworth George Gower, a local lad who had fought in the Great War. Though deceptively simple and sometimes even mundane, they slowly revealed the powerful reality and the devastating effects of the war on both the young men who fought and the families they left behind. A year later, Hartlepool Borough Council acquired the war effects of the Jones brothers: Theo Jones is commemorated as the first soldier of the First World War to be killed on British soil, during the German bombardment of Hartlepool in 1914 - but it wasn't previously known that his mother also lost both of her younger sons to the war in France.

Your Affectionate Son was a new show commissioned for Hartlepool Folk Festival 2019, based on the stories of these young men. Featuring songs by Robb Johnson, spoken word by John Hegley, accompaniment by Durham Miners' Association Brass Band, contributions from Eliza Carthy, Jackie Oates, Luke Daniels, The Wilsons, Damien Barber and Jack Worth, and arrangements by Jonny Mohun, Your Affectionate Son was produced to commemorate the centenary of the Treaty of Versailles with music, song, dance, and the real voices of the men who fought in the War to End All Wars.

Following a hugely enthusiastic reception, and many requests during the festival and since, we have decided to produce an album of the show. It will feature the original cast, all of the songs and arrangements, and lots of accompanying material in a beautifully-produced CD package. It will also be available as a digital download.

 

What You Get

There are several levels of reward, from downloads and hard-copy CDs (plus lots of gratitude and love!) To special perks, including VIP packages at Hartlepool Folk Festival 2020. 

If we don't reach our target, we will put the funding towards the production of the album and recoup additional costs through post-production sales.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jabari Gibbons, I go by the artist name Roc Kartel and i am from PG county, Maryland. I created this campaign to raise funds for my Album that will be releasing on June 26th, 2020 and i'm asking for your help. My goal is to maximize my Album reach by implementing a strong marketing campaign, 2020 has been a historical year thus far and i would like to influence and inspire as many people as i can through my music. I make music that people can feel and it's super important to me that i step in and impact a life in a positive way with my music and dance. In addition to that i can also expand my fan base and eventually get the right partnership in place.

 

What I Need & What You Get

My Goal is to Raise $5,000, these funds will spread out accordingly to my Publicist, Marketing company, and filming of Music video on July 11th, 2020. 

For every person that donates $20 or more will have FREE entry to my next concert (TBA). For every person that donates $50 or more can book me for FREE to perform at any setting of your choice this includes private parties, house parties, weddings, venues etc.

If i don't reach my goal of $5,000 by the end of this campaign i will still use the funds that is raised towards my marketing campaign, but the more i raise the stronger my marketing campaign will be. 

The Impact

I have always been told that my music literally get's people going and inspired to achieve their highest potential. I have a die hard fan which is now a personal friend of mine who happens to be a LA fire fighter, he tells me all the time that my music gets him through the challenging moments in his day to day life particularly my song "Energy". My goal here is to make this same impact on millions of people especially with all the challenges we have dealt with in 2020.
