story:
Zenamon- A Chamber Music Collection 

      I was introduced to Jaime’s music early on when I first started studying classical guitar.  It wasn’t until I came to NYC in 2012 that I rediscovered his music by playing with cellist Mark Humburg.  I met Mark while I was studying at Mannes and he had music for Jaime’s piece for guitar and cello, Reflexoes no. 6.  In another instance, Matt Pidi, my guitar duo partner from my Master’s program at Mannes asked me about another a guitar duo piece of Jaime’s: Suite Andina.  He had heard it played brilliantly on a recording by Julian Gray and Ronald Pearl and thought we could also do good work with it.  When we finally started to incorporate that piece into our regular recital programs - it was easily one of the most well-received pieces in every performance since. 

    I first reached out to Jaime about his music because I lacked information that I wanted to give audiences about his inspiration behind the music. Receiving this information was extremely meaningful because music is all about communication.  I felt it strengthened my performances to a new level between me and my audience.

     There are a lot of factors that led me to work on this project.  For instance, I stopped learning new music after my time at Mannes and found myself focusing on technique, taking my time to learn music right.  This is because I feel that confidence and security in playing are always correlated with your confidence in practice and preparation. Previously, I just didn’t have that. Spending time away from my instrument, I set up new and healthier habits.  I also invested in a new instrument crafted by a science-driven luthier, Gary Lee whose knowledge and skill set for guitar-making is fueled by his passion for music.  Previously, I hadn’t even felt confident in my sound.

     Part of my story is New York City and coming here for music. I wanted to keep that as part of the album—the story of the album. I could not do it alone. I’m super grateful for meeting a host of musicians along the way.   And the outcome is really just that —it’s easy to feel singular as a musician in New York.  I wanted to share what’s something I’m proud of. I want this album to be an expressive representation of myself in spirit of collaboration. I want this to be remembered because I don’t think this have ever been done— the chamber music of Jaime Zenamon all on one album. I would be proud to represent his music.

    I resonate with this music. Jaime is able to tell a story with his music.  It’s different and it’s accessible. People who have a perception of what classical guitar is will be surprised by how wide ranging the pieces are. 

    Will you support me, Jaime Zenamon, and my NYC colleagues in creating a worthwhile piece of art? 

Album

3 Retratos (Guitar & Violin w/ Elizabeth Wright)

Suite Andina (Guitar Duo w/ Matthew Pidi)

Luz y Sombra Op. 121 (Guitar & Clarinet w/ Michael Conklin)

Berlin (T)Rio (Guitar Trio w/ Phil & Hannah Goldenberg)

Reflexões No. 3 (Guitar & Violin w/Elizabeth Wright)

Reflexões No. 6 (Guitar & Cello w/ Mark Humburg)

Reflexões No. 7 (Guitar Solo)

12 Fantasias (Guitar Duo w/ Pierre Ferreyra-Mansilla)

Contrastes (Guitar Quartet w/ New York City Guitar Orchestra Principals - Jason Sagebiel, Dr. Peter Argondizza, & Adam Hug)

Funds and Rewards!

In order to make this album come to life, I'm turning to your support to make it happen!  

Recording Time 27 Hours = $2,160

Musician Compensation = $1800

Indiegogo costs, shipping, and misc expenses (estimation) = $540

Album Artwork = $500

Mechanical License = $500 

Mixing and Mastering = $400

$100 = Digital Distribution

Total = $6,000

The Impact

    Contributing my campaign not only supports me and my career as musician in NYC, but also the careers of my fellow colleagues on record as well as the artistry of Jaime Zenamon.   Most classical artists embark on a solo CD for their first recording but I am passionate and confident in the value of this collaboration album of Jaime's music.  This is a new record and collection for the classical guitar world and people who have a preconceived notion as to what classical guitar is will be pleasantly surprised by how wide ranging and accessible the pieces are. 

Other Ways You Can Help

    Any contribution helps!  If you are unable to help at this time it would mean so much to me if you can "like" this campaign and notices I share about it on social media.  To take it one step further I would ask you to share it with anyone you know that supports the music and the arts!  This can be done via socials, e-mail, word of mouth, or anything of the like.  Indiegogo has many convenient tools for you to share at the top of the page.  

 

Thank you all so much for your time and support.  Let's do this!

         -Matt

story:
Hey everyone! Over a year after the release of our last single “Rodeo” and our main stage performance with Lifehouse at The QuickChek Ballooning Festival, we’ve decided that it's finally time to bring you some brand new music! For the past 7 months, we’ve been preparing a variety of anthemic, powerful, and infectiously catchy pop rock songs for our project’s second ever full length album. We’re finally ready to step into the studio and record what we’ve done, but first, we need your help to make it happen!

In order to create an album at the level of quality we feel these songs deserve, we’re pulling out all the stops: professional recording sessions, top of the line studio production / post production, amazing artwork, and packaging worthy of the material. This is going to be a professional release in every way possible, so you can be assured that this album will sound incredible.

To get to our goal of $10,000, we’ve created an Indie GoGo campaign which includes a variety of exclusive items. These include pre-release distributions, unique merch, autographed material, among others.

Your support over the years has proven to us that this project is worth pursuing, and that delivering the highest possible quality product is something that you, the fans, deserve.

That being said, thank you for being there for us: for buying our music, watching our videos, coming out to our shows, and just simply loving and supporting us on social media. We don’t take what you’ve given us for granted, because without you, this project would never exist at this level. We hope that you continue to put your trust in us, and in return, we will give you everything we have to provide you with the best album we’ve ever written.

story:
Summary

We're trying to raise funds to complete the new MoreThanMe EP and release it to the #MTMfamily!! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $10K to complete production, mixing, mastering and some form of physical replication. We also hope to have funding to contribute to the promotion of the release.

We're going to offer an exclusive electronic copy (before the release date), Signed copies of whatever physical product we have, private acoustic performances, as well as bonus content from the making of the EP

The Impact

The revisioning of this group is special to us and we hope to you as well! We hadn't played in a couple of years and the first time we got together, we immediately started writing new songs which told us our band still had life and wasn't just a nostalgic act. The new songs stem from the root of our high energy Live Show. Always fun, will make you smile and of corse..sing along! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know crowdfunding can be overwhelming and a bit intrusive and we apologize for that but we really hope you guys will get behind this and help us make more music and memories together as a family. Understandably, not everyone is financially able to get involved but a simple share on your social platforms could help us immensely.

story:
WHAT IN-THE-GOOD-FRICK IS A GARDEN PARTY?

GARDEN PARTY is a Southern-Ontarian, Canadiana, Alt-Folk Rock group. A group that grew out of friendships, house shows, community, bon fires, long commutes, and collaboration. OH, and of course, gardening. The group is made up of an ever-rotating diverse roster of collaborators and contributors, with a small core group, who you will meet later!

This campaign will essentially allow us to simultaneously both expand our network right to you, AND bring the music back to where it came from: sharing with, and fostering, compassionate community. Album 1, ‘CAROLINIANA’ is DONE, help us finish and fund the next 2!

Each album will be released independently as a limited edition 'field lyric guide' mini booklet. Within which you will find collaborative artwork, a download card printed on plant-able wildflower seed paper, and that album's lyrics. Each release and book will also have an accompanying very limited-edition collector's enamel pin*. All of the above is an exciting journey to what will eventually be a for-charity vinyl collection of all of the past releases.

*So, you eventually collect all 3 pins – A SURPRISE FUN FUTURE DISCOUNT, WOW!

ALBUM 1, RELEASE – MAY 18TH 2019

ALBUM 2 PROJECTED RELEASE – MAY 16TH 2020

ALBUM 3 PROJECTED RELEASE – MAY 15TH 2021

 

PRIZES

ALBUM ‘FIELD LYRIC GUIDE’ BOOKLET WITH DOWNLOAD (PREORDER) – $20

ALBUM BOOKLET PREORDER AND PIN (LIMITED QUANTITIES) – $32

ALBUM BOOKLET PREORDER, PIN, AND SHIRT – $50

ALL MERCH PLUS SIT IN ON STUDIO SESSION OF YOUR CHOOSING – $100

ALL MERCH PLUS A PERSONALIZED SONG (DEMO RECORDED AND SENT) – $200

ALL MERCH PLUS 3 HOURS ACTUAL GARDEN/YARD LABOUR (LOCAL ONLY?) – $300

ALL MERCH AND A FRICKING SOLO HOUSE SHOW – $600

ALL MERCH AND A FRICKING BAND HOUSE SHOW – $1200

THE BIG ONE – MERCH, BAND COOKS DINNER, BAND PLAYS SHOW – $1500

*full band attendance subject to availability, but you’ll always get a bunch of us*

 

FUNDING

But where will your generous support actually go you ask? (See below for full list and links of contributors).

  • $3000 will go directly to Bradley McClure at Home Studios as an advance on our next two albums.
  • $1000 will contribute to paying those collaborating musicians as much as possible to ensure support to their hard-earned living wage.
  • $500 will go towards the next 2 rounds of ‘field lyric guide’ booklet manufacturing, so we can get the music right back to you.
  • The remaining $500 will contribute to supplying merch, booking opportunities, and travel!

*If our goal is not reached, the funds will still be divided in these ratios and allocated accordingly*

 

Your contributions literally mean the world to us. Thanks will never be enough. At a time when the Arts are so unrightfully and so invariably on the chopping block for so many countries, provinces, states, cites, and school boards, contributing to any campaign and dream like this means you are declaring Art a right as well as viable trade. Creation, in some way or another, has saved everyone involved in this project from something. Even if you don’t contribute, we thank you infinitely for your eyes and ears, and hope we, and this campaign, can act as at least some small match in your fighting for the rights and opportunities in your community we all require and deserve.

LOVE LOVE LOVE,

The garden party team.

 

So please, don’t forget to share, share, share. Both this campaign, and everything you’ve got.

 

THE TEAM

Home Studios (JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING, FRICK) – https://www.homestudios.ca/

Bradley McClure (Wizard of JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING) – https://forkeepsband.bandcamp.com/

Julie Neff (Vocals and Music) – http://julieneff.ca/

Rose Brokenshire (Vocals and Music) – https://rosebrokenshire.bandcamp.com/

Tom Schiks (Banjo, Vocals, Guitar, Music)

Patrick Hoorigan – https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AGLAYsQP8NQ

Evan McCosham (Bass) – https://www.instagram.com/emccosham/?hl=en

Cam McDonald (Drums) – https://forkeepsband.bandcamp.com/

David Poulin (Fiddle) 

Andrea Manica (Branding and Design) – http://www.andreamanica.com/

J Stead (Stylist, “Manage”, General Best Friend) – https://newfrdm.com/

Nadja Pausch (Production)

Emily O’Quinn (Production) – http://www.eclecticcomfort.com/

Justin Yaroski (Photography) –http://www.eclecticcomfort.com/

Adam Silcox (Branding, Editing, Videography) – http://www.eclecticcomfort.com/

Books – https://www.foldfactory.com/

Shirts – http://www.alpineprintcompany.com/

Pins – http://www.presstimedesign.com/

Distributions and Downloads – http://indiepool.com/

Seed Paper – https://www.botanicalpaperworks.com/catalog/see...

Special thanks to Collective Arts Brewing, Sparrow Tree Productions, and our families.
story_txt:
WHAT IN-THE-GOOD-FRICK IS A GARDEN PARTY?GARDEN PARTY is a Southern-Ontarian, Canadiana, Alt-Folk Rock group. A group that grew out of friendships, house shows, community, bon fires, long commutes, and collaboration. OH, and of course, gardening. The group is made up of an ever-rotating diverse roster of collaborators and contributors, with a small core group, who you will meet later!This campaign will essentially allow us to simultaneously both expand our network right to you, AND bring the music back to where it came from: sharing with, and fostering, compassionate community. Album 1, ‘CAROLINIANA’ is DONE, help us finish and fund the next 2!Each album will be released independently as a limited edition 'field lyric guide' mini booklet. Within which you will find collaborative artwork, a download card printed on plant-able wildflower seed paper, and that album's lyrics. Each release and book will also have an accompanying very limited-edition collector's enamel pin*. All of the above is an exciting journey to what will eventually be a for-charity vinyl collection of all of the past releases.*So, you eventually collect all 3 pins – A SURPRISE FUN FUTURE DISCOUNT, WOW!ALBUM 1, RELEASE – MAY 18TH 2019ALBUM 2 PROJECTED RELEASE – MAY 16TH 2020ALBUM 3 PROJECTED RELEASE – MAY 15TH 2021 PRIZESALBUM ‘FIELD LYRIC GUIDE’ BOOKLET WITH DOWNLOAD (PREORDER) – $20ALBUM BOOKLET PREORDER AND PIN (LIMITED QUANTITIES) – $32ALBUM BOOKLET PREORDER, PIN, AND SHIRT – $50ALL MERCH PLUS SIT IN ON STUDIO SESSION OF YOUR CHOOSING – $100ALL MERCH PLUS A PERSONALIZED SONG (DEMO RECORDED AND SENT) – $200ALL MERCH PLUS 3 HOURS ACTUAL GARDEN/YARD LABOUR (LOCAL ONLY?) – $300ALL MERCH AND A FRICKING SOLO HOUSE SHOW – $600ALL MERCH AND A FRICKING BAND HOUSE SHOW – $1200THE BIG ONE – MERCH, BAND COOKS DINNER, BAND PLAYS SHOW – $1500*full band attendance subject to availability, but you’ll always get a bunch of us* FUNDINGBut where will your generous support actually go you ask? story:
Aisle Five Records and the artists within our collective are going to disrupt the system by showcasing edgy music that questions the status quo. We will guide bands to reach new heights by creating a unique outlet for them to voice their experiences, all in an inclusive, safe space.

We’re currently working on recording and launching a seven track compilation album of new music, all recorded and mixed by our team. Four songs are recorded in a traditional recording studio, and three songs are recorded with our DIY, comprehensive recording kit called the BasKit, in a non-studio setting. The purpose of variation in these recordings, both in recording techniques and locations, is to showcase what is possible with simple equipment in every-day spaces (i.e. barns, churches, and regular ol' rooms). We hope to demonstrate to artists with minimal experience in recording that you are able to create an amazing sound with what you are given. Upon completion of this album we will be hosting an extravagant album release show featuring the artists on the album, with drinks, art, and merchandise. It will be a night to remember. 

This is just the beginning of our company. Our hope is that this album will get our name out there as a reputable collective for artists to come to when they need assistance breaking through the industry. We have big plans as to how we will proceed, and if we're successful with this, Aisle V will be at the top of the charts and the music scene in Toronto will see great improvements. 

 

We are looking to raise $4000 in order to kick off our collective and produce a full-length album. We’ll also be hosting a release show once the album is complete, and you’ll be invited to see our artists play the music they’ve been working on with us over the past few months! 

Here is a rundown of where the $4000 will be going towards directly:

  • Production of physical copies of the album: cassettes with cool covers that’ll get you dreaming of the 90s. Get out your tape decks!
  • Marketing materials: we are in the process of creating merchandise, including stickers, posters, tote bags and more! 
  • Locations: For the Baskit, we've been scouting some interesting spaces to record in, and a few of them require payment!
  • Paying the incredible session musicians we've hired to play on the album. 
  • Equipment: to get the best sound possible!
  • Album release event: venue, transportation, merch for our bands, and much more to provide you with a great show!
  • Food: our artists need to be fed and stay hydrated during long recording sessions!

So what do you get out of supporting us? A lot of the things mentioned above! We are offering perks to those who donate certain amounts. These include stickers, tote bags, posters, cassettes tapes with all the songs, personalized mix tapes, a ticket to the release show and a few more!

 

We are going to create a new community that artists trust, with an atmosphere that legitimizes the DIY music scene in Toronto. With your help, we will be able to fulfil our vision for this collective. By supporting Aisle V, you are also helping seven different bands/artists make their mark in the Toronto music industry. You are supporting a group of audio engineers, visual artists and creatives that make up the team behind Aisle V and allowing them to watch a project they’ve been working on for months become a reality. 

 

Any contribution to our fund will help us in the process of recording an album. You will also be allowing a group of artists to create music that is meaningful to them, forming a new community in the Toronto music scene. If you’re  not in a position to donate, we completely understand and ask that you simply follow our social media pages to keep up with what we’re up to! Any sharing of this page will also help tremendously.

 

Thank you for your interest and support in this project, whether you are able to donate or not. See you at the launch show!

story:
MY STORY (Abridged version!)

I'm a jazz singer in Los Angeles – something I couldn't say a few years ago! Music was the "path not taken" until I reached my mid-thirties, when I discovered that one can only evade one's calling for so long before the "itch" of that unfulfilled passion grows too intense to ignore! Scratching that unrelenting itch, I made the leap from a well-established career in corporate marketing to a brand new career in music in 2016. I moved to L.A. I began performing regularly; taking workshops; resuming the study of music that I'd abandoned at 18; and gradually, growing my network of fans, fellow musicians, and industry folk. And, I established a brand for the music that best encapsulates my musical taste, performance style, and personality: “Firecracker Jazz”.

I'm excited about the progress I've made in just two and a half years, and even more excited about the milestones yet to come. Right now, I'm heading towards a particularly huge milestone: recording my first album! I'm incredibly lucky to have some of the industry's best talent involved in the making of this record, including Jane Monheit (a jazz icon) as a Producer and some of L.A.'s most in-demand jazz musicians recording with me.
 

MY VISION FOR “FIRECRACKER JAZZ – THE EP”

Making an album is an enormous – and costly – undertaking. However, being ever the business-minded professional from my earlier life, I would not be continuing to “leap” in the direction of this unpredictable artistic career if I didn’t have a deep belief that my musical gifts can add value, move people, and ultimately, be a contribution to the art form. This belief has been affirmed by the reception and support I’ve seen thus far, and I’m fully fired-up to continue creating the best work I can with this record.

My debut album will be an EP (which, for those who are wondering, stands for “extended play”: longer than an LP, shorter than a full-length record), containing five or six tracks. (The sixth may be reserved as a “bonus track” for later release.) It will combine the stylistic elements that have come to define me as a singer,  The songs will cross genre lines a bit: fundamentally jazz, but blended with flavors of Pop, Funk, Soul, and Blues. There will be no original compositions on this album, but there will be some unique interpretations of both beloved jazz standards and lesser-known musical gems.
 

WHAT I’M ASKING

Your support is essential in making this vision a reality! In contributing to this campaign, you’ll – first and foremost – be helping to create a fantastic piece of art. (And let’s face it: art wouldn’t really exist without support like this… And what is a world without art??) You will also have my eternal gratitude. But, in an effort to offer as much value and reward for your contribution as possible, I’ve put together packages of perks and exclusives for different levels of pledges. Among these perks are services that I will personally render, using the skills that were heavily developed in my first career as a marketing professional – namely, graphic design. I hope these perks will help express my desire to give back and my deep gratitude for every one of you that helps me make this record happen!

If you’re excited by the vision and want to be part of its realization, I invite you to:

  • Pick your reward
  • Contribute
  • Help spread the word!

Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for supporting me in my journey and helping me manifest the music that I want, more than anything, to make.

With love and gratitude,

Mandy

story:
The Project

BETA Quartet is celebrating the exciting news that we have been invited to perform at the 2020 International Low Flutes festival in Japan! We have also organized an educational and community outreach tour in the Tokyo-area.

We will be partnering with flutists Ryota Fukae and Izak Kertznus for this cross-cultural collaboration. Our program, "Around the World in 30 minutes," will feature new works and world premieres for flute sextet. The works are composed by international living composers hailing from Greece, South Korea, Colombia, Japan, the Netherlands, and the United States. Two of the works have been commissioned by and will be dedicated to BETA.  

This project is valuable because it brings performers and composers of different cultural and musical backgrounds together to promote new music inspired by various parts of our world. It also helps support our vision of educating others through music. You are helping enrich the body of repertoire written for flute sextet while allowing us to reach a larger audience with our music through an educational and community outreach tour.

How do we make this happen?

Every dollar counts! To bring this project to fruition we need your help to cover airfare tickets, lodging, transportation, and per diem expenses for six performers.

We are looking for a total of $10,000: 

  • Airfare tickets: $5,000

​Each round-trip airfare ticket from the United States to Tokyo costs approximately $1,000.  Five of the performers are flying out from the US and will meet the sixth performer in Tokyo. 

  • Lodging: $2,500

This is the total cost for AirBnB lodging from March 17 to March 25, 2020 for six performers. Rehearsals and preparation will take place in this space. 

Location: Edogawa City, Tokyo

  • Transportation: $480

$72

Three members of the ensemble will be purchasing a Suica card to have access to public transportation while in Japan. The other three members already own this card.

To learn more about the Suica card: https://www.japan-rail-pass.com/services/suica-...

$86

Round-trip airport transfer from Narita International Airport to AirBnb

$22

Ryota Fukae’s Round-trip Airport Transfer

$50 x 6 people = $300

The Suica card will need to be loaded with money (similar to the New York MetroCard) in order to be valid. Additional expected expenses during our 10-day trip are $50 per person.

Our daily transportation will also include traveling from the AirBnB to the Urayasu Concert Hall and other performance venues included in our tour (TBD).   

  • Festival Registration Fees: $636

Each member of the ensemble has to pay the registration fee of $106 in order to perform at the festival.

  • Ryota Fukae: $300

This amount will be used towards covering Ryota Fukae's airfare ticket expenses from Akashi, Hyogo to Tokyo.

  • Per Diem: $1,100

​​This amount will be used solely on everyday food expenses for the duration of our travels in Japan. Each individual will receive the total amount of $220 for a 10-day trip in Japan ($22/per day).

 

What Do You Receive For Your Support?

You will find a descriptive list of all perks offered to our backers and here is quick overview:  

  • Your name on our website and social media platforms
  • Unique souvenirs from Japan
  • CD's shipped to your house
  • Flute ensemble arrangements 
  • In-home concert in select states (see perks for details!)

 

What Happens If the Funds are Not Raised?

We are so excited for the opportunity to work with artists from around the world and promote new music!  If we could fund this project ourselves, we would. However, with many of us just starting our careers, we are unable to do so.  Let's keep it real, we are musicians after all.

If we do not manage to raise the necessary funds then we will not be able to complete the project, and you will have the choice to either get your money back OR allow us to use your donation.

 

Learn More About Us

Described as "chamber music at its finest" by Kenneth Tse and "unique and virtuosic" by Barbara Siesel, BETA Quartet is an award-winning ensemble comprised of flutists Eftihia Arkoudis, Tatiana Cassetta, Alyssa Schwartz, and Meg Brennan. 

BETA is dedicated to exploring and promoting the cutting edge of modern flute music by premiering and performing works by living composers from around the world. The ensemble is actively engaged through concerts, masterclasses, and educational outreach across the country and abroad.

As strong competitors, the group has won First Prize at the West Virginia Music Teachers National Association Chamber Music Competition, First Prize at the Flute Society of Kentucky Quartet Competition, and advanced to the semi-finals of the prestigious Fischoff National Chamber Music Competition. They have performed and presented workshops at the National Flute Association Convention, Florida Flute Association Convention, the Mid-Atlantic Flute Convention, the Flute Society of Greater Philadelphia, and the International Flute Symposium.

BETA’s activities have been partially funded by grants from The Friends of Flutes Foundation and West Virginia University, and their recognition within the flute community resulted in sponsorship by Flute Specialists, Inc. (Clawson, MI).  The album is available through Spotify, iTunes, YouTube and www.betaquartet.com. 

BETA released their debut album with ℗2017 Merandi Records, which can be found through Spotify, iTunes, and YouTube. As of 2019, the group is a Trevor James Low Flutes Ensemble.

www.betaquartet.com

 

"BETA Quartet is redefining the medium in a way for which the flute world has been thirsty for a long time."

- Valerie Coleman, flutist & composer, University of Miami

 

For BETA members official websites, visit: 

Meg Brennan, Eftihia Arkoudis, Tatiana Cassetta, Alyssa Schwartz

 

IZAK KERTZNUS

Izak Kertznus is pursuing a double major in both Japanese Studies and Music Performance from Florida International University. Recent performances include substitute principal flute with the Orquesta Antonio Soler, a collaborative recital with Eftihia Arkoudis during the 2019 Mid-Atlantic Flute Association, and performing in masterclasses for William Bennett, Jasmine Choi and Marina Piccinini, among others. Kertznus was accepted to perform at the Kirishima International Music Festival and studied at Ritsumeikan University in Kyoto, Japan. 

RYOTA FUKAE

大阪音楽大学卒業。学内オーディションによる演奏会に2度、作曲学科新作展での初演多数、卒業演奏会、姫路市新人演奏会に出演。ウィーン・プライナー音楽院を首席で卒業。第8回高校生管打楽器ソロコンテスト関西大会第一位、全国大会優秀賞。Fluteを 赤穂由美子、待永望、竹林秀憲、Reza Najfarの各氏に師事。留学中、ウィーン国立音学大学のPro-arte Orchestra,バロック室内楽アンサ ンブルMusica Vitrioliなどで3年間活躍。『路面電車で行く 世界各街停車の旅 音楽の街ウィーン』の案内役でテレビ出演。2016年、姫路市吹奏楽団とフルート協奏曲を共演。Top Dog Recordsより自身のアルバムCD『Digital Dive』をリリース。2019年姫路地方文化団体連合協議会より黒川録郎賞を受賞。関西を 中心に室内楽、オーケストラで活動する傍、音楽教室・プライベートレッスンで後進の指導も行なっている。

FUKAE's BIO (translated)

Ryota Fukae graduated from the Osaka College of Music, where his performances include many premieres at the new composition exhibition and the Himeji newcomer concert. He also graduated from the Prayner Conservatory (Vienna, Austria) at the top of his class. Ryota received first place in the 8th Kansai Solo High School contest and received the  national tournament excellence award. Flute instructors include Yumiko Ako, Nozomu Naganaga, Hidenori Takebayashi and Reza Najfar. While studying abroad, he had been active for three years at the Pro-arte Orchestra (Vienna State University of Music) and Musica Vitrioli, a baroque chamber ensemble. He appeared on TV as a guide for a program entitled  “Trips Around the World: Vienna City Music". In 2016, he performed as a soloist with the Himeji City Orchestra. Additionally, he released his own album "Digital Dive" from Top Dog Records. In 2019, he received the Kurokawa Shiro Award from the Himeji Regional Cultural  Association. In addition to being an active member in chamber music and orchestral engagements mainly in the Kansai region, he teaches music classes and private lessons. 

For Ryota Fukae's official website, visit: https://pukae0211.wixsite.com/fukae-flute

 

Other ways you can show us love: 

If you are interested in our mission as a chamber music ensemble, here are some ways you can show us some love:

  • Like our page on Facebook or follow us on Instagram
  • Sign up for our newsletter (website)
  • Purchase our self-titled debut album (website)
  • Book us for performances, workshops and mastersclasses (betaquartet@gmail.com)
  • Tell your friends and family about us
  • Share this campaign with others who may be interested
  • Email us with any questions you have regarding the campaign. Your consideration for donation matters to us and we are happy to clarify further.
story_txt:
The Project
BETA Quartet is celebrating the exciting news that we have been invited to perform at the 2020 International Low Flutes festival in Japan! We have also organized an educational and community outreach tour in the Tokyo-area.
We will be partnering with flutists Ryota Fukae and Izak Kertznus for this cross-cultural collaboration. Our program, "Around the World in 30 minutes," will feature new works and world premieres for flute sextet. The works are composed by international living composers hailing from Greece, South Korea, Colombia, Japan, the Netherlands, and the United States. Two of the works have been commissioned by and will be dedicated to BETA.  
This project is valuable because it brings performers and composers of different cultural and musical backgrounds together to promote new music inspired by various parts of our world. It also helps support our vision of educating others through music. You are helping enrich the body of repertoire written for flute sextet while allowing us to reach a larger audience with our music through an educational and community outreach tour.


How do we make this happen?
Every dollar counts! To bring this project to fruition we need your help to cover airfare tickets, lodging, transportation, and per diem expenses for six performers.
We are looking for a total of $10,000: 
Airfare tickets: $5,000

​Each round-trip airfare ticket from the United States to Tokyo costs approximately $1,000.  Five of the performers are flying out from the US and will meet the sixth performer in Tokyo. 
Lodging: $2,500

This is the total cost for AirBnB lodging from March 17 to March 25, 2020 for six performers. Rehearsals and preparation will take place in this space. 
Location: Edogawa City, Tokyo
Transportation: $480

$72
Three members of the ensemble will be purchasing a Suica card to have access to public transportation while in Japan. The other three members already own this card.
To learn more about the Suica card: https://www.japan-rail-pass.com/services/suica-...
$86
Round-trip airport transfer from Narita International Airport to AirBnb
$22
Ryota Fukae’s Round-trip Airport Transfer
$50 x 6 people = $300
The Suica card will need to be loaded with money (similar to the New York MetroCard) in order to be valid. Additional expected expenses during our 10-day trip are $50 per person.
Our daily transportation will also include traveling from the AirBnB to the Urayasu Concert Hall and other performance venues included in our tour (TBD).   
Festival Registration Fees: $636

Each member of the ensemble has to pay the registration fee of $106 in order to perform at the festival.
Ryota Fukae: $300

This amount will be used towards covering Ryota Fukae's airfare ticket expenses from Akashi, Hyogo to Tokyo.
Per Diem: $1,100

​​This amount will be used solely on everyday food expenses for the duration of our travels in Japan. Each individual will receive the total amount of $220 for a 10-day trip in Japan ($22/per day).
 
What Do You Receive For Your Support?
You will find a descriptive list of all perks offered to our backers and here is quick overview:  

Your name on our website and social media platforms
Unique souvenirs from Japan
CD's shipped to your house
Flute ensemble arrangements 
In-home concert in select states (see perks for details!)

 
What Happens If the Funds are Not Raised?
We are so excited for the opportunity to work with artists from around the world and promote new music!  If we could fund this project ourselves, we would. However, with many of us just starting our careers, we are unable to do so.  Let's keep it real, we are musicians after all.
If we do not manage to raise the necessary funds then we will not be able to complete the project, and you will have the choice to either get your money back OR allow us to use your donation.
 
Learn More About Us

Described as "chamber music at its finest" by Kenneth Tse and "unique and virtuosic" by Barbara Siesel, BETA Quartet is an award-winning ensemble comprised of flutists Eftihia Arkoudis, Tatiana Cassetta, Alyssa Schwartz, and Meg Brennan. 
BETA is dedicated to exploring and promoting the cutting edge of modern flute music by premiering and performing works by living composers from around the world. The ensemble is actively engaged through concerts, masterclasses, and educational outreach across the country and abroad.
As strong competitors, the group has won First Prize at the West Virginia Music Teachers National Association Chamber Music Competition, First Prize at the Flute Society of Kentucky Quartet Competition, and advanced to the semi-finals of the prestigious Fischoff National Chamber Music Competition. They have performed and presented workshops at the National Flute Association Convention, Florida Flute Association Convention, the Mid-Atlantic Flute Convention, the Flute Society of Greater Philadelphia, and the International Flute Symposium.
BETA’s activities have been partially funded by grants from The Friends of Flutes Foundation and West Virginia University, and their recognition within the flute community resulted in sponsorship by Flute Specialists, Inc. (Clawson, MI).  The album is available through Spotify, iTunes, YouTube and www.betaquartet.com. 
BETA released their debut album with ℗2017 Merandi Records, which can be found through Spotify, iTunes, and YouTube. As of 2019, the group is a Trevor James Low Flutes Ensemble.
www.betaquartet.com
 
"BETA Quartet is redefining the medium in a way for which the flute world has been thirsty for a long time."
- Valerie Coleman, flutist & composer, University of Miami

 
For BETA members official websites, visit: 
Meg Brennan, Eftihia Arkoudis, Tatiana Cassetta, Alyssa Schwartz
 
IZAK KERTZNUS
Izak Kertznus is pursuing a double major in both Japanese Studies and Music Performance from Florida International University. Recent performances include substitute principal flute with the Orquesta Antonio Soler, a collaborative recital with Eftihia Arkoudis during the 2019 Mid-Atlantic Flute Association, and performing in masterclasses for William Bennett, Jasmine Choi and Marina Piccinini, among others. Kertznus was accepted to perform at the Kirishima International Music Festival and studied at Ritsumeikan University in Kyoto, Japan. 

RYOTA FUKAE
大阪音楽大学卒業。学内オーディションによる演奏会に2度、作曲学科新作展での初演多数、卒業演奏会、姫路市新人演奏会に出演。ウィーン・プライナー音楽院を首席で卒業。第8回高校生管打楽器ソロコンテスト関西大会第一位、全国大会優秀賞。Fluteを 赤穂由美子、待永望、竹林秀憲、Reza Najfarの各氏に師事。留学中、ウィーン国立音学大学のPro-arte Orchestra,バロック室内楽アンサ ンブルMusica Vitrioliなどで3年間活躍。『路面電車で行く 世界各街停車の旅 音楽の街ウィーン』の案内役でテレビ出演。2016年、姫路市吹奏楽団とフルート協奏曲を共演。Top Dog Recordsより自身のアルバムCD『Digital Dive』をリリース。2019年姫路地方文化団体連合協議会より黒川録郎賞を受賞。関西を 中心に室内楽、オーケストラで活動する傍、音楽教室・プライベートレッスンで後進の指導も行なっている。
FUKAE's BIO (translated)
Ryota Fukae graduated from the Osaka College of Music, where his performances include many premieres at the new composition exhibition and the Himeji newcomer concert. He also graduated from the Prayner Conservatory (Vienna, Austria) at the top of his class. Ryota received first place in the 8th Kansai Solo High School contest and received the  national tournament excellence award. Flute instructors include Yumiko Ako, Nozomu Naganaga, Hidenori Takebayashi and Reza Najfar. While studying abroad, he had been active for three years at the Pro-arte Orchestra (Vienna State University of Music) and Musica Vitrioli, a baroque chamber ensemble. He appeared on TV as a guide for a program entitled  “Trips Around the World: Vienna City Music". In 2016, he performed as a soloist with the Himeji City Orchestra. Additionally, he released his own album "Digital Dive" from Top Dog Records. In 2019, he received the Kurokawa Shiro Award from the Himeji Regional Cultural  Association. In addition to being an active member in chamber music and orchestral engagements mainly in the Kansai region, he teaches music classes and private lessons. 
For Ryota Fukae's official website, visit: https://pukae0211.wixsite.com/fukae-flute


 
Other ways you can show us love: 
If you are interested in our mission as a chamber music ensemble, here are some ways you can show us some love:

Like our page on Facebook or follow us on Instagram
Sign up for our newsletter (website)
Purchase our self-titled debut album (website)
Book us for performances, workshops and mastersclasses (betaquartet@gmail.com)
Tell your friends and family about us
Share this campaign with others who may be interested
Email us with any questions you have regarding the campaign. Your consideration for donation matters to us and we are happy to clarify further.

story:
About OrchestraOne  (www.orchestraonenyc.org)

OrchestraOne is a professional orchestra and musical institution dedicated to shifting the classical music paradigm, and fostering the appreciation of music through inclusive and holistic symphonic performance and community engagement.

OrchestraOne will do more. We are founded on the idea that the experience of music in all of it’s forms is essentially a study of the human condition, and through that study, music can bring a new understanding of ourselves, those around us, and the world at large. Our goal is to foster this understanding in our audiences and participants in order to bring about a new era of understanding in order to bring the world closer together.

 

Founded on education and involvement

Where many orchestras have commendable community programs and initiatives, OrchestraOne is founded on it. Every event we hold, including our concert experiences, is developed and curated with our communities at it’s heart. We are dedicated to continually exploring the world around us in an effort to bring the power of music to as many people as possible in a meaningful, positive way.

Listening to our communities

Our philosophy on community involvement is that in order to develop meaningful relations and effect lasting change, we must ask the right questions and listen to our communities. We partner with community leaders in order to identify organizations who would benefit from partnering with OrchestraOne and curate unique programs that fit their wants and needs.

A new concert experience

We are dedicated to making all of our concerts and events remarkable. We perform in unique and interesting venues throughout New York City, and are dedicated to creating a holistic, exciting, welcoming and inclusive environment.

We shift the traditional performance paradigm by tearing down any and all barriers between the orchestra and audience, and encourage freedom of movement and interaction with the music. Our conductor and artists will lead interactive talks, lectures, improvisations and much more before, during and after the concert.

Our concerts are first and foremost collective community experiences aimed at bringing the audience and the orchestra together We give our audiences the tools they need to extract the meaning in every work we perform.

Inclusive and accessible

In our effort to make world class performances and well-curated educational programs available to as many people as possible, we are wholly dedicated to making sure that all of our events are inclusive, accessible and welcoming to every member of our community.  

 

Where your donation goes

Your donation to OrchestraOne helps us form stronger bonds with our communities, develop lasting partnerships with local organizations, curate inspiring programs for our audiences and create unique concert experiences. Make a donation today to help us bring the world closer together.

Communities

OrchestraOne is founded on the principal that we are here to serve the public. We are committed to listening to our diverse communities and making every effort to meet their unique wants, needs, and expectations. OrchestraOne develops specialized programs based on the input we receive from our communities.

Forming partnerships

Forming meaningful and lasting partnerships with local organizations is integral is strengthening our ties with our community and maximizing OrchestraOne’s potential impact.

Program development

The OrchestraOne team, comprised of educators, performers, composers community members and administrators is committed to creating and continually developing unique programs aimed at exploring the true power of music.

Creating our concert experience

OrchestraOne views it’s concerts as complete experiences. We buck the traditional norms of symphonic performance and create brand new and unique events that not only aim to inspire our audiences, but to create a sense of community for all involved. All of our events are accessible, welcoming and inclusive of all peoples.

-Fifty dollars gets us space for three hours in a public library to present inspiring comments events.

-One hundred dollars pays for one hour of a workshop with some of the best musicians, clinicians and educations that NYC has to offer. 

-Two hundred and fifty dollars pays for developing one partnership with a local organization.

-Five hundred dollars is enough to pay one musician for our concert experiences

-seven hundred fifty dollars is enough to pay a principal player for one concert

-one thousand dollars is enough to curate a whole seasons worth of events with one partner.

-two thousand dollars is enough to rent a unique space for a chamber music concert. 

-five thousand dollars is enough to pay for a chamber concert, or rent the soace for a large orchestra concert. 

 

For more information about OrchestraOne, including our team members and upcoming events, please visit OrchestraOnenyc.org. 

Any questions can be sent to info@orchestraonenyc.org and we will get back to you with an answer as soon as possible!

 

OrchestraOne is a non-profit organization under section 501(c)3 of the Internal Revenue Code and section 402 of the Not-for-Profit corporation law of New York State. All donations are tax deductible under IRC section 170

story:
Short Summary

Here we are again. Over 3 years after the release of 'Stitched in Fiction' we have written, practiced again and again, and recorded another 2 whole CD's worth of material and we are dying to get it to you! This project has seen a long road. We started recording in March 2017 and we feel the end result represents a major achievement of what we as a band have achieved so far in our 6+ years playing music. It is certainly the culmination of many challenges, and we are confident in saying it is our most polished and high quality work.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, we hit some hurdles in funding toward the end of this project, and need some help. We are hoping to raise $5000 because a project like this has a lot of expense. What specifically? Well, in part the many studio recording hours at Lane Gibson Studios in Charlotte, epic artwork contribution from local airbrush master Ron Hernandez, mixing and mastering time, graphic design, and physical production of the CD's. All of this really adds up for musicians who (sadly) don't (yet!) make a livelihood doing what they love.

We are super grateful for anything you can give, and will make it worth your while. Even if you can't give, please share this page on social media or with your friends, every little bit helps! Even if we don't reach our entire goal, we are hoping to stretch our personal piggy-banks to get the album into your hands on October 27th.

story:
Casco Bay Wind Symphony (CBWS) is a non-profit, non-auditioned adult community band with a mission to perform high quality wind band literature, commission new works and to support wind band education throughout our community.

Our campaign targets raising funds for being a part of a consortium that commissioned a composition by John Mackey that honors those who have been affected by dementia and Alzheimer’s. It will be performed as part of our 40th Anniversary concert for which we have invited the University of Southern Maine’s School of Music Concert Band to participate. This performance will be the New England premiere of this major new work for wind band.

Donors will be helping CBWS perform a historical concert at Merrill Auditorium in Portland Maine that will support our vision of supporting wind band education as well as develop awareness of our local dementia and Alzheimer’s community organizations.

In this campaign, CBWS is looking to raise $5,000 to cover the costs associated with the commissioning and performance of John Mackey’s newest work inspired by his mother’s sudden onset of dementia. This includes paying the consortium cost, bringing John Mackey to Maine as an Artist in Residence for CBWS and area schools, and creating a community event that will include educational collaboration with local dementia & Alzheimer’s organizations on the evening of the performance.

We have created several perks which include VIP access to our dress rehearsal with John Mackey, VIP access to post concert reception, being a guest conductor at a future CBWS concert, and many more!

If the goal is not fully met, funds will be prioritized to the commissioning of the work first.

CBWS is reaching beyond our traditional performances in a high school auditorium to a major concert hall with special guests and a Maine premiere of a major new work for concert band. We are also reaching beyond the scope of our musical endeavors to become part of the larger community through the inclusion of local organizations that support families and individuals living with dementia-related illness.

CBWS has hosted local band festivals in the past with much success, and has proven itself to be a viable, popular community ensemble with a dedicated following for forty years. Now with this larger event, CBWS is working to overcome the financial hurdles through grant writing, fundraising campaigns and collaboration with local organizations. Our ensemble is very large, so members and friends/family are exploring contacts, promoting the event, utilizing grant-writing expertise, employing marketing skills used in our non-music careers, and networking with musicians and music educators throughout the area.

We are approaching the challenges of this performance event and dementia outreach by striving for excellence in the concert, directly targeting local educational organizations (through the inclusion of the University of Southern Maine music program and local high schools), and using the experience, skills, and contacts of the Merrill Auditorium and its ticket sellers to a much larger market area. CBWS members are also volunteering their time and talents in the writing of grants, selling program advertising to local organizations, and soliciting support from area businesses and agencies.

If you aren’t able to donate at this time, please share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tools, like our Facebook page, mark the concert date on your calendar, and come hear an amazing work of music!

story:
Short Summary

WHO WE ARE:

The company, Fifth Wall Performing Arts is confronting: calling into question the institutions of performative art-making by dismantling the suspension of disbelief and by creating work that is personal, intimate, and unabashed. As an interdisciplinary performance collective, Fifth Wall produces works of opera, theatre, and music that call into question the nature of what it means to perform both “in character” and as oneself, and by what means—  what vessel, what landscape— stories, histories, and mythologies are shared. 

WHAT THIS IS:

Our inaugural production, Michigan Trees: A Guide to the Trees of Michigan and the Great Lakes Region, is a new opera for folk and classical singers that follows the journey of Orna, a trans-woman, as she grapples with self-acceptance. She travels to the north of Michigan, guided by the Mother of Trees, and transforms into the white pine that sits upon Chapel Rock, on the edge of Lake Superior, overlooking it all.

 

What We Need & What You Get

If this work excites you and you’d like to see new and groundbreaking art by up-and-coming artists, we’d love to have some help in making this establishing project happen!

WHERE THE MONEY GOES: We need help purchasing our props, compensating our performers, renting the Ypsilanti Freighthouse space, documenting the performance, and funding our transportation to NYC. Additional funds go towards building our website, audio equipment, and printing a chapbook of the libretto!

We've already received an EXCEL Grant from the University of Michigan in collaboration with Converge New Music, and are raising what we need to fill in the gaps.

 

The Impact

  • Our work bridges the gap between contemporary music and folk-style singing, as well as intimate and abstract works of theater.
  • After our previous production of Einstein in the HOUSE (our adaptation of Philip Glass and Robert Wilson's Einstein on the Beach for an Ann Arbor living room), we want to start bringing original works by our team into production! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want to help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Come see either the performance in Ypsilanti Michigan on Aug 28-29 or in New York City on Oct 12!

story:
Who am I?

I’m a DIY grassroots pop artist striving to bring my vision to the mainstream one deeply gay banger at a time. This past year I released my debut album “Crush on Me” which gathered considerable steam and praise by press and fans alike. As an independent artist, I do not have major label backing or a big secret budget so it is hard to keep up with the momentum to be frank! I have a big vision and a tiny wallet but want to deliver the most epic music videos (like Haunted House!) I possibly can for my dedicated fanbase and new listeners/viewers. It is never easy to produce a music video, particularly without a sponsor. I do not want this to stop us from delivering a music video on a scale that CHEERLEADER deserves. 

To reiterate, this project is an opportunity for queer content to be made FOR the queers BY the queers. There will be no watering down of queerness in this video, only pure unfiltered GAY SHIT. In return I hope to provide a community driven project with the kind of catharsis that can only come through dance floor discoveries.

Risks & Challenges 

Videos are expensive to make! Locations, rehearsal space, film crew, and transportation all add up. Even working on the most frugal of levels can be tight on the budget. With the funds raised from this campaign, I hope to comfortably meet my team’s budgetary goals AND elevate my video's quality and reach to spread the bisexual agenda!

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!! Every cheerleader needs a squad, and shouting about this to new people is as valuable as a donation. I very much get not having money to throw around (hence this Indiegogo!), so if you’re strapped for cash please consider shouting about this project to the next 5 people you run into:) If you’re STRAIGHT--donating to this will give you an honorary ally award for the next calendar year!! <3

 

**All photos taken by Molly @m0photo 

**Video shot and edited by @oliviakua
story_txt: Who am I?I’m a DIY grassroots pop artist striving to bring my vision to the mainstream one deeply gay banger at a time. This past year I released my debut album “Crush on Me” which gathered considerable steam and praise by press and fans alike. As an independent artist, I do not have major label backing or a big secret budget so it is hard to keep up with the momentum to be frank! I have a big vision and a tiny wallet but want to deliver the most epic music videos (like Haunted House!) I possibly can for my dedicated fanbase and new listeners/viewers. It is never easy to produce a music video, particularly without a sponsor. I do not want this to stop us from delivering a music video on a scale that CHEERLEADER deserves. To reiterate, this project is an opportunity for queer content to be made FOR the queers BY the queers. There will be no watering down of queerness in this video, only pure unfiltered GAY SHIT. In return I hope to provide a community driven project with the kind of catharsis that can only come through dance floor discoveries.Risks & Challenges Videos are expensive to make! Locations, rehearsal space, film crew, and transportation all add up. Even working on the most frugal of levels can be tight on the budget. With the funds raised from this campaign, I hope to comfortably meet my team’s budgetary goals AND elevate my video's quality and reach to spread the bisexual agenda!Other Ways You Can HelpSPREAD THE WORD!!!! story:
Our Story + The Vision

Our dream for Hollerhorn Distilling was to create a cultural hub in the heart of the Finger Lakes region. A place to celebrate and highlight the bounty of the area through good food, amazing cocktails and spirits, and by bringing in some of the best artists and musicians from around the country. As many of you know well, we were off to a great start! 

This year has obviously been extremely difficult for so many, and has impacted all of us. We have done the best we can in pivoting to make sanitizer for the community during the lockdown, and by taking a very slow, thoughtful approach to reopening as safely as possible.  We have been scrambling like so many businesses to stay afloat, try and adapt, and grow in new inventive ways in order to survive. The loss of all musical events has been the biggest hurdle for us here. We are asked every week “when is the music coming back?” and we are here trying our best to answer your call and bring the magic back.

Not only has Hollerhorn been greatly impacted by the lack of events here, but also the entire community that thrives on it. So many of us are local artists and musicians, and so many of our brilliant friends have performed here these last 2 years. They have been hurt tremendously by this situation, and by the lack of outdoor venues practicing safe distancing guidelines. This is a big reason for this fundraiser, and our goal to build an outdoor music venue by next summer!

We have been racing to navigate the next pivot, the next shut down, and the next wave of this pandemic before it catches us off guard again. This fundraising effort is our best way forward toward a future that is hopeful, healthy, inspiring, and brimming with vibrant live events again! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We built Hollerhorn with our own hands, with every penny we could save, beg, or borrow, and we are at a point where we must grow to survive. We need to find a safe way to bring events and people back to our area, as well as a way to expand the space and capacity of our entire model. From seating capacity and service, to barrel warehousing and parking, this is our attempt to help address, and move forward in solving these needs. Every dollar raised will be used for materials to build the stage and underlying barrel storage for our spirits. 

We have come up with some fun rewards for your support of this next step, (hello super delicious holiday cocktail kits, limited edition whisky, private mixology classes, oh my!) as well as some great ways to literally make a mark here permanently - from the stainless steel “Stage Supporter”plaques, to the actual naming of the stage.  We have many fun ways for you all to be recognized, celebrated, and forever infused into the great spirit of Hollerhorn!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out will be crucial for our fundraiser.  Please tell your friends and neighbors.  Shout if from the rooftops! You can share our campaign page with ease using the Indiegogo sharing links for e-mail, Facebook and Twitter.  Spreading the word would mean the world to us!

 

With Gratitude

We are so thankful for all of you, all of your support these last few years, and for your continued support of what we strive to do! “Raising Spirits in the Finger Lakes” is the mantra we hold in mind everyday, and we hope to continue to push to greater heights in the coming years! Lots of love and gratitude from all of us here, to all of you! We look forward to seeing you all back here soon!

-Karl and Melissa

story:
Whats up everyone, my name is Niesha Burns but I am A.K.A Yoyo Sumz. I am a american Rapper from Chicago trying to see how far I can go. I have 4 songs in stores with most of your favorite online retailers and online streaming sites. I released my first come out single "Lotto" in 2017,  my second single "MBDN" in 2018, my third single "blu" in 2019 and my fourth single "Cant deny me" in 2020.  Before the global covid 19 pandemic, performing and doing shows was a great way to make extra monies to help fund my projects. Now, most musicians like myself  are forced to depend solely on streaming However, I cant let that stop me. I need help from the people who are inspired and enjoy my music to help me create more content and help get the word out. By donating today, you guys are helping me achieve that goal. This is not just a campaign to me. This is a contribution to helping my career as a serious and talented musician. Although I was born and rasied in communities that are broken and deprived, Im still striving to be the next big name and success in music. To be able to give back to our communities the way they once gave back to me would be a blessing and a great privilege. With you help, each donation gets me one step closer.

A minimum budget of 25,000 is needed for this E.P project. For those who help me reach my goal will recieve exclusive clips and footage of my performance and receive a free copy off the project on the day of release.  If i reach my goal of 25,000, all the funds will go toward E.P project  called "Hear Me Now?. To be specific the funds will cover studio recording, mixing and mastering, producing original music, promotional music videos, marketing and promotion. 5,000 will go towards all studio recording, mixing and mastering, 1,000 will go towards making original music for the songs, 5,000 will be for the music videos to give you guys great visuals and last but not least the remaining 14,000 will go towards marketing, promotion, running ads and branding. 

The road ahead of my career will be long and bumpy, but with the support and love from my new and old loyal fans, I know I'll overcome and I am grateful and thankful you guys get to play a major part in that. I plan to continue networking and promoting and upload fresh content all while building my loyal fan base.

Your glad you found me!?, you love my music!?, your a new fan!? you just really don't have the funds to help at the time. That's ok too. You are my new fan and your still excited about your new discovery! What are you waiting for? Go be your awesome self and share it with the world. Feel free to Share this fundraiser on your social media pages, follow me and listen on spotify. Let's get people talking! ????

Feel free to use Indiegogo share tools as a easy way to share??

story:
ART FOR THE EARS

by Mike Blakely

What drives a young songwriter to the terrifying act of standing in front of an audience to perform an original song for the first time?  Most couldn’t even tell you.  It’s just an aching “want-to” to release something that’s fighting to get out of them.  Not even the fear of public embarrassment can dissuade them.  I remember feeling that way decades ago.

But now, after 45 years in the music business, nerves seldom get to me on stage and instead of feeling swept up by some mysterious urge to perform, I have developed an understanding of my life’s purpose and why it is worthwhile.  If I can write, perform and record a song that helps someone forget a nagging worry for a while or takes one’s imagination on a fascinating trip to a far away place and time or brings about a laugh or a sigh or a tear, then I have succeeded beyond any measure of wealth or fame.  It’s my calling to create those escapism experiences for music lovers.

With much joy and anticipation I now endeavor to record my 14th album.  As always, I need partners to make this happen.  As with my last CD, The Outside Circle, I am sticking with the brilliant production team of Walt Wilkins and Ron Flynt at Ron's Jumping Dog Studio in Austin, Texas.  We established a track record of success with that album including two national awards. 

With this funding campaign I now offer you the chance to be a part of our next musical adventure.  Unlike The Outside Circle, the new project, yet untitled, will not be a whole-hog cowboy and wild west musical project.  You might hear a track or two with a western flare, but the rest of the collection will fall into the Americana, country or folk-rock categories.  But regardless of genres, our dedication to creative excellence will remain the same.

So, if you believe what I have come to embrace – that music is healing and uplifting; that it is not only important but crucial to a joyful life – then I invite you to partner with me and my team to have some fun and make some art for the ears. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're setting a goal to raise $12,000 for studio recording, mixing, mastering and CD manufacturing.  Those costs include payments to top-notch musicians and graphic designers, among other necessary incidentals.  

With your contribution come perks!  Take a look at our various levels of support and the rewards that go along with them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Ask folks to get the word out and stir some interest in our campaign to make the world a more musically wonderful place.  Social media can work as a profound tool for positive energy, and that - good vibes - is what this project is all about.

story:
B2C: Bach Cello Suites Unleashed with Choir

 

I have always loved Bach, and as a cellist, especially his Six Suites for Solo Cello. Yet it seems that too often people feel like they don't have a "way in" to this glorious music... at first glance, it can appear too "intellectual" or "dry," especially in a busy, technology-driven world in which our attention span is so short...

Since graduating from Indiana University Jacobs School of Music in 2009, it has been my dream to present this gorgeous music in a new context and to challenge listeners who may think they don't enjoy Bach with an alternative presentation that does allow them a "way in." My cello teachers would all tell me to "hear the implied harmonies" in the music... the idea of combining the solo cello suites with choir always seemed very natural to me... a realization of what is already there (with a little artistic license, of course, please forgive me, Johann*!). 

And so when I recorded Bach's Six Cello Suites at St. Paul's Cathedral in 2017 and had the opportunity to meet the cathedral's wonderful choir director, Martin Green, I just couldn't resist the idea of proposing my idea to him... The creation of an album of Bach's Cello Suites Nos.1 and 3 alongside an original choral arrangement --with the talented St. Paul's choristers. Luckily for me, Martin loved the idea, and here we are!

In order to help bring this project to fruition, a number of people are volunteering their time, and St. Paul's Cathedral is very generously allowing us to record in their beautiful space pro bono. We have been able to reduce or cut costs in a number of areas, but are still in need of considerable funding to bring this project to completion (our expenses are listed below in "Risks and Challenges").

This is the reason we have created this campaign... any financial support you are able to give to help bring "B2C: Bach Cello Suites Unleashed" to light would be incredibly appreciated! We hope you will take a moment to watch our campaign video and to browse our thank you gifts. This campaign is an "all or nothing campaign" which means we have to reach our funding goal or we get nothing. Any help you can give in spreading the word about our campaign would also be much appreciated.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration of support for "B2C: Bach Cello Suites Unleashed." Together, we can help bring classical music to a broader audience, both nationally and internationally, with a goal to communicate both with current classical music-lovers, and also with people who may not find classical music readily accessible today. 

We literally couldn't do it without you! <3

In gratitude,

Sophie

*It was very important to me to keep the writing minimal and uncluttered, with each notational choice stemming from Bach's original composition. 

 

P.S. If successfully funded, all backers of this project will receive updates about the project as it progresses, including short video and photographic documentation. 

 

 

The Impact

 

  • Help bring classical music to a wider audience
  • Support innovation in the the arts, and classical music in particular!
  • Hear Bach's Cello Suites in a totally different way
  • Pre-order a limited edition signed album (CD/download cards available)
  • Share the classical music love!

story:
Before I get into this, let me first explain that I just ran a successful Kickstarter Campaign. This is for those of you who came late to the party. Life happens. I get it. But you still want to pre-order my EP or contribute in some way so this is where you can do that!

Now here's the story:

Hi, I'm Jenny Bruce, a New York City independent singer-songwriter. I've released 3 full albums and an EP, and I'm deeply proud of that body of work.  

As "Jenny Bruce" I am also a wife, a mother of two boys, a full-time Communications Director, a grad-school student, and caregiver for my father who is in the end stages of Parkinson's.  

Immersed in the layers of a wonderful, busy, full life, I realized that the artist in me was slowly becoming invisible. That triggered a memory of my mother telling me repeatedly that, "At 50, you become invisible. Nobody sees you or listens to you anymore."  

One night, I had a very lucid dream. In it I was on stage. The lighting was dim and electric blue. A voice introduced me as "GHOSTE" and as it did, I saw the word (with the “E”) projected in bright letters behind me.  

I woke up.  

And I made a choice. At 52, I will not be invisible. Or ignored. The artist in me has a voice. That voice is GHOSTE! 

The E is silent. I am not.

It has been freeing to write and record in the blue glow of GHOSTE and the songs I've written for this EP are brimming with passion, melancholy, joy, and longing. Gifted producer and composer, Matt Anthony, brings his innovative textures and sounds (sampling a loon! - how a propos) and his boundless enthusiasm and creativity to the mix!

***Are you with me so far? This is where I really need YOU!***

To continue recording, mixing, mastering, duping and promoting the songs for this new EP I need to raise funds. I've set my goal at $7000 as that would cover SOME of the costs of making this EP... The actual cost is twice that! 

This is a little backward design in action. If you're not familiar with BD, it a model we use in education and it works! The goal is to release this music and share it with as many people as possible. However, in order to do that without a record label and the budget and PR machine that come with, I am reaching out to YOU to give GHOSTE wings!

Why did I set my goal lower than what I need? I'm comfortable taking creative risks, but I'd be a lousy venture capitalist! If I don't meet my goal, I don't receive any of the funds so I'm playing it "safe." I hope. On the other hand, if I exceed my goal, oh, the wonderful things I can do!!!

Any extra funds will help me cover the REAL costs of recording, mixing, mastering, duping, maybe even printing some vinyl, and getting real photos taken.  I am the artist, and my own webmaster, and graphic designer... However, hard as I try, I can't do it all on my own! At least not well.

Music is my passion and I'm so grateful to you for helping make that happen and for giving my music greater meaning. Connection is everything. I make the music because I need, but it becomes meaningful when you listen and connect with me. 

Thank you so much!

Enjoy these silly, spooky outtakes. Days of recording tossed onto the virtual cutting room floor... 

GHOSTE or just plain ghost? 

There are many beautiful things about being a mature human. One is truly grasping the precious, precarious nature of life. Another is understanding the absurdity of our existence and being able to laugh at it all! I have never felt more alive or more creative!

Let's prove definitively that creativity doesn't diminish with age and that GHOSTE(s) truly exists! Support my first EP as - GHOSTE! 

Thank you for supporting my campaign by contributing or sharing this. I am deeply grateful for your faith in me and am forever in your debt.

xo

Jenny the friendly GHOSTE

 

* * * *

"Jenny Bruce, has a lot of life stories to tell. She weaves them into the fabric of her songs that unfolds for her listeners so effortlessly, like a soft linen handkerchief in the warm summer breeze." - PASTE MAGAZINE 

"Jenny Bruce's warm, clear voice is ideally suited to convey the emotions she has invested in original songs that deal with the myriad dimensions of love, its summits, and limitations. Her pipes can transition confidently from breathy to resonant in a seamless fashion." - MUSIC CONNECTION
 

Is all that we see or seem, But a dream within a dream? - Edgar Allan Poe

 

  • RISKS AND CHALLENGES

    Four songs are nearly completed and I anticipate having a six-song EP ready to distribute digitally in July! I am working with familiar vendors and I don't anticipate any hiccups there either. The official release is slated for October. Barring acts of God, I don't see any impediment to my delivering all rewards as promised. The Ghost-Hunt reward will depend on your availability. There is a great deal of flexibility on my end and on the venue's part.

    Back to the acts of God, my father has been very ill for a very long time. That is a big unknown. But I will make all best efforts to honor my timelines in any event.
