Hi, I'm Jenny Bruce, a New York City independent singer-songwriter. I've released 3 full albums and an EP, and I'm deeply proud of that body of work.  
As "Jenny Bruce" I am also a wife, a mother of two boys, a full-time Communications Director, a grad-school student, and caregiver for my father who is in the end stages of Parkinson's.  
Immersed in the layers of a wonderful, busy, full life, I realized that the artist in me was slowly becoming invisible. That triggered a memory of my mother telling me repeatedly that, "At 50, you become invisible. Nobody sees you or listens to you anymore."  
One night, I had a very lucid dream. In it I was on stage. The lighting was dim and electric blue. A voice introduced me as "GHOSTE" and as it did, I saw the word (with the “E”) projected in bright letters behind me.  
I woke up.  
And I made a choice. At 52, I will not be invisible. Or ignored. The artist in me has a voice. That voice is GHOSTE! 
The E is silent. I am not.
It has been freeing to write and record in the blue glow of GHOSTE and the songs I've written for this EP are brimming with passion, melancholy, joy, and longing. Gifted producer and composer, Matt Anthony, brings his innovative textures and sounds (sampling a loon! - how a propos) and his boundless enthusiasm and creativity to the mix!
***Are you with me so far? This is where I really need YOU!***
To continue recording, mixing, mastering, duping and promoting the songs for this new EP I need to raise funds. I've set my goal at $7000 as that would cover SOME of the costs of making this EP... The actual cost is twice that! 
This is a little backward design in action. If you're not familiar with BD, it a model we use in education and it works! The goal is to release this music and share it with as many people as possible. However, in order to do that without a record label and the budget and PR machine that come with, I am reaching out to YOU to give GHOSTE wings!
Why did I set my goal lower than what I need? I'm comfortable taking creative risks, but I'd be a lousy venture capitalist! If I don't meet my goal, I don't receive any of the funds so I'm playing it "safe." I hope. On the other hand, if I exceed my goal, oh, the wonderful things I can do!!!
Any extra funds will help me cover the REAL costs of recording, mixing, mastering, duping, maybe even printing some vinyl, and getting real photos taken.  I am the artist, and my own webmaster, and graphic designer... However, hard as I try, I can't do it all on my own! At least not well.
Music is my passion and I'm so grateful to you for helping make that happen and for giving my music greater meaning. Connection is everything. I make the music because I need, but it becomes meaningful when you listen and connect with me. 
Thank you so much!
Enjoy these silly, spooky outtakes. Days of recording tossed onto the virtual cutting room floor... 
GHOSTE or just plain ghost? 
There are many beautiful things about being a mature human. One is truly grasping the precious, precarious nature of life. Another is understanding the absurdity of our existence and being able to laugh at it all! I have never felt more alive or more creative!
Let's prove definitively that creativity doesn't diminish with age and that GHOSTE(s) truly exists! Support my first EP as - GHOSTE! 
Thank you for supporting my campaign by contributing or sharing this. I am deeply grateful for your faith in me and am forever in your debt.
xo
Jenny the friendly GHOSTE
 
* * * *
"Jenny Bruce, has a lot of life stories to tell. She weaves them into the fabric of her songs that unfolds for her listeners so effortlessly, like a soft linen handkerchief in the warm summer breeze." - PASTE MAGAZINE 
"Jenny Bruce's warm, clear voice is ideally suited to convey the emotions she has invested in original songs that deal with the myriad dimensions of love, its summits, and limitations. Her pipes can transition confidently from breathy to resonant in a seamless fashion." - MUSIC CONNECTION 
Is all that we see or seem, But a dream within a dream? - Edgar Allan Poe
 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
Four songs are nearly completed and I anticipate having a six-song EP ready to distribute digitally in July! I am working with familiar vendors and I don't anticipate any hiccups there either. The official release is slated for October. Barring acts of God, I don't see any impediment to my delivering all rewards as promised. The Ghost-Hunt reward will depend on your availability. There is a great deal of flexibility on my end and on the venue's part.
Back to the acts of God, my father has been very ill for a very long time. That is a big unknown. But I will make all best efforts to honor my timelines in any event.

story:
Life can take a turn, and what you thought you would always do is not what you find yourself doing. When I was in my mid 20’s I took a break from my life as a touring musician, opening for the likes of Odetta, John Gorka, and the Indigo Girls; a break that lasted the better part of 25 years. “Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both” as Robert Frost wrote. Then, one sultry evening in the summer of 2018, I found myself at an open mic. By the end of the night, I was singing again. Four months later, to my surprise, I was writing songs again. An evolution of style had occurred while I had been busy living my life and the connection I had to music was more potent. The words flowed onto the page. My guitar playing was more fluid. I felt more capable of expressing. I had traveled a road of challenges and sacrifice that informed my music with a depth only achieved through life experience.

I wrote 40 plus songs in a year, 11 of which are on this record. In the words and melodies are the stories of my adult life: the passing of my mother, the dissolution of a 20 year marriage, my discovery and exploration of meditation, new love, and the essence of the sacred in everything and everyone. Writing the songs for “Brave New View” was my safe harbor; my rise out of the proverbial ash pile. Tracy Walton, who is producing the album with me, has referred to this record as my Phoenix Rising. I’d love to have your help getting it to take flight.

I’m looking forward to you hearing it! In this challenging era we all find ourselves in, my wish is that  the album will offer healing and joy to many. I’d be forever grateful for your help on the home stretch. 

What We Need and What Your Support Will Help Us Achieve:

The monies raised with this campaign will help offset the cost of recording, session musicians, the album’s CD duplication, music video filming and editing, photo shoots, our launch and support of a national radio campaign, and will fuel the wind beneath all things promotional. Making the record is the first step in a much longer journey.

As thank you perks, we have an array of choices, including signed CDs and photos, house concerts, artwork, and a professionally produced music video. Check out the list!

    Additional Ways You Can Help:

    Share this Campaign  with friends and let’s increase the wind factor, and see how high and far we can take this music together. Thank you for taking the time to visit this page and check out the video! I look forward to getting the music "out there". Thank you, thank you.

story:
The Calla Quartet: Michaela Wellems and Amelia Dietrich, violin; Aiden Kane, viola; Karissa Zadinsky, cello

Be sure to check out our IndieGoGo photo gallery!

Who are we?

Formed in February of 2014, the members of The Calla Quartet are currently sophomores in the Bachelor of Music program at The Colburn Conservatory of Music. This May, The Calla Quartet will be performing in the Fischoff National Competition Quarterfinals in Indiana this spring. Calla has been selected to participate in the 2015 Perlman Music Program Chamber Music Workshop with Merry Peckham. Following the Workshop, the quartet has been invited to perform at the Mimir Chamber Music Festival as part of the Emerging Artists program. Mimir will be located in Fort Worth, Texas and Melbourne, Australia this summer. Calla performed at the Norton Simon Museum’s Musical Compositions series in November 2014, presenting works by Bartok, Ravel, Haydn, and Tchaikovsky. This February, they worked with Colburn's Theater Chair Debbie Devine to reach over 1,500 elementary school children through interactive performances at Zipper Hall. Calla has also been featured in several private performances for donors of The Colburn School. The quartet will return to perform a second full recital at the Sierra Madre Playhouse on April 19th at 7:00pm. The Calla Quartet is coached by Martin Beaver, Clive Greensmith, and Arnold Steinhardt.


Why We Need Your Help

We've been fortunate to have been accepted to incredible festivals where some tuition and housing is covered; but for four people and a cello (who also needs a plane ticket,) there are more expenses than we can cover ourselves as young artists. Next month we will be competing in the quarterfinals of the Fischoff National Chamber Music Competition at Notre Dame University. In addition, we have been invited to study and perform at The Perlman Chamber Music Workshop in Shelter Island, NY; The Mimir Music Festival in Fort Worth, TX; and at Australia’s prestigious Melbourne Conservatory in September! Of course, hotels, meal plans, and plane tickets really add up, so this is where your support can come in. Through these competitions and festivals, we will continue to expand our knowledge, repertoire and build professional connections which are so vital to emerging artists, like ourselves. Your support is truly appreciated.  Thank you, because without you, this could not be possible. 


Breakdown of our Summer Expenses

Fischoff National Chamber Music Competition hotel—$750 (3 nights)

Fischoff NCMC plane tickets: $700 (LAX—Chicago) (4 people and 1 cello)

                                            $600 (Chicago—Home) (3 people and 1 cello)

Perlman Chamber Workshop Tuition:  $2,000 ($500 per person)

Perlman CW plane tickets: $450 (2 people, 1 cello, 2 Calla members are driving)

Mimir Festival food: $1,200 12 days, $25 per day, 4 people

Mimir plane tickets: $1,200 (4 people and one cello)  (NC—Mimir)

                                        $800 (4 people and 1 cello)  (Mimir—home)

Mimir Festival (Melbourne, Australia) food and overhead: 4,000 ($1,000 each)

Transportation cushion: $300

TOTAL: $12,000

We can't thank you enough for all of your donations and support. We look forward to sharing all of our experiences with you!


Mimir Festival: 

http://www.mimirfestival.org/mimir-emerging-artists/

Perlman Chamber workshop:

 http://perlmanmusicprogram.org/programs/chamber-music-workshop

story:
The Journey Tapes project

Hi everyone! My name is Ed Carlsen and I am a 26-year-old London-based composer. I have decided to start a crowdfunding campaign to support my five-track debut EP, 'The Journey Tapes', out in early 2016. 

'The Journey Tapes' is indeed a brief summary of the journey that has led me to create these fresh songs; in fact, just like a real journey, life has got me in touch with so many different influences and styles that shaped me as a musician.

Throughout my life, I played many different musical genres, including classical, metal, rock, reggae, prog and more. I want to bring the energy that is typical of a rock track to meet the unbounded solutions of experimentation, thus creating a fresh and enjoyable mix.

Lately, I have approached the world of music production, which made me realise how to better combine the needs of both the musician and the guy who sits behind the console. Thanks to my studies, I have had the opportunity to explore electronic instruments, synthesisers and MIDI operations. This is why I feel the need to deliver you all a product that includes both the acoustic and the electronic sides of music. It's a real challenge, as it's entirely experimental, but still keeping the harmonic dimension as the pivotal point.

Along with the audio production, each track will be fitted with its own video, realised by talented filmmakers and animators. The visual aspect will have an important role, as making the image emerge through sound is one of the things I enjoy the most.

I wouldn’t tag my music as being one genre only, but I’d say it’s a mixture of modern classical, electronic and ambient music. Composing can be a real challenge, but I think it’s crucial to bear in mind the importance of making music whenever there is a story to tell. Right now, I have a story in mind and I couldn’t be more excited to tell you all!

 

(photo by Kristine Norlander - www.kristinenorlander.com)

 

 

 

About Ed

I decided that music would have been my lifelong companion when I listened to The Eagles’ ‘Tequila Sunrise’ for the first time. I was only six years old and I decided to start playing piano. I have practised it for one year, until I fell in love with the guitar. I have never stopped playing the guitar since, studying several genres. At first, I took the classical path, thus getting to study pieces by Albeniz, Tarrega, Brouwer and more. Then, heavy metal knocked upon my door, followed by all the electric guitar virtuosos, such as Steve Vai, Joe Satriani, Andy Timmons and many, many more. In between, I started playing with my early bands, which gave me the chance to understand how to make music as part of a team, rather than exclusively by myself. I have played classic rock, reggae, indie and progressive rock. This latter is still one of my reference genres, as it combines simplicity with pure extravaganza. My favourite prog artists are Neal Morse (my major inspiration in the last decade), Transatlantic, Spock’s Beard, and the immortal Genesis, Yes, ELP, and so on.

Seeing Steven Wilson live in March 2015 changed my life, and this is actually when I decided to tell my story through an integrated aural/visual experience. His last album 'Hand Cannot Erase' is a great example of the idea I have of music.

Exploring electronic music brought me to know artists like Nils Frahm, Olafùr Arnalds and Efterklang. They are great at combining the acoustic and the electronic souls of music. The music contained in 'The Journey Tapes' will be like that, with the piano as the main instrument, some strings and the magic of electronic sounds. This is exactly the direction I intend to follow!

 

 

Why I do this

Honestly, I have always thought that an effective way to establish somebody’s own music is to get the product out there. It is the realisation of the long journey that started with the raw idea in the first place. The reason why I need a strong product in my hands is to qualify for the admissions to access a prestigious Masters degree in Copenhagen, which I am really longing for. Admissions are tough and I will need to do the best work I’ve done so far to make it through. It’s a dream that often keeps me awake at night, but today I feel confident that we’re totally gonna make it!

 

 

 

 

 

Let’s talk business

The amount of money I request is £2,500. This will cover for expenses to bring some professional performers over to the studios and make some magic together. It will also allow me to hire some talented graphic designers, animators and video makers to produce the visuals. Some of the money will be allocated for production expenses, such as the packaging of the physical copies and the mastering, which will be carried out at some top-class studio in London.

A smaller part of the sum will cover the logistic aspects of the perks, including shipment, printing, mailing fees, etc.

Should we not reach the goal (but let’s just not jinx it!), some cuts will obviously occur. The main concern is to keep the funds allocated for the musicians, as I really want it to sound amazing first. The visuals are also crucial to the project, so I’ll try to keep as much money as possible for this purpose too. Should some extra £100 be available, I’ll try to make all my contributors happy regardless of the outcome.

The business plan can roughly be expressed as:

Musicians (average 30/h per musician, including transport and meals)…….700.00

Visuals team (filmmaker, editor, graphic designer and animator)……………...700.00

Production costs (Mastering, printing and packaging)……………………….........900.00

Logistics (perks delivery)…………………………………………………………..................100.00

Contingency………………………………………………………………………........................100.00

Total……………………………………………………………………………….........................2,500.00

 

 

A huge thanks to all of you

Dudes and girls, from the bottom of my heart, thanks to all of you no matter what happens! I can’t wait to start this project with you, who are part of this sort of inner circle. Make sure that you choose carefully among the wonderful perks I’m offering you and that you make some noise by spreading the word and bringing ‘The Journey Tapes’ all over the world!

Thank you!

Ed

story:
News:

I spoke recently with Age UK ("the country's largest charity dedicated to helping everyone make the most of later life.") about volunteering in each city that I'm going to visit, and hopefully make the most of that time playing music to bring a nice and joyful moment to all the people there!
---

About me

Hi everyone! My name is Winston Barlow and I am a musician from Viña del Mar, Chile. I’ve been playing and studying violin since I was 12. I also play the guitar and piano, sometimes I sing, write and record music and film videos. Music is one of the most important things in my life and I believe that it is a source of inspiration for so many people and it can be used to make a change in our world.

WHAT INSPIRED THIS?

I have been busking with my violin on the streets of Viña del Mar for a year, and it has been a truly meaningful and fascinating experience, the connection with people, especially children is just amazing. My dream and my goal is to share music and inspire people through it, and inspire people to live as active dreamers.

Music has the power to convey emotions as nothing else can, it can change our mood, it can inspire us, make us dream. I believe that music can be used to connect people and as a positive influence for so many people in many different ways, from musical education in schools to a street musician performing, it creates a special atmosphere in our lives. I want to explore this in other cultures and learn from it and share it with the world.

WHAT IS THIS ABOUT?

On June 2015 I will be flying to London where this adventure will begin, expecting to reach more places and countries. My plan is to join street musicians, artists, and people around to talk about music and its meaning in their life. I will record casual music sessions with other musicians and share a message through this. My goal is not only talk about music but also talk about culture, about dreaming, about getting things done, and give a meaningful dimension to our daily life through this so we can inspire the people who is around us.

I will be traveling with my violin and guitar, always open to get one of them and start playing (I am aware that busking permits are required, so before trying to perform on the streets I will surely get one on the respective city council). I would love having the possibility to volunteer in schools or organisations that would let me reach children through music, inspire and teach them to learn an instrument, and spread the love and importance of art in their lives.

DREAM AND SHARE!

The main goal of this project is to share this adventure with everyone. So I will be making a series of videos (vlogging-documentary-style) of each city that I am going to visit on my youtube channel, and occasionally writing a travel blog. I love making movies and I will do my best to put up good material to share.

Social media is a unique platform where this project can reach a large amount of people around the world, so I will be constantly sharing updates so everyone will be able to follow this adventure.

I truly believe that the beauty of dreaming lays in the virtue of sharing, and because of this is why I need your help and I want you to be involved in this project. If you are around and you want to join me, let me know! I would be really happy and it would be an amazing experience for sure. Maybe we can make a good team!

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

I want you to be part of this project and join me in this adventure. Busking has been my main source to fund this trip but I need your help to make this happen and reach more people and places since my arrival in London. With your contribution you will be involved in this cultural journey to show everyone how music is a universal language of connection and inspiration and how it can be used to make a change in our world, and also you will help spreading a message of inspiration through this adventure itself to become active dreamers. 

I am looking to hopefully raise $3000, and this will help with:

  • Accommodation: I will manage this by staying with friends and volunteering. Couchsurfing is also an option and it is a wonderful way to get to know the city that I am visiting and its people. But sometimes I will need to pay for a place to stay.

  • Transportation: this is one of the most important parts, to reach more places and expand this journey, it is also an expensive item.

  • Gear and instrument maintenance: my camera will be my eyes to share with you and the world  this journey so it has to be always fully working. I will be playing a lot and my violin and guitar are delicate instruments who need lovely care especially with the transportation.

  • Food: sometimes it will be necessary to eat.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Sharing this campaign will be a huge contribution too!
Don't forget to stay in touch with this adventure by following me in social media.
story_txt:
News:
I spoke recently with Age UK ("the country's largest charity dedicated to helping everyone make the most of later life.") about volunteering in each city that I'm going to visit, and hopefully make the most of that time playing music to bring a nice and joyful moment to all the people there!
---
About me 
Hi everyone! My name is Winston Barlow and I am a musician from Viña del Mar, Chile. I’ve been playing and studying violin since I was 12. I also play the guitar and piano, sometimes I sing, write and record music and film videos. Music is one of the most important things in my life and I believe that it is a source of inspiration for so many people and it can be used to make a change in our world.    
WHAT INSPIRED THIS?

I have been busking with my violin on the streets of Viña del Mar for a year, and it has been a truly meaningful and fascinating experience, the connection with people, especially children is just amazing. My dream and my goal is to share music and inspire people through it, and inspire people to live as active dreamers.Music has the power to convey emotions as nothing else can, it can change our mood, it can inspire us, make us dream. I believe that music can be used to connect people and as a positive influence for so many people in many different ways, from musical education in schools to a street musician performing, it creates a special atmosphere in our lives. I want to explore this in other cultures and learn from it and share it with the world.    WHAT IS THIS ABOUT? 
On June 2015 I will be flying to London where this adventure will begin, expecting to reach more places and countries. My plan is to join street musicians, artists, and people around to talk about music and its meaning in their life. I will record casual music sessions with other musicians and share a message through this. My goal is not only talk about music but also talk about culture, about dreaming, about getting things done, and give a meaningful dimension to our daily life through this so we can inspire the people who is around us.I will be traveling with my violin and guitar, always open to get one of them and start playing (I am aware that busking permits are required, so before trying to perform on the streets I will surely get one on the respective city council). I would love having the possibility to volunteer in schools or organisations that would let me reach children through music, inspire and teach them to learn an instrument, and spread the love and importance of art in their lives.    
DREAM AND SHARE!


The main goal of this project is to share this adventure with everyone. So I will be making a series of videos (vlogging-documentary-style) of each city that I am going to visit on my youtube channel, and occasionally writing a travel blog. I love making movies and I will do my best to put up good material to share.
Social media is a unique platform where this project can reach a large amount of people around the world, so I will be constantly sharing updates so everyone will be able to follow this adventure.I truly believe that the beauty of dreaming lays in the virtue of sharing, and because of this is why I need your help and I want you to be involved in this project. If you are around and you want to join me, let me know! I would be really happy and it would be an amazing experience for sure. Maybe we can make a good team!
    
WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET  
I want you to be part of this project and join me in this adventure. Busking has been my main source to fund this trip but I need your help to make this happen and reach more people and places since my arrival in London. With your contribution you will be involved in this cultural journey to show everyone how music is a universal language of connection and inspiration and how it can be used to make a change in our world, and also you will help spreading a message of inspiration through this adventure itself to become active dreamers. I am looking to hopefully raise $3000, and this will help with:
Accommodation: I will manage this by staying with friends and volunteering. Couchsurfing is also an option and it is a wonderful way to get to know the city that I am visiting and its people. But sometimes I will need to pay for a place to stay.

Transportation: this is one of the most important parts, to reach more places and expand this journey, it is also an expensive item.
Gear and instrument maintenance: my camera will be my eyes to share with you and the world  this journey so it has to be always fully working. I will be playing a lot and my violin and guitar are delicate instruments who need lovely care especially with the transportation.
Food: sometimes it will be necessary to eat.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Sharing this campaign will be a huge contribution too!
Don't forget to stay in touch with this adventure by following me in social media.

story:
I’ve been singing all my life and over the 22 year history of The O-Tones, a New England Swing and Motown band, I’ve had the pleasure and good fortune of singing with many talented vocalists. Now is the time to get into the studio to have some fun with this! I will be collaborating with a dozen singers plus a rockin' rhythm section on hidden gems by Etta James, Ray Charles, Anita O'Day, Keb' Mo', Shelby Lynne, James Hunter, kd lang, Mayer Hawthorne, Dinah Washington, Allen Toussaint, and Mutlu, Here's where we are now: www.theotones.com. And we are traveling to new heights with this endeavor!

The fabulous singers include:

Samirah Evans (think sultry New Orleans)

Tony Lechner (jazz vocalist, director of Rock Voices)

Jim Henry (sings like butter, tours with Mary Chapin Carpenter, among others)

Ellen Cogen (jazzy director of Valley Jazz Voices)

Anand Nayak (soulful singer of rani arbo and daisy mayhem)

Ann Percival (swingin' bandmate in The O-Tones)

Tracy Grammer (renowned musician, singer and fiddler)

Annie Patterson (creative songbird, creator of Rise Up Singing)

Tom Mahnken (from the band Trailer Park)

Liza Constable (bluesy diva)

Max Cohen (rich and versatile vocalist)

John Caban (world-touring musician)

And the rhythm section is killer!

Jim Henry on guitar (one of our favorite sidemen, Jim works with a number of touring musicians including Paula Cole, Tracy Grammer, among others)

Chris Haynes on piano, organ, and accordion, as well as producer and arranger  for the project (world class musician, composer, arranger, and producer)

Jeff Dostal on bass (upright and electric, superb musicianship, has toured with Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, teaches and performs liberally)

I will also add my bass stylings on a few tunes, but will be kept busy singing with so many vocalists!

Pieter Struyk on drums (The O-Tones own drummer, incredibly versatile and talented, as well as really fun!)

Soloists will include guitarists Jim Henry, Anand Nayak, John Caban, and John Mason as well as sax players Charles Neville (of The Neville Brothers!) and Kerry Blount. Some songs will also have horn sections covered by the above plus sax Rick Page, trumpet Don Anderson, and trombone Joe Sabol. These soulful guys all have so much to contribute to the sound!

What we need & what you get:

This project is an ambitious one and we need help covering all the costs. That's where you come in! If you can pre-buy the recording as well as consider some of the other perks, and even kick in some extra to make it all happen smoothly, we would so appreciate it! And please help spread the word too. It makes such a difference to feel the support from our community. The O-Tones have gathered so many friends over the years. We are so grateful for all the people who listen and dance to and buy our music!

$15,000 might sound like a lot but that's what it costs these days for a project like this! We need to cover recording costs, artwork, photography, packaging, distribution, you name it. But we hope you like the perks selection we offer in exchange for your generosity and support!

We are excited about bringing this project to fruition because it feels like the culmination of many years of collaboration with other musicians, a real community effort. One of the joys of music is playing it with other people, a stimulating conversation! It's fun to imagine the coming together of all these great artists. Going into the studio is always so rewarding, to be able to record moments that just fly by in a live performance. The O-Tones have recorded several CDs over the years (http://theotones.com/?p=songs) and each one gets more ambitious and rewarding. Moving forward in this musical journey is so satisfying.

Thank you for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute much monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please help us spread the word. Everyone has a friend or family member who likes music! Please let them know.

Don't forget, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I started playing music about 8 years ago, and since then I've released 2 singles and 2 EP’s, been played on a multitude of radio shows and played a variety of gigs from Yorkshire down to the beaches of Brighton.

This June I'm hoping to go on a UK tour starting in York and travelling as far as Glasgow and Plymouth, before finishing my next EP.

The money raised from this campaign will be spent on fuel and accommodation, and whatever’s left will be spent on recording and CD production for the next EP.

What I Need & What You Get

IndieGoGo require a £500 minimum target, but realistically I only need about £300 to cover travel but obviously anything more would be really appreciated to help fund future musical endeavours!

Here are some of the “perks” you can get for donating certain amounts:

£3 – Copy of Empire (EP)

£5 – Recording of your choice of cover song

£10 – Pre-release copy of my next EP.

£12 – Black or White logo t-shirt

£80 – House gig!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate, no worries! You can also help out just by spreading the word about both the fundraising and about the tour itself.

Thanks in advance!

story:
The Campaign

Thank you for checking out this page to learn more about Mir Fontane and support his campaign.

Based out of Camden, NJ, Mir Fontane is an artist in all aspects of the word, who has been recording music for six years. 

This 22-year-old raps, sings, draws and loves to make an audience laugh. He has rapidly developed his lyrical skill and complimented it with a sense of humor that can only be compared to Kevin Hart, Jay Pharoah and Dave Chappelle.

As Fontane released new freestyles and remained consistent, he began to develop a following within the tri-state area. In the past 5 years, he has released four mixtapes, been featured in Coast2Coast Magazine, opened for Nappy Roots, A$AP Ant, and SZA, has had a handful viral youtube videos, including his comedic "Meek Mill Missed Calls" which made it to worldstarhiphop.com, vladtv.com, and thisis50.com. 

This young emcee is working to bring hope to the city of Camden through his music and is trying to pave the way for his friends and family. Fontane plans to use his vivid, story-telling of both good and bad situations to not only connect with members of his community, but one day, the world. He knows that music is not just his escape, but it is something that everyone can get behind.

The purpose of this campaign is to fund Mir Fontane's upcoming music, music videos, and all creative endeavors this Summer. 

"Mir Fontane is a 21-year-old NJ rapper that just dropped a 12-track project, entitled He So Crazy.

He So Crazy is much more than a mixtape, but more so an expertly crafted play where Mir Fontane not only becomes Martin, but adds his own twist to the show’s storyline, while utilizing snippets of dialogue from fan-favorite moments. With production from Kev Rodgers, Fontane has given us a very well created, 90s nostalgic project." - Scoob from AllHipHop.com

Mir Fontane hopes to amplify the success of his recent He So Crazy mixtape with his Summer 2015 releases. In an effort to make this happen, Mir Fontane will need to hire a videographer, a publicist and have a budget to finance studio time. 

By contributing to this campaign, you are playing a crucial role in helping Mir Fontane reach new fans, enhance the quality of his content, and make his dreams tangible. 

Helping Mir Fontane 

The goal is to reach $3,000, which will make it much easier for Mir Fontane to fund recording new music and creating high quality visuals. 

Recording the EP: $800

  • Mastering the Songs: $500
  • Printing CDs/Purchasing USBs: $300

2 Music Videos: $1000

  • Location: $300
  • Equipment: $300
  • Directing/Editing: $300
  • Costumes/Props: $100

Marketing: $1200

  • Press: $800
  • Advertising: $400

The Impact

Mir Fontane is a passionate artist that genuinely believes that his music can make a difference in his community. He recognizes  reaching this goal is a small, but great step forward towards his bigger goal of giving back to Camden and the youth in various struggling cities across the nation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love what Mir Fontane is doing, it would be greatly appreciated if you could share this campaign with anyone you think would be interested in supporting. 

Thank you!

story:
When people ask me what Fresh Department is about, I like to explain it with 4 Fs:

-  fresh PEOPLE: music lovers, artists, designers or just people who are interested in knowing more about it – fresh DEPARTMENT welcomes you.

-  fresh MUSIC: deep sounds, piano-led melody and clean vocals – we'll release music we'll all enjoy listening to.

-  fresh CULTURE: who says record label needs to be just about music? We'd love to connect with as many young and talented artists and designers as possible and give them a chance to represent their work.

-  fresh COMMUNITY: Lastly, we want to create a community which will be opened to all – everyone can join and everyone is welcome. We believe everyone has its one story, just like fresh DEPARTMENT does, so we don't judge each other.

The first idea of having my own record label occurred to me about 8 years ago, when I was still in high school. At that time I knew it's too soon and that I need to learn a lot about the music business. But the wish about having my own record label one day remained.

I've been following the events in the electronic music industry in the past 3-4 years and discovered there was a lot of negativity in it. After the EDM scene went big, one genre artists started  to hate other genres artists, similar thing happened with the fans.

I didn't understand what all the hate was about, I was and still am happy that there are people with different tastes in music on this planet. Just like we wear different clothes, drive different cars and use different phones. Imagine all of listening to the same music, wearing same clothes and driving same cars. Wouldn't it be boring?

So that's when I started thinking: why not start a record label and grow it in a community full of fresh people and at the same time give a chance to young artists and designers to showcase their work? The idea of Fresh DEPARTMENT as born.

We don't want to focus just on one main genre, we want to give the artists space for creativity and innovation, but we want this story to have a red line, a line that connects all of its participants – deep sounds.

What's the main message of Fresh Department? Fresh MUSIC, fresh PEOPLE, fresh CULTURE, fresh COMMUNITY. 

Of course there are other ways of helping! You can share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other socials or with you best friends through email and help us reach as many people as possible.

Additionally, you can follow us on our socials and stay updated with the latest news:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/freshdept

Soundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/freshdept

Twitter: www.twitter.com/freshdept

Instagram: www.instagram.com/freshdepartment

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2skDOhJptnpD8...

Website: www.freshdept.com

*Are you an artist and would like to submit a demo for our record label? You can submit it here: freshdept.toneden.io. Quick tip: we love vocals!

*Are you a web designer and would like to get spotted? Well, we got some great news for you! We decided to give young designers a chance to show their work by opening submissions for releases artworks! We'll choose one submission for every track we release and award you by giving you credits and mention you on all of our socials! Hurry up, you could design the artwork for our next release! You can submit your artwork here: http://bit.ly/1Kjee70.

We have connected with the most inspiring and interesting artists and designers to create the freshest community and we want to thank them all for being a part of this.

BOOPACKS (Katarina & Dominika Bučar):
Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/Boopacks/1384378758544491
Instagram: www.instagram.com/boopacks
Order your Boopack here: www.boopacks.com

BLUBIRD (#FRESH residents):
Website: www.blu-bird.com 
Facebook: www.facebook.com/blubirdmusic
Soundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/blubirdmusic
Instagram: www.instagram.com/blubird_music

CREAMSOAP (#FRESH resident):
Soundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/creamsoapmusic

The only risk with this campaign we can think about it right now is that your perk might arrive a little late, but we'll try our best to deliver all of them on time. Those of you who will purchase a "12 months of free music perks" might get the first release a few days later, but it will definitely happen in September!

story:
CD Narváez - 2015

Después de un largo, pero bien aprovechado receso, vuelvo al estudio para emprender la aventura de un nuevo disco. Desde que se lanzó el primero, hace cuatro años, un sinnúmero de sucesos diversos me llevaron a replantear el abordaje de la música que hago, y en el camino me he reencontrado con la tradición cultural de mi país de origen, Ecuador.

After a very helpful recess, we're going back to the recording studio in order to start a new CD album. Since we released the first one, four years ago, a lot of incidents made me reset my approach to music, and now I've found the cultural tradition of my birth country, Ecuador.

Sobre el nuevo disco 

A decir verdad, lo que me ha sucedido ha sido más un maravilloso descubrimiento y un refrescante aprendizaje, que un reencuentro.  Pese a que nací en la capital ecuatoriana, la circunstancia de mi ascendencia colombiana primero y las oportunidades vitales de mis padres después, me desconectaron del suelo originario muy temprano y me destinaron a crecer entre dos culturas diferentes de aquella que me puso en el mundo, de modo que llegué a conocer y vivir a Quito cuando ya había cumplido los 10 años. Recuerdo el aterrizaje en la ciudad y los rostros de la gente que nos esperaba en el aeropuerto; recuerdo sus manos llamando a mis padres, y recuerdo sus ojos, que reían llorando por la emoción de volvernos a encontrar. En medio de aquella vorágine que hoy me viene la mente con el vértigo de una secuencia confusa de fotografías antiguas, yo tenía la sensación de haber mudado de planeta: no reconocía paisajes, no entendía el dialecto, ni encontraba un aroma familiar que me conectara con este nuevo mundo al que había llegado. Solo entonces fui consciente de que en realidad jamás había comprendido el significado de la palabra “volver”, que ahora flotaba abandonada en el océano de mi cabeza de 10 años, cual náufrago a la deriva.

Como yo tocaba la guitarra desde los siete, lo primero que me interesó de este nuevo mundo fue conectarme con su música, y por inercia aprendí lo que aprenden todos los niños de Quito: que la música del Ecuador es el Pasillo, y que el emblema del pasillo ecuatoriano era un intérprete que murió joven, a quien se conoció como “el ruiseñor”. Creo que jamás alguien ha cuestionado aquello.

Todo lo que sucedió después del primer lanzamiento, tiene que ver con cuestionar aquel mito de la música ecuatoriana. He descubierto un nuevo país, en el que sí hay pasillo, pero que además tiene vals criollo, cumbia andina, y un sinnúmero de músicas traídas del África en los siglos coloniales y adaptadas al mestizaje de las diferentes regiones americanas. Aquí se quedaron ellas en las formas del Andarele y de la Bomba y de los Arrullos y de las Décimas.

Pero también se quedó el rock, que empezó a llegar desde los 60s, y que a medida que creció la industria de la música global dio paso a un abanico impresionante de géneros que hoy coexisten aquí con los otros, y que van del Pop al Metal como quien va de la cama al living.

El disco que estamos produciendo hoy, es un compendio de todo esto. Escribí las canciones que lo conformarán como una serie de historias de diversa índole, tragedia y comedia, ficción y poesía, entre las que se cuenta incluso alguna verdad del amor; y las compuse con los elementos del país descubierto, pero también con el remanente de las músicas que aprendí antes de llegar a Quito; como construyendo la brújula con la que una persona podría navegar en este País de las Ultimas Cosas. De alguna manera, es el regalo de bienvenida que le entregaría a aquel niño de 10 años que se vio arrollado por la sorpresa de llegar a un lugar en el que –como en la novela de Paul Auster- las cosas “desaparecen una a una y no vuelven nunca más”, y en donde “el clima cambia de forma continua: un día de sol, seguido de uno de lluvia; un día de nieve, luego uno de niebla; templado, después fresco; viento seguido de quietud; un rato de frío intenso y… en pleno invierno, una tarde de luz esplendorosa, tan cálida que no necesitas llevar más que un suéter.”

ABOUT THE NEW CD

I was born in Quito-Ecuador, but I didn,t live here until my tenth birthday. When I came here, I did not recognize the scenry, the dialect, the flavors or the smell of the air. Soon, I learned that the paradigm of ecuadorian music is the "Pasillo". 

In the last years I rediscovered that Ecuador is more than "Pasillo". It is, yes. But it also is Creole Waltz, Andean Cumbia, and a lot of afro-ecuadorian styles such as Andarele, Arullo, Décima and Bomba.

This new CD is my gift to that ten years old boy. It is a kind of a compass for navigate in Ecuador, my own Country of Last Things.

Qué necesitamos, que entregamos.

META: 15.000 Usd. 

Si alcanzamos la meta, invertiremos en:

    • Pago de estudios para las grabaciones finales, mezclas y masterización.
    • Desarrollo, diseño y producción del material gráfico necesarios para las artes del CD, para un sitio web de descargas digitales, y para piezas promocionales y otras (camisetas, fotos, posters).
    • Edición del 1er tiraje de CDs exclusivos para los participantes del proyectos, y envío postal.
    • Pago a músicos, arreglistas y técnicos participantes. 
    • Edición de 1 videoclip para redes sociales y medios
A cambio de ello, te ofrezco:
  • Descarga digital y/o envío de disco físico de mi primer álbum y los singles promocionales
  • Preventa digital y/o física del nuevo disco.
  • Merchandising: Camisetas, posters, fotos.
  • Concierto Acústico privado o serenata
  • Clase de música
  • Partituras y Score de mis discos
  • Un cuadro original pintado y firmado por mi (acuarela, pastel o carboncillo)
Si no alcanzamos la meta
  • Lo recaudado servirá para cubrir los costos de producción del disco, el diseño gráfico y la distribución.
WHAT WE NEED, WHAT YOU GET!
We need 15.000,00 Usd. With the money we are going to:
  • Pay recording studio, editing, mixing and mastering.
  • Develop graphic design, a web site and merchandising
  • Make CDs and send it to you
  • Pay musicians, arrangers and all the people involved in this project
  • Make one promotional videoclip
And you are going to get
  • Download Mp3 or get a CD of my first album "Desamor en 7 pecados"
  • Download Mp3 or get a CD of the new album
  • Merchandising
  • Private concert
  • Music Lesson
  • Scores of my music
  • an original painting by myself 
Thanks a lot!!!
Muchas gracias!!!

story:
Hey Everyone!

       My name is Salina Ford.  I am an independent cam model and adult entertainer.  I have been modeling since I was very young and know the ins and outs of my trade very well.  I work effortlessly to pursue my dream of becoming one of the most popular and well known faces of the industry.  Most of my work is done from home, but just recently, a horrible storm swept through and caused significant damage to the structure.  I am working to rebuild and hopefully add a studio to make photo shoots and camming easier for not only me, but also other models trying to make their start by working with me.  I am setting small goals to gradually accomplish everything I need for a successful studio.  The beginning stage will be to simply rebuild what I have lost from storm damage.  Second, I will be building, from the ground up, a new section of my home specifically for my studio.  Lastly, I will be remodeling the interior of the studio as well as purchase the necessary filming, photography, and camming equipment I will need, that will benefit everyone who participates in my studio.  With your help, I know I can create the perfect environment for making my dream a reality.  Thank you for all of your support!

story:
The Backstory

Howdy partner, my name is Michael Monroe Goodman and I am a Honky Tonk singer and songwriter from Kentucky. What is Honky Tonk music you may ask. Well its a mixture of country, rockabilly, blues, and bluegrass. I actually call my style of music "Kentucky Fried Tonk". I grew up in a very musical family. My grandpa was a Gene Autry disciple, my dad played bluegrass banjo, and I was lucky enough to be close friends with Bill Monroe and I spent most of my childhood backstage at the Grand Ole Opry. So, it's no wonder I have such a passion for American Roots music. 


                                  

I have been a hard working music artist ever since my teens and I am so blessed to still be doing it today. I stay busy with writing and performing as a musician as well as being an actor and comedian. You can see me currently in Chicago at the Mercury Theatre playing Young Johnny Cash in the hit show "Ring of Fire", which is a musical about Johnny Cash's life and his music. I also spent two years with the successful Broadway show Million Dollar Quartet in Chicago and the national tour. Aside from acting in theatre and film I spend the rest of my time making music and making people laugh. I am a stand up comedian and improviser, and that certainly spills over into my songwriting as you can tell if you're familiar with my music.  


The album "The Flag, the Bible, and Bill Monroe"

I have spent almost a year recording this album. Most of the recording has been in Chicago and mixing is being finished up by the legendary Alex Hall from Hi Style records who is a staple in the Chicago music scene. Mastering is going to be done by Independent Mastering in Nashville, who has worked on many award winning albums over the years. A lot of great musicians came together to record this including, Billy Bob Shaffer, Greg Hirte, Jesse Woelfel, Christy Miller, Tiffany Miller, Evan Dain, and Brian Wilke. 

                   

By contributing you will be launching a really great album that is choked full of great stories and emotions, some of them personally biographical for me. You may have heard me sing some of these songs live, or acoustically online, but now you will get to hear them with the full band anytime you want when you have your very own copy of the album. Here is the tentative list of the songs 

  • Tinkerbell Love Song
  • Wretched Woman
  • It Never Rains
  • The Flag the Bible and Bill Monroe
  • She was Mine
  • Concerts in my Underwear
  • I'm Just Country (revisited)
  • Maple Inn
  • Yay Friday
  • Let it Ride
  • If She Knew
  • Rosine I Cry
  • Drunk Again

Links to acoustic versions of some of the songs

It Never Rains

Tinkerbell Love Song

Wretched Woman

She Was Mine

Listen to my last album "Unbreakable Heart" on my website

MichaelMonroeGoodman.com

About the Funding

I am so grateful for the ability of music fans today to directly contribute to their favorite artist's music and that's why this campaign is so important to me. 

My last crowd funding campaign was successful and it helped launch my last album "Unbreakable Heart" which was loved by critics and fans. I anticipate this campaign being even better than the last one. I need at least 8,500 dollars to pay for the launch. All the money goes toward

  • Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Online distribution
  • CD manufacturing 
  • Album artwork 
  • Promotional materials

I am SO confident in this album, that any additional funds raised will go toward public representation. It cost money nowadays just to get your music heard by radio stations and reviewed my media outlets. I really hope to raise enough money to get my music introduced to millions of people who otherwise may never know what "Kentucky Fried Tonk" is. Any additional proceeds will go toward.

  • Public representation
  • Music Videos
  • promotional events
  • Marketing


You Are My Rock!

Without fans of great music, like yourself, no one would be making great music. Crowd funding is this beautiful new thing that keeps the power with the people. Through small individual support from the masses, someone like myself can continue to make music and be out there performing it for you in the real world. 

I greatly appreciate all of my fans (and future fans) who continue to push me to keep creating. From concert attendance, buying music and merchandise, to words of encouragement and praise, you keep me going. Thank you for being awesome.

  

Other Ways to Help

I know times can be hard and that's why I have made rewards for all budgets, but if you are still unable to contribute don't worry you still can help. You will be a huge part of this successful campaign by sharing this with as many people as you possibly can. Please copy and paste this campaign to your Social Media as much as possible. Email the link to everyone you know. If you like my music, most likely all your friends will too, so share it and keep authentic American Roots music ALIVE. 


Thank You and God Bless!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WIND ORCHESTRA KRŠKO / PIHALNI ORKESTER KRŠKO

In 2013 our orchestra had another concert, but at that time with a theme: movies. Since we wanted to make something different, the music was supported with scenes from movies. But we didn't stop there! We also made our own movies which have replaced the moderator. After the concert our conductor, Dejan Žnideršič, had an idea: in the future, we have to make a concert with music from cartoons.

Since then, the idea has developed to music from Disney cartoons only. Today this is not only a concert but an experience that every person should have.

The main concert will be on November 28th 2015 at the Cultural home Krško.


CREATING MAGICAL WORLD

The Lobby of the Cultural Home Krško will be transformed to a magical world. Our goal is to create a world where our visitor will go through the forrest, past a stream to the land of snow and more.

With the collaboration with local theatre group and dancing club we will be able to create magic.


THE CONCERT OF WIND ORCHESTRA KRŠKO

We will play the music from Disney cartoon movies. But again we have to do something special. When the music is played we have to make special effects. And since Disney is magic there are other effects to be made: rain, snow, fog, special lightening, moving star and other visual effect.


We know this project is very ambitious. But we are a big orchestra with more than 70 members, with other societies to support us. And our team has made special projects in the past.


ADDITIONAL CONCERTS FOR PRIMARY SCHOOLS

Because this is very big project, we believe we shouldn't make only one concert on Saturday. That is why we have already contacted local primary schools and offered them to be a part of additional concerts that we'll make only for them during the school.
Since this is a great experience for children, we are to believe they shouldn't pay for our costs and performence.


WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?

If you decide to fund our project you will be help us with:

-  Promotion: 2.600,00 €
-  Administration, material costs and web site: 1.425,00 €
-  Renting Cultural home and their technical support: 3.400,00 €
-  Copyright fee: 1.000,00 €
-  Scene and other props: 5.450,00 €
-  Costumes: 3.335,51 €
-  Salaries costs (conductors, mentors, directors, producers, invited societies, imitators, moderators fee): about 15.000 €
There are also some expenses for food and drinks for all of our members and members of invited societies.
Members of our orchestra will do in-kind-of contribution for over 20.000 €.

Until now we have raised a little more than 5.000 € with sponsorships, but with todays economy it is hard to raise the money! Our local commune will also help us with some funds, that are less than 2.000 €.

Even though we charge entrance fee, we will not be able to pay all the expenses. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP! So we can organize this great concert for everybody who wants to experience a little bit of magic!


ABOUT WIND ORCHESTRA KRŠKO

Wind orchestra Krsko is one of best amateur orchestras in Slovenia for the last 20 years; since 1991 we are a part of the highest category of competition nationally, in 1994 we received a silver plaquette at the international competition in Valencia (Spain) and a golden plaquette in 1997 at the most pronounced international competition in Kerkrade, Netherland. We have recorded 4 CDs and 1 DVD. Since 2004 the conductor of our orchestra is Dejan Žnideršič.Today we are an orchestra with 67 members.

Please go to our youtube page and listen to what we have created so far or look at our Facebook page and go through our pictures and events.


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

You can help us with your donation! Select a perk that you like or make your own donation.

If you can not help us with the donation, please share the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or Google+ account.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR DONATION!

story:
The idea:

This is the most important period since the formation of the band. Last year we had the opportunity to perform in 38 cities, as part of a giant tour lasting 45 days, travelling all around Europe, whilst we released our 2nd album with the title "Skein Syndrome" (through ViciSolum Productions). In order to take advantage of the very good momentum and to keep building the relationship with all the people who have accepted and embraced us, we're planning to hit the road again, this time for 16 days in 15 cities performing in several European countries, as the support band of the progressive death metal band Persefone.

More precisely the schedule looks like this:

Spain 07/4: ES - Barcelona, Razzmatazz 

Spain 08/4: ES - Madrid, Changó

Spain 09/4: ES - Murcia, Garaje

Italy 11/4: IT - Milano, Barrio's Cafe

Germany 12/4: DE - München, Backstage

Switzerland 13/4: CH - Pratteln, Z-7

France 14/4: FR - Paris, La Boule Noire

France 15/4: FR - Nantes, Le Ferrailleur

UK 16/4: UK - London, Underworld Camden

Germany 17/4: DE - Essen, Turock

Holland 18/4: NL - Hoofddorp, Podium Duycker

Holland 19/4: NL - Nijmegen, Merleyn

Germany 20/4: DE - Hamburg, Markthalle

Denmark 21/4: DK - Copenhagen, Forbrændingen

Sweden 22/4: SE - Stockholm, Kraken Sthlm

 The money we receive will be used for:

  • Plane tickets, safe gear transportation and gear rental
  • Tour bus and engineers cost
  • T-shirts and merchandise material in general

About the rewards: 

We have focused our attention on delivering the best and most efficient perks possible. Some of them are regular, some others are incredibly limited, so choose wisely! 

Please keep in mind that once you get a reward, you will get access to a private mailing list and you'll have the opportunity to be informed first hand about the preparations before the tour, the funny moments on the stage, the backstage stories and "the after tour feelings" through videos and photos!

Also, if your reward is t-shirts or zip hoodies, you will be asked your size once we contact you to confirm your address and info.

Please feel free to contribute as much as you wish, despite the offered perks!

story:
Welcome!

Hi, my name is Eli.

I am starting a permaculture studio, which is a place to explore sustainable design and share those ideas online.

I have been researching permaculture and growing gardens since 2002. I am interested in a wide array of sustainable living strategies from growing food to building with the earth.

I have recently moved onto a 20 acre ranch in the beautiful high desert of northern New Mexico.

This is an opportunity to create something I've always wanted to create. A place that explores natural systems while also sharing online with video and feedback.

It will integrate the best of traditional systems with technology in a way that is efficient and selective.

Why a “studio” instead of a “farm”?

Blue Beetle is a place for small scale exploration on a family or individual scale. Rather then producing large amounts of one crop, I will produce modest amounts of many crops with a focus on nutrition.

Crops with a high amino acid profile are of particular interest, including amaranth, quinoa, chia seed and goji berries.

Stage I

This campaign represents Stage I, or the beginning of Blue Beetle Studio. This year I will be focusing on plant acquisition, and the establishment of a number of hardy shrubs and trees.

Once established, they can then been multiplied both for additional plantings around the property and also to share with local gardeners.

Plant Species to be planted this year include:

Honeyberry, Bur Oak, Honey Locust, Elderberry,  Mulberry, Raspberry, Sea Buckthorn, Nanking Cherry, Siberian Pea Shrub, Asparagus,  Arctic Kiwi, Goji Berry, Serviceberry, Hazelnut, Apple, Asian Pear, Grapes and more..

Annual food crops will also be an important component to food production.

In 2015 I will be experimenting with grains like quinoa and amaranth, as well as a number of tender vegetables(tomato, cucumber) and herbs.

Stage II

With plant systems established I will look to incorporating chickens and other components that will flesh out the system.

This stage will see a turn towards earth building and other DIY projects including water filtration(slow sand filter), passive solar heating and other practical skills.

There may be opportunities to bring in other members at this point and form a small community working towards a common goal of exploring and sharing online.

Stage III

The final stage, stage III represents a more complete system in which sub systems are combined and a sustainable lifestyle is demonstrated.  Classes can be held online live by webcam for interested teachers and students.

Your help is integral to getting Blue Beetle off the ground

Your contribution will help me with necessary gardening equipment (including irrigation, tools, fencing, etc.), the purchase of trees and shrubs(I also have many started from seed) and the filming, editing, production and shipping of the DVD.

For contributors of $25 or more, I am producing a DVD at the end of the growing season. This DVD will document events during the season and it will include instructional videos on the following topics:

vermicomposting/worm bin construction, worm tea brewing, mushroom cultivation, seed stratification, propagation by cuttings

Contributors of $50 or more will get both the DVD and access to an exclusive animal video(at least 1-hour long) which will include birds, insects and other critters that show up during the growing season.

If you contribute $100 or more you will get all of the lower perks plus I will send you a custom seed collection of both annuals and perennials of at least 10 varieties which are suitable for your growing zone.

Contributors of $500 or more are true believers in the future of Blue Beetle Studio so for this price you will receive every DVD or video that is produced at Blue Beetle from now into the future, in addition to all of the lower perks.

Contributors of $1000 or more receive all of the above plus I will dedicate a guild of plants in your name and create a monument declaring it so. You will also go onto the list of founders for Blue Beetle Studio, and will be listed on all video productions as such.

And finally, with a contribution of $5000 or more you will become a partner and have input into Blue Beetle's development(plus receive all lower perks). You will also receive an all-expenses paid trip to visit the studio here in Taos, New Mexico. This perk will be available during Stage II or Stage III of the project.  You will be flown into Albuquerque and I will provide all transportation and food/lodging during your stay, which will be approximately 2-4 days.

Exceed Goal?

Should I exceed my goal for this campaign, I will use the money to build a greenhouse, upgrade my camera and save for Stage II building projects.

I would also like to have annual plant giveaways to local gardeners(sponsored by you)..  This would be a chance to spread useful plants throughout the local area. I will record "thank you" videos from them and share with you, the sponsors.

Blog

My online blog is documenting daily events including seed stratification and germination, planting, weather and insect events.

This is available for everyone thanks to your help.

Thank you!

Thank you so much for your support! Please share this campaign.

Stay tuned for an exciting 2015!

story:
THE SCOOP - click here to download our 1st single "Winds of Change" 

Hi everyone! Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign. Producing an alternative rock album has significant costs. Some of the costs are studio time, musicians, mixing, mastering, album artwork, CD production, and guess what…you guys are our record deal! 

Our 1st album "Masquerade" was a blast to create. This time around we have an all-star cast of musicians and technicians who have excitedly worked with us to finish this rocking alternative 10 song body of work, “Closer to Red.”

HEART OF THE MUSIC​ - FREE DOWNLOAD OF "WINDS OF CHANGE"

  • Jennifer Kaiser (Masquerade)- co-producer, singer, songwriter, finger picking and rhythm guitar, piano
  • Fernando Perdomo (Jakob Dylan & Dreaming in Stereo)-co-producer, bass, lead guitar
  • Durga McBroom (Pink Floyd)-Back up vocals
  •  David Goodstein (Nil Lara & Jackson Browne)-drums
  • George Chavles (the DI’s and the Red Devils)- guitar
  • Dave Schulz (the Goo Goo Dolls & Berlin)- Keys
  • Emmanuel Canete (Velocity Gospel)- Keys, quirky sounds, co-creator of the sound blueprint
  • Ozzy Carmona- mixing/mastering
  • Zach Ziskin- mixing/mastering
  • Matt Kramer (Saigon Kick)- Vocal coach extraordinaire 
  • Dina Six- Campaign video edit, "Don't Hide" video, random videography, and "Perks" cameo ;)
  • Jo Blanco- Campaign Videography 

Those are all of the musicians, engineers, and videographers whom I am humbled to work with on bringing “Closer to Red” to life. We are almost at the finish line, and WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Please check out our list of "Perks" here on the right, where you can pre-purchase the album, buy t-shirts, and view many other donate options. We have 60 days to reach our goal. Once we have reached it, all additional funds received will go towards the costs of video production, touring, marketing, and pre-production of album #3!!!

We all thank you for putting us to work doing what we do best with our God given talents, and we can't wait to bring you the finished album!

SHARING IS CARING :)

If you are unable to make a financial contribution but really dig our vibe, then you can TOTALLY  help us by simply sharing this campaign! To show our appreciation for your sharing and support, as a gift, please click here to download "Winds of Change," our very first completed song off of "Closer to Red"!

T-SHIRTS AVAILABLE - SEE PERKS

 

I would like to give a special thank you to a few individuals whom without their hard work this campaign would not have been possible. Thank you Adi Mo, Dina Six, and Jo Blanco for whipping together this campaign on a dime. John Loftus, Mom, and my close friends and family for your never ending love and support.

story:
Summary!

Hello!

My name is Joshua Romatowski and I am gearing up to collaborate with some of North America’s top Baroque specialists to create a wonderful recording of six flute sonatas by Swedish composer Johan Helmich Roman.

These rarely recorded and performed pieces are full of character and provide a unique experience for listeners.  Johan Helmich Roman was coined the “Swedish Handel” and brings a multitude of unique and dazzling sounds and ideas to the fore. 

Preparing these pieces has been an exquisite experience, and I dream of being able to share my work with everyone I know!

As my first recording project, I am excited to pour all of my energy into this and to make sure that it is well done.  That is why I have worked to find the best and most experienced people to help me make this project a reality.

Joshua Romatowski, Baroque Flute

Byron Schenkman, Harpsichord

Nathan Whittaker, Baroque Cello

What We Need

I am going to need a total of $7600 to make this project happen.  Here is a breakdown of the costs!

$2000 – Artist Fees

$1500 – Engineer/Producer Fee

$2500 – Transportation

$300 – Hall Rental

$300 – Harpsichord Rental/Tuning

$600 – Food

$400 – Lodging

If I do not reach my entire goal, funding will first go to for the artists and engineer.  I am also planning to contribute a substantial amount of money to the project to make sure everyone gets the payment and experience they deserve!

The Impact

Swedish Baroque music is a unique experience.  As baroque music listeners, people are very much accustomed to hearing the magnificent works of J.S. Bach, Handel, Vivaldi, and Telemann.  What is unique about Johan Helmich Roman is that his style of composition is not entirely German, Italian, or French but a pleasant blend of all three, with his own unique personality thrown into the mix.

I find that music from Sweden is very much under-represented in modern day performance spaces.  I hope to use this project as a way to inject this music back into the repertoire of performing artists and to bring its beauty and uniqueness to the countless number of aspiring performers appearing on the scene.  On top of that I find that audiences really enjoy these pieces, which makes it all the more relevant.

Challenges

The challenges of this project are numerous.  As modern day classical musicians, we have a responsibility to these composers to make their music come alive.  That being said, baroque composers left a lot of opportunity within their compositions for performers to be unique and bring a lot of their personality to the table.  Making sure to present a well balanced performance of these pieces is key.  I have worked to make sure that everyone working on this project is of the highest professional quality, which makes a lot of this easier to accomplish.  Everyone involved in this project has had top of the line training and extensive professional experience in this type of music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount of assistance is greatly appreciated!  Please send this out to anyone you think will find it interesting!

The
Impact
Swedish Baroque music is a unique
experience.  As baroque music listeners,
people are very much accustomed to hearing the magnificent works of J.S. Bach,
Handel, Vivaldi, and Telemann.  What is
unique about Johan Helmich Roman is that his style of composition is not
entirely German, Italian, or French but a pleasant blend of all three, with his
own unique personality thrown into the mix.
I find that music from Sweden is
very much under-represented in modern day performance spaces.  I hope to use this project as a way to inject
this music back into the repertoire of performing artists and to bring its
beauty and uniqueness to the countless number of aspiring performers appearing
on the scene.  On top of that I find that
audiences really enjoy these pieces, which makes it all the more relevant.
Challenges
The challenges of this project are
numerous.  As modern day classical
musicians, we have a responsibility to these composers to make their music come
alive.  That being said, baroque
composers left a lot of opportunity within their compositions for performers to
be unique and bring a lot of their personality to the table.  Making sure to present a well balanced
performance of these pieces is key.  I
have worked to make sure that everyone working on this project is of the
highest professional quality, which makes a lot of this easier to
accomplish.  Everyone involved in this
project has had top of the line training and extensive professional experience
in this type of music.
